Reviews.Title: Great TV with 2-Year Warranty?
Reviews.Author: E. Madrid "Abinadi"
Reviews.Content: I picked up the newer 40" TV for $379.99, was looking for a nice, but inexpensive TV for my daughter, she just bought her 1st home and was wanting a TV to match her new place. So, for a house warming gift I picked up a wall mount and this TV, was worried it might not be good quality product, but with all the 1000+ reviews on the last model equaling 4+ stars, I decided to take the chance. It's been in for a day now and is working great. 10 Stars for Amazon, I ordered this TV on Wednesday night at 8:00pm and used my $3.99 next-day upgrade to get it here by Friday... WOW, it shows up at 10:00am Thursday morning!!! 14 hours later. I live in a rural area, were next-day is near impossible, much less an after 5:00pm order showing up the next day. Thank You Amazon!

Reviews.Title: If I could leave ZERO stars, I would.
Reviews.Author: Elyse M. Kopietz "Elyse"
Reviews.Content: I feel like I am being punked, just without Ashton Kutcher. I ordered this tv for my husband for Christmas and had next day shipped. It didn't turn on.Amazon customer service kindly sent a new one, to be next day shipped so it would be there in two days.It arrived. And...you guessed it! IT DIDN'T TURN ON!!Let's add it up: one broken 40"+one broken 40"=no Christmas present.The good side (because there always should be a good side!) is that Amazon Customer Service is fantastic, and they took care of it. I'm happy to continue spending my money with Amazon but definitely will be purchasing a different tv!

Reviews.Title: DOA-only Blue Light
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Item arrived with packaging in good shape.  Plugged in- got blue light.  Pressed remote on- nothing.  Put in known good batteries- still no joy.  Panel power switch no help. Tried another power outlet to no avail.Too bad- specs are great- physical looks are good- price was good.  Just wished it worked.  Glad it was bought at Amazon with their great returns system.

Reviews.Title: Have Now Sent Back Two of These
Reviews.Author: JB
Reviews.Content: The phrase "you get what you pay for" really rang true with what I thought was a bargain deal on this television. Once I set up the TV I turned it on only to discover a red spot on the screen, what I later learned to be dead pixels. Amazon graciously offered to send me a replacement, so I packed up the original and sent it back only to receive a TV that showed up in a previously torn and poorly-patched box. The replacement worked great for just a couple of days before completely shorting out and showing nothing but a live black screen when it turned on. Couldn't even get the menu screen to load. I'm packing this one up and returning it, but will not be trying a third. I would not recommend this TV to anyone unless they're willing to go through several gambles of getting a working set.

Reviews.Title: Bang for the buck TV! and how i went from 1/5 to 5/5.
Reviews.Author: ktmck
Reviews.Content: 12/29/11I've been a holdout on getting a HDtv. I'm a bit of a techie yet I am not an early adopter, more like a very late adopter. I make a point to never pay full price if I can help it. I think I'm pretty adept at being able to hound out a good deal. MIGHT have found it in this tv.First heard about this tv through a tech savvy friend. He bought it for $260 had it shipped overnight. He is very satisfied with the tv and thought it a great deal for the money, as good/better as other $500 to 600 dollar tvs.After reading ALL of the customer reviews, I felt that this might be the tv for me: bang for the buck. When it became available again I ordered one on Tuesday 12/27/11, went with the free shipping option, and recieved it today 12/29/11. Pretty fast shipping.The customer reviews stating the tv was DOA and did not power on irked me a little before I ordered, but Amazon has a pretty fair return/refund policy, and it comes with a two year warranty, no worries right? Unboxed, set up, and plugged in later in the afternoon. Wouldn't you know it, the tv was DOA. Wouldn't power on.I went throught the Amazon return/refund process online, boxed it back up, and UPS will pick it up in the morning, and hopefully I'll recieve a replacement in the next few days. HOPEFULLY ONE THAT WORKS. Fingers crossed.The tv not working might have something to do with the tv being upside down in the back of the UPS truck, box looks beat to hell, and three out of the four styro packing blocks at the corners (top and bottom) were broken or cracked, and the corners of the box indicate how that may have happened.I was looking forward to watching some movies and playing some xbox this weekend. damn it.I will follow up on this review and update as the situation develops.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------12/30/11 1:44P UPDATEEven though I went through the return/refund process yesterday afternoon, UPS picked it up today about an hour ago and provided the return shipping label as well, didn't have to print anything, and I left the original shipping statement unopened on the box.UPS guy took one look at the box and said "oh, wow. they're sending you another one right?"Which they are. It shipped out this morning at 8am. I am more than satisfied with the turn around and ease of use of Amazon in this matter. All in all I have to say that their return/refund process is fairly painfree. Other than having to box it back up, but that only took a few minutes. If it ships out similar to the first one, more than likely I'll receive the next one tomorrow afternoon sometime.I remember reading a customer review for this tv where he had recieved two DOA tvs back to back from Amazon.....I am not overly perturbed by this. Amazon or UPS is the one footing the bill to ship around broken tv's.It comes with a two year warranty as well, not too worried about it.The tv out of the box looked exactly as advertised with the correct amount and types of hookups.The glass base is nice and attached simply and easily and has a nice heft to it.It looks like a really decent tv, the form does fit the function.A thought/opinion about the quality of this tv: I havn't seen it in operation yet but the outward appearance of it seems like any other normal tv. It's not an objet d'art, nor is it meant to be, yet it will suit my workaday aesthetic just fine. Besides, i think the upper price ranged tvs look a little gaudy and pretentious anyways. This tv is more in keeping with my small apartment and budget.Talking about how 'pretty' a tv is reminds me of the fancy wood cabinet floor model tv we had when I was a kid.If your worried about that with a tv like this for this little money then you may want to rethink having champagne tastes and a beer budget.Let's get over ourselves ok?My experience so far: some light reading shopping around, order tv, recieve a broken tv, return/refund process, UPS picks up broken tv.The heavy lifting I've done so far: nil. well, except for unboxing and reboxing, meh.Total time invested: a few hours. ON MY BUTT. CRUISING THE INTERWEBS.Just have to put a little trust in Amazon, my own judgement, the other customer reviews, and the process.If I don't like the working tv I eventually will recieve, then I will return it for a refund.I might yet get a nice bang for the buck tv. I'll keep ya posted.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------12/31/11I recieved the replacement tv around noon today. Just unboxed and setup and it's up and working. Will spend the weekend checking it out and putting it through it's paces. So far so good. Xbox 360 and Netflix look great. Will follow up with a more complete review after the weekend.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------01/24/12Finally updating my review. What else can I say that hasn't been covered more in depth in other reviews? I'll just keep it short and sweet.I don't have a Bluray player, or surround sound, YET. I have basic cable which looks exactly like it should via the S-video connection. I hooked up the old bunny ear antenna I had laying around to get my local HD channels via the coax connection. As stated earlier Xbox games and Netflix, which make up 2/3 of the use of this TV, look great through HDMI connection.  I think the sound from the TV is really good. I do switch over to the antenna connection though when watching football as the picture from the over the air HD looks way better than watching with cable. I think the remote is really good, only took a day or two to get used to, the menus are simple and easy to navigate, and the options are plentiful enough.Anyone concerned about the  warranty, DOA, the hassle of a return, should not be, those issues have been explored in other customer reviews. I would have bought another one if I'd had a place to put it. You get exactly what you should in a TV at this price, and then some. Regardless of the initial DOA issue caused by, in my opinion, shipping damage, Amazon's ease of use, my virtually pain free return experience, and the quality of the TV, I AM ADJUSTING MY REVIEW TO A 5/5. I am WHOLLY satisfied with this TV.

Reviews.Title: The GOOD, The BAD, The UGLY.
Reviews.Author: joe@truevalue
Reviews.Content: The Good "I purchase from AMAZON"The Bad "TCL 40 Inch Television"The Ugly "TCL Service Dept."TCL L40FHDF12TA 40-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LCD HDTV with 2-Year WarrantyLike everyone else I was sold by the positive reviews. Amazon shipped fast and it washanging on the wall in a couple of days. Worked great for 5 days! On Saturday started todevelope white lines. Called customer service on Saturday. CLOSED! Called on Monday fromwork to get some ideas on things to try. Needed model number and serial number. After workgot home called back gave afore mentioned information. Only prelim to register television.Had to call another 1-800-NUMBER. They are in California and I had 15 minutes before theyclosed for the day. 1st call cut off after 5 minutes. 2nd call cut off after 5 minutes. 3rdcall cut off after 5 minutes. 4th call "Sorry we are now closed." So Tuesday called fromwork early, got a real person, said I would need to e-mail pictures of what the TV lookedlike when it had white lines. So Tuesday night I took pictures and e-mail to real person online along with a phone number and e-mail address to contact me. Wednesday call again. Put on holdafter 5 minutes cut off. 2nd call person answers ask me to hold. 5 minutes later I'm cut off.3rd call person answers, at first was not sure if they got my e-mails, YES they did get mye-mails, they will have a technician look at them, I will probably have to send it in for repairs, willcontact me. Repairs could take 2 weeks. So I waited Wednesday night and Thursday for a callor and e-mail. ZERO, ZIP, NADA. On Friday I got a return authorizationfrom AMAZON to return it to them.By Friday afternoon televison no longer has white lines, it has NO PICTURE AT ALL!!!!Boxed it up over the weekend, UPS picked it up Monday, AMAZON had it by Thursday late,and I have recieved a FULL REFUND. As I write this on Friday morning I stillhave recieved NOTHING from TCL Customer Service a week and half later.If you decide to buy, don't waste your time with one of these sets.

Reviews.Title: Bad TCL support
Reviews.Author: Random Reviewer
Reviews.Content: My TV came with missing screws. I contacted TCL support to see if they can send me the missing screws. I was told to call a second number with a case number, but the people at the second number haven't picked up.Edit:If someone can tell me the screws needed for the TV, I could just buy them at a hardware store, but this information seems to be impossible to find.

Reviews.Title: TCL 40 LCD TV a GREAT BUY!!!!
Reviews.Author: Ronald Scott
Reviews.Content: I bought the TCL 40" LCD due to the low price - $319.99.  It really seemed almost too good to be true.  I just wish I had bought it a few days earlier when it was $299.99 during a sale on Amazon.  Ordered the TV on New Year's Eve and received it on 1/4/12...great delivery considering I took advantage of the Super Saver free shipping!  I read some reviews of DOA units and other problems.  Thus far (1 day) we have had no problems.  We bought this TV to use in our bedroom with a HD Dish Receiver.  It was very easy to hook up with the HDMI (3 are included) and has a picture that I would judge to be SUPERB!!  In fact, I was shocked at what a great picture it has.  Right now we are just using the TV for sound and it is very good for such an inexpensive set.  We have a surround sound system which I will probably hook up with this but, quite frankly, if all you are going to do is watch regular TV, the sound is fine.  I want the surround in case we were to watch a movie late at night or music channel.  We have another 65" TV (different brand) in the Family Room for movies, etc with Surround Sound: so this is not a real big factor for us on this TV in the bedroom.  I did take advantage of some other folks notes to use the RCA codes for setting up the Dish Remote to operate the TV.  For me code 503 worked great.  The remote that comes with the TV is pretty basic but gets the job done fine.  But hey, for the $'s saved you can go buy a nice Harmony remote with all the whistles and buzzers and still have $'s left over versus buying more expensive name brand set.  Bottom line, this is a GREAT TV for the price; GREAT picture; Adequate Sound quality; easy to set up.  And Amazon is the GREATEST place to buy.  Great Price and Great Return policy.  Thank You Amazon!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent once you set it to "No Overscan".
Reviews.Author: M.Young
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about shipping damage, given recent news about rough handling during shipping. The package arrived in good condition. No dead pixel, great picture. I tested all ports I am going to use; all worked.To my surprise, when I connected my PC via HDMI, the screen was cropped and the characters were not clear. I finally discovered that there was a zoom setting in REMOTE CONTROL. It defaults to "normal", but "normal" is bad. After I set it to "No Overscan", it's perfect as a compute monitor at 1920x1080.I also set audio EQ to personal as suggested by previous reviewer ( turn 100Hz to 90%, 500Hz to 60%, and 10K 70% ), boosting low and high frequency. It sounds a lot better to me.I also changed picture 'Sharpness' to 0 and 'noise reduction' to 'low' to minimize image processing.Overall, it has excellent picture and good sound, but needs some default setting change.

Reviews.Title: An Excellent TV & Awesome Deal
Reviews.Author: A. Fincher
Reviews.Content: I ordered the TCL L40FHDF12TA on December 22nd, and was set to receive it on December 27th. To my surprise I got a call from UPS today, December 24th (Christmas Eve) and got to go pick it up. Everything so far has been great! The picture is excellent, and the audio sounds great as well. So far I have only tested it on my PS3 using HDMI, but it has worked flawlessly.I am extremely happy, and cannot be more thankful for such a great deal. I have yet to update the firmware via USB, but may do so in a few days if needed. Many thanks to Amazon and TCL. This is one of my first Amazon reviews so I will definitely update it soon with more detailed information. I mainly just wanted to share my experience so far :)

Reviews.Title: The Newest Model of the TCL 40" LCD
Reviews.Author: Trent "AnDaLe!"
Reviews.Content: Be advised, this is a brand new model for the 40" TCL.  The last model has over 1000 reviews and an overall rating of 4+ stars.  I went with this new model thinking newer is always better.  I was right, this new model is great, a black piano finish and a very clean, stylish, and minimal-style base made of plate glass.  Be advised there is no tilt option, but you can always shim the base to adjust for your needs, or wall-mount the unit.  It appears some "internet-challenged" have already placed reviews here for the older model by mistake.  This model only became available the FALL of 2011, my guess is October.I bought this for my sister's birthday, and only set it up tonight, but I am amazed with the quality.  Additionally, DirectTV had the remote codes, which was a huge negative with the previous model, with people upset that they could not set up the TV on an alternate remote.  TCL codes, not RCA codes.  Both probably work, but at least DTV is on the ball and providing codes for the latest equipment.  The model number was not exact, but the codes work 100%, all I did was select the 40" model codes.Picture is great right out of the box, no adjustments at all.  All I did was select the "home" setting.  All colors, including flesh-tones, were perfect.  Sound right out of the TV, which usually sucks, was pretty good.  My sis has no home-theater system, but I may get her a sound bar to add some uummph.Anyway, at $380 delivered, for now, this is an amazing 40" 1080p TV!!!  I wish I could swap my 40" Toshiba for it!!!  This has a better pic than my 1080i Toshiba that I payed $600 for!!  This model is 1080i/1080p.Time will tell, and if I hit a bump in the road, I will update.  My advice is to go for it!!UPDATE:  Two years later, and now with 2 of these, they are still going strong.  What a deal!!

Reviews.Title: Lemon - An accident?
Reviews.Author: Dinko Perkovic "dinko"
Reviews.Content: Despite high number of negative reviews for this set being DOA, price was much too tempting for a 40" LCD TV - majority of reviews are still positive. 2 years warranty is longer than typical and I trust Amazon for "customer friendly policies" - while I hopped that I won't have to test any of it. Alas, after unpacking it, mounting the foot, installing everything, looking with pride new addition to my bedroom, I found out that antenna input does not work. So, it goes back for replacement; I hope (this time) second is the charm. Now, thumbs up for Amazon but what is wrong with TCL? Cheap product still suppose to work, but, based on product reviews and my personal experience this is a total lack of quality control on a product that does not appear to be manufactured on high standards.I am going for replacement, yet this time I keep my fingers crossed - returning a product is not a convenient process and I hate to go there.I'd like to add couple of words about my first general impressions on this TV for potential buyers, though. If the replacement set works right I plan on re-visiting this review. Overall design dates several years back - my wife dislikes aluminum line in front as a design element; matter of taste. I don't care for ultra thin TV set or frame around the screen; quality of picture is what counts. I didn't put it on a weight scale but my impression is that this TV set may be lighter than average 40" set; I'd feel comfortable hanging it on a wall - not alone, though. Picture quality has few pre-sets and manual adjustment; blu-ray disk looked great on HDMI input after just a little bit of tweaking. Brightness is high for well illuminated environment - very positive; price is paid in electricity but this TV set is still not too hungry (according to energy rating label). Remote is very basic; it does the job but I'd like to have direct choice of input signal input on remote.Conclusion: Basic set well worth the price, under condition that you get one which works right out the box. Keep fingers crossed.UPDATE:After getting the replacement set and months later, this TV works. At the price asked now, this is far from being a bargain, though. Price aside, this TV can compete in picture quality with others. It appears that LCD/LED screen went up in price lately, but that not justifies difference in price what I paid for this set and asking price now. In short, for taking chances with this brand, one would expect a better deal.UPDATE Feb. 22 2013:I changed my rating from 1 star to 3. With Amazon return policy and 2 years warranty (I hope I won't have to test TCL tech support) this looks like a decent deal at today's 323. LED TV sets promise longer life and these would be my first choice now; price is what defines good deal. My rating reflects my whole experience with this set, including return.

Reviews.Title: Nothing...but only a little blue LED
Reviews.Author: shatonymouse
Reviews.Content: So happy when I was buying this TV. But so unhappy when I received it today. I just unboxed the TV, but after plugged it in, there was only a little blue LED in the bottom on left corner. I tried all the ways but just cannot turn on it!! So disappointed in this Chrismas holidays. But after reviewing other comments, it seems that this is a common defect since others have had the DOA issue as well. I also begin to believe that they may just send me a TV that others just returned. Anyway, good thing is the convenience of the Amazon return policy, so give them one more opportunity, I replace it so see if it will work properly when I receive the new one.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value for money
Reviews.Author: M. Wise
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for a week now, so I thought it was time to do a review. I've used it to watch DVDs, use as a computer monitor, and played with a Wii.Pros:- Value, value, value. I originally paid $320 but got it adjusted to the latest $300 price after it dropped. That is just a great deal.- No dead pixels- Dead simple interface with simple menus where everything responds quickly. No menu lag, complicated options, internet gadgets, or indecipherable menu structures that I've seen on some very expensive "Internet TVs." Input selection menu can be customized to be very short and annotated with the devices actually connected. Inputs switch quickly.- Surprising amount of video/picture adjustment options - and you can have separate settings for each input.- Looks like it costs more than it does. Great, sturdy, GLASS base. Clean, simple, and elegant design.- Great input selection for price range. 3x HDMI, 2x component, VGA, 2x composite video, even an S-video input, which are long gone on most TVs now.Cons:- Backlighting could be more even - mine is a little brighter in the upper right hand corner. Not noticeable unless you're staring at a completely black screen.- Relatively thick for an LCD, especially compared to newer LED TVs- Some motion blur is visible if you're using it for high contrast, high motion applications (e.g., as a computer monitor or in highly contrasted video games). I've only actually noticed blur when moving the (dark) Wii pointer on a totally white screen and in the scrolling scoreboards (which are dark gray scrolling against white) on Wii Fit. Not problematic or even noticeable in actual video game playing. No undesirable blur noticeable on movies or TV sources.- Average TV speakers. I have an older component system I use for sound.- Remote control has stiff buttons. This may improve with use.Have not evaluated:- Warranty. Complaints can be read here - hopefully they're isolated.- Over-the-air TV reception - I don't live in an area with great reception anyway and don't have an antenna to really do a proper evaluation. On the one channel I can get, it looks fine.If you're looking for a simple TV or monitor for DVD/game system/video streaming, it's hard to go wrong with this size, which will accommodate a lot of different room sizes. I wouldn't want anything bigger than this for the smallish living room I have. This is also one of the largest size TVs you can get shipped via normal carriers that also will fit into most cars for transport.

Reviews.Title: Best TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: Steven W.
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV on 12/27/11 for $300 and its one of the best TV's I've ever owned. Picture quality is excellent and there are a multitude of input options. The sound is weak like others have said but is not an issue if you have a home theater to hook up to the TV. I bought this TV together with Sony BDVE280 3D Blu-ray Disc Home Theater System for about $500 and the combination of picture quality and sound is great.Pros: Best Value TV out there. $300 for a 40in 1080p LCD is an absolutely ridiculous price. Get in on it while you can. $320 still isn't bad.  Love the Glass TV stand. It makes the TV look more expensive than it is.Cons: Only RCA and Coaxial SPDIF out. NO Optical audio. Weak built in speakers.This TV is the best bargain on Amazon right now and I highly suggest you buy it while it's this cheap.If anyone is interested in calibrating their TV, the settings I have that look best to me are:Brightness: 50Contrast: 65Sharpness: 8Backlight: 36Color: 44Light Sensor OFF, Dynamic Backlight OFF, SABC OFF

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV for price
Reviews.Author: denverdave
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for $319.99 on Dec 18th received by Fed Ex on Dec 21st. The package was not torn up at all and I opened it up and the picture was perfect right out of the box, with no dead pixels. I am happy with the sounds as it is in my bedroom most of the time I don't even turn the sound up past 10 and I can hear it loud and clear. I saw the tv go on sale the 23rd for $259.99 and upset I didn't wait for it but I was happy with getting a 40" LCD for $320! Amazon does not give you a refund on gold box items but today I saw the tv go down to $299 so they did issue me a $20 refund. I highly recommend this tv for $299.99 if you are wanting to use it in your bedroom or a kids room.

Reviews.Title: This TV Rocks!!!!
Reviews.Author: John A. Williams "viper"
Reviews.Content: I paid $250.00 Bucks for this TV, and it is fantastic!!! The picture is razor sharp, the colors are very nice. The TV is very simple, but does an amazing job. You need to realize that this TV is for one purpose only. Watching TV or Blu-rays. Think about it. I bought this TV for $250.00, plus a $60.00 LG blu-ray player (it has apps), a Ruku box for my amazon prime, plus 3 amazon HDMI Cables all for $420.00 bucks!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! OMG please go find a setup up like that for that kind of money!!!! You wont!!! The reason i can say that the TV looks so good is i have another high end Sharp LED TV http://www.amazon.com/Sharp-LC40LE830U-Quattron-40-inch-LED-LCD/dp/B004NP1E9E/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid;=1324875913&sr;=8-1I put these two side by side and they look the same from a distance. I can find things to nit pick about, but you have to understand that you are comparing a $950.00 TV to a $250.00 TV. I feel like a complete idiot to have spend that much!!! I could have bought almost 4 TVs for the same price!!!!!! Once thing that I had found out that was very interesting in that the company that makes these TV's, TCL uses Samsung panels and internals!!!!! The company TCL also, makes and rebrands their TV's for RCA. So you get an off brand name that at the heart of it has Samsung internals.People its very simple. This TV rocks for the kind of money you pay for it. If it makes you feel better to spend $2000 - 3000.00 for something that you can brag about because it is a brand name, go ahead. But for the rest of us in the real world, its nice to be able to get something for a lot less and make life a little bit better.I hope this helps!!!! I will upload some pictures for you guys!

Reviews.Title: Can't beat the price for the quality
Reviews.Author: Omar
Reviews.Content: Well-built TV, 40" and full HD at 1080p at a very low price is a sweet deal.I would recommend messing with the picture settings to your liking.The TV has a Samsung panel and the audio is good enough for a decently sized living room.  It's not tinny or anything but don't expect surround sound.One complaint I have is the picture settings sometimes change automatically, and one of the two TV's I bought has flashlighting in the corners, but it's not too noticeable, I just like to pay attention to detail.Warranty is two years on this TV, more than any other manufacturer I've seen unless it's a TV purchased from Costco.I recommend purchasing an extended warranty from Costco by Squaretrade simply because coverage begins after the manufacturers warranty totaling this TV at 5 years for $29.99.  The TV does not have to be purchased from Costco either.  In contrast, if you buy directly from Squaretrade, the warranty begins immediately on the TV's date of purchase.Here is the link to the Squaretrade warranty from Costco:[...]This is the fine print for the warranty from Costco:"SquareTrade can also be bought to protect TVs bought outside of Costco, where 3 year added protection begins at end of manufacturer's warranty.*Excludes limited life consumables such as batteries and lamps."

Reviews.Title: Extremely happy with TV; Nervous about warranty/Firmware update
Reviews.Author: Whedon
Reviews.Content: *************UPDATE 1/5/12*****************SW Version pre firmware update: V8-0RSC801-LF1V041SW Version post firmware update: V8-0RSC801-LF1V041After performing firmware update today the SW Version did not change (as listed in Menu>Setup>System Information)*************REVIEW 1/4/12*****************Before Christmas I woke up to an Amazon gold box deal for this TV for $260. My stomach tensed with excitement that I may be able to actually afford my first LCD TV. After an hour of model/brand research I clicked back to Amazon to purchase and it was sold out. Damn me and my lack of impulsiveness. On Christmas day, however, when this TV was back in stock and listed for $300 I decided not to pass on this again, even at $40 more, and ordered TV 12/25/11.TV arrived 12/28/11, setup was extremely easy: 4 screws in glass base, cable/sat channel scan (took about 8 minutes for scan), plug Xbox in via hdmi and cable in via coax and BOOM, up and running with my first HDTV. My jaw dropped when I tuned to the HD weather channel! Let me say again this is my first hdtv so I have no means of comparison but to a standard def Sanyo CRT, so I am no connoisseur, but 7 days later I am still in awe. Put in Enslaved Xbox 360 game and an audible "Whoooa!" was my first reaction to seeing a game in 1080p.Read the instruction manual cover to cover, tweaking settings as best I could, turning off the auto lighting and backlight functions, setting up a Personal picture setting to go along with the preset modes, adding 10 channels to the 'favorites' button on the remote. The remote is decent, but I do have a difficult time finding the circular +/- channel and +/- volume buttons in the dark as there are 2 circular buttons above the + volume + channel that, although slightly smaller, don't 'feel' much different. The 8-watt speakers work well for me as my living room is small and I'm only 11 feet from the TV. That said, I plan on buying Cyber Acoustics Subwoofer Satellite System (CA-3602) 2.1 speakers to connect to the R/L audio out next month to enhance sound.My current concern is 'to update firmware or not to update firmware?'. Right now I have not updated, although I did go ahead and put the update on a FAT formatted flash drive. Do I update and risk the TV going black as some have stated in these reviews and requiring a return to Amazon, or do I just leave well enough alone since I have no problems with the TV auto-powering on or changing volume? Other reviews indicate successful firmware update. I am so torn, but if i'm going to try it I need to do it within the 30 day return window. Gah! I will update with result if I get brave and try it.The scariest thing about this TV is the reviews i've read about the TLC customer service nightmares. I have decided that on day 29 of my Amazon purchase I will definitely be buying a 3 year warranty from Square Trade for peace of mind.Pros:-Best deal on hdtv I found-Beautiful HD picture-Tons of inputs including 3xHDMI-Input Skip to hide inputs you don't use, Channel Skip to hide unwanted channels (you heard me home shopping channels)-Setup menu is extremely easy to use-Glass stand is sturdy and attractive (subjective of course)-Silver strip accent goes well with my black and silver entertainment center (subjective)-I can walk almost all the way to the side of the Tv and still see the image clearly-Samsung LCD panel-remote makes it extremely easy to adjust aspect ratio and access 10 favorite channels and just feels good on button pressCons:-Firmware update hassle-No optical audio out-Possible sketchy TLC customer service/warranty-Subpar remote design on the +/- channel & volume in my opinion (still make mistakes with those in the dark d/t similar feeling buttons above)-SD channels look very 'blah'-Light bleed in top left/right corners when screen is solid black; NOT noticeable at all when image on screen-I have to switch between picture settings (Eco/Sports/Cinematic/Vibrant/Natural/Personal) often for tv shows/sports/movies/xbox games. Being that this is my first hdtv maybe this is normal, although I still haven't found a great setting for very dark movies after trying to adjust Personal picture mode for this purpose.-With my PS2 plugged in via RCA, each time I make a selection on a DVD (play, skip forward, etc) there is an annoying 'pop' sound from the speakers. This does not occur on xbox via hdmi.-If you turn off an input and take too long to decide what you want to do/watch next, the TV will power off after a few minutes (it does warn you first). This could just as easily go in the Pro's category for some.TLDR: Love the TV, love the price, nervous about TLC warranty/customer svc, nervous about doing firmware update. Would definitely recommend this to friends with the stipulation that they purchase a Square Trade warranty.

Reviews.Title: Works fine for me now.
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I was worried about the TV after reading the 1 star reviews, But i got mine in today. The 24th, Plugged it up and right away HDMI works, cable, all the settings without updating the firmware. No problems yet, hope it stays that way.Thanks, Will update if any changes!

Reviews.Title: Returned it!
Reviews.Author: Jose
Reviews.Content: The TV was good for the price I payed. However, The TV stopped working after a firmware update. I called the costumer services and they didn't know a thing about what happened. Also, One more problem I had with this TV was that since the make is new there are not control remote codes for cable companies like time Warner and others major companies that provide cable services. This was why I updated it, to see if it will worked with other remote control codes since using two remotes at the same time to watch TV one for the volume and to turn it off and on and other to change channels. Finally, my advice is to pay one or even two hundred more dollars and get something good because is not worth it. Now I have to return the TV and wait to see if they refund my money back which is going to take 2 to 3 weeks.

Reviews.Title: Fine TV, Just Hope Nothing Goes Wrong
Reviews.Author: Alex Pretzlav
Reviews.Content: This review is for the customer service you'll get after buying your shiny TCL television.Don't make the mistake I made on an earlier TCL model and upgrade your firmware. After the upgrade, my television went completely blank and wouldn't show anything but a blank screen.After being forwarded to second level technical support (outsourced to [...]), I was told a new mainboard would be shipped to me and a tech would be sent when it arrived to replace it in my television.It's now been four weeks and no mainboard has arrived. When I call tech support I get a recording on loop for five minutes then the system hangs up on me. I have to keep redialing hoping someone will answer. I've gotten through several times only to be told they would check on my status and call me back. They've never called back. They haven't answered a single email from me. They haven't given me an issue number or a tracking number. When I do get through, their behavior is unprofessional and dismissive.This TV comes with the practical equivalent of no warranty.UPDATE: It's now been six weeks and I'm still being given the runaround by tech support. Dropping from two stars to one star. This is completely unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: I wish ZERO stars was an option as a rating.
Reviews.Author: jp-squared
Reviews.Content: I purchased the TV though Amazon, because for the price, size and quality there really wasn't any better deal out there (and I shopped around for quite a while). The TV was easy to assemble and hook up, but that is the end of my positive feedback. After only owning the TV for two days, in the middle of a movie, the TV turns off. I visit TCL's website to look for troubleshooting techniques to find that my only option is to unplug it and plug it back in. I try looking in the owner's manual for any additional ideas as to why the TV would suddenly turn off, only to find the same advice as the website. After trying their singular solution many times I am still left without a working television. I have already filed a complaint with their website and I will be calling their customer service line first thing in the morning. I will never suggest this product or company to anyone ever. Dissatisfied does not even come close to explaining my feelings towards this product.

Reviews.Title: Best unit available for the price.
Reviews.Author: John Barelli
Reviews.Content: There are televisions with more features, and there are televisions that are higher technology, and there are televisions that have bigger screens.  Most of those televisions cost twice (or more) what this one does.  This is a good set, and a great set for the price, but not the best television ever made.First, the picture.  That is, after all, why we buy a high definition set.If you exclusively watch fast-motion video, you might want to look for one of the 240 Hz (or faster) sets, but you'll pay more than twice the price for a smaller screen.  If you are putting together a home cinema room you'll want to go to a larger set, 60" or larger.  But expect to pay triple the price of this set.  If you're looking for a good sized set for a living or family room where you watch TV with your family, this is a great size with a great picture.Connections.  This is often a problem with inexpensive sets.  Not here.On the back, two HDMI inputs, two component video inputs, an SVGA input (not many folks need two of these), an S-video input and a composite video input.  Audio outputs include digital audio out and RCA jack output.  The only thing I'd like to see is either a second RCA out or a 1/8 in output for wireless headphones.  There is a headphone jack on the side, along with another HDMI input, another composite video input (for video cameras) and a USB 2.0 input (for all sorts of stuff), but the headphone jack cuts off the speakers, and there's no way to override.Yes, that's picking at some really small nits.This set won't give you bragging rights with your buddies and isn't cutting edge.  It's just a really good set for a really good price.A couple more notes:1.  Yes, some folks have gotten broken televisions.  Not surprisingly, inexpensive televisions are occasionally dead on arrival,  Of course, expensive televisions are occasionally dead on arrival too.  Keep the box until you're sure it works, and don't arrange for delivery on the day of the big event you want to watch.  Test the set as soon as you get it.  The return timeframe is from date of delivery, not the date you open the box.2.  TCL is connected to Thomson (now Technicolor).  They used to make RCA, ProScan and GE sets, and may still be making them (it's gotten really hard to track that).  If you're looking for remote codes for your cable or satellite box, try the newer RCA codes.3.  Yes, it's made in China, by a company partly owned by a French company.  Parts of it are made in South Korea, and probably other places.  The last US television maker (Zenith) was sold to LG (South Korea) over ten years ago.  Many of us like to buy American, but that's not an option if you want to own a newer television set.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a Great Price!
Reviews.Author: Robert M. Dobson "Bob in GA"
Reviews.Content: NOTE: COMCAST CODE TO PROGRAM REMOTE IS 10047BTW, it was found by using RCA for the brand and the model number of the TV on Comcast's site. I understand that TCL also makes RCA brand TVs.I wish I had ordered 2 of these 40" HDTVs at the GB special price of $259.99! I would use one for a computer monitor if I had bought 2 of them. I used the savings towards the Square Trade 4 year warranty after having a dead 32" Toshiba that I paid much more for 2 years ago that isn't worth repairing.I ordered this TCL 40" TV on Dec 23rd and received it on Dec 24th!! I bought this TCL to replace a $200 piece of new junk (32" Emerson) I got on Thanksgiving night special from Wally World. There's a world of difference! This TCL 40" is as nice as the the new LG 42" LED LCD HDTV I had bought about a month earlier for almost twice as much also from Amazon.The picture is clear enough to use as a monitor. The color, depth and blacks are as nice as the new 42" LG in the master bedroom and our living room's 54" Sony.I waited a bit before writing a report to see if it developed any problems or anything, but it has been flawless, using it in the family room for a fantastic gaming experience along with watching cable TV. It gets lots of use there doing double duty for the kids being used for a TV when not hooked to the XBOX 360.You get MORE than what you pay for with this TV.If it continues to be high quality I will buy another one if it goes on special again!If it develops any problems I will update this report, but it has worked great since it was hooked up. NO PROBLEMS at all as of 1-15-12.Big bang for your buck with this bargain priced TV!!

Reviews.Title: Great for the price!  Exactly what I expected, no more, no less.
Reviews.Author: Albert W. Roethlisberger
Reviews.Content: For a $300 40" LCD, one can't really compare feature to feature with the latest models costing twice as much, or more.  But we're very pleased with the performance of the TCL.  It does everything it is supposed to do, and does so without too much complexity.  The different aspect ratios, luminance levels, inputs and other basic settings one often seems to need are just one button away.  And the unit has more inputs, and outputs, than most owners would probably need.  It even has SVHS if one still has a SVHS equipped VCR or cable-box.The picture quality is fantastic, and while playing the latest PS3 games we saw no blurring even though this is a 60Hz only set.  The colors and contrast are just as good as any other set I've seen, although as with all TVs, I'm sure one could find differences with side-by-side comparisons.Not being a field LED set than can vary individual LED's brightness, there is some slight bleed at the corners (when the screen area is total black) as one would see with many edge LED and other CCFL based sets. But this isn't really a problem or no greater than others in this class, or even more expensive edge LED sets.  I would in no way count this against the set.The set itself seems well built and looks every bit as classy as more expensive sets.  And the heavy glass stand is a real plus.  The packing, and unpacking process, was well thought out and our TV arrived unscathed.  In no way does the set look cheap.The remote control is a shiny lacquer look that some may or may not like, but I think was done well and looks good.  It doesn't have a plethora of buttons, but seems to have the most used features one click away.  The remote seems to work well and doesn't feel cheap.  Time will tell, and we'll probably use a programmable remote anyway over time.Given that TCL makes components and TVs for other well regarded manufacturers, I think these sets are a good bargain if one isn't chasing the latest and greatest features.

Reviews.Title: New, but not necessarily improved
Reviews.Author: Zack Davisson
Reviews.Content: I bought the TCL L32HDF11TA 32-Inch 720p 60 Hz LCD HDTV as my first flat-panel HDTV.  I was nervous about the  brand, TCL, but the thousand or so positive reviews on the TV convinced me to give it a try, and I was very happy.  TCL makes an easy-to-use, no-frills, affordable HDTV with a nice picture that was a startling improvement over my ancient tube TV.When I was given the opportunity to review the "TCL L40FHDF12TA 40-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LCD HDTV" I was excited.  Surely, when it comes to television technology, newer is always better, right?  Not necessarily.Right out of the box, I was disappointed in the look of the 12TA.  Whereas the 11TA had a sleek, futuristic look, this 12TA can only be described as industrial.  Instead of a sculpted black base that matches the set, the foot for the 12TA is just a glass plate mounted with four screws.  It sets up easy enough, but it just doesn't look as good.  Then, there is a large strip of metal going across the front on the bottom of the TV on the 12TA that wasn't there on the 11TA.  I don't know why these design-elements were changed, but the 12TA is not as handsome a TV as the 11TA.The rears of the TVs are identical.  Both the 11TA  and the 12TA have the exact same number of interfaces.  The remote for the 12TA is larger and I found it to be inconvenient, but maybe that is because I am used to the remote for the 11TA.But we aren't buying TVs to be decorations, right?  So how is the performance?The 12TA claims to have "enhanced picture and sound."  I set the two TVs next to each other and gave them a watch. I don't have a BluRay player, but I do have an upscalling DVD player and both TVs registered as native 1080p.  They have identical options  as far as picture adjustment goes.  I normally turn off the Backlight Sensor, because it doesn't work very well and leaves the screen too dark.  In terms of advancement, the 12TA doesn't have any extra features over the 11TA.  I did find that the 12TA had a slightly nicer picture.  I couldn't quite put my finger on what it was, and it wasn't an incredible difference, but there was definitely more going on with the 12TA than the 11TASo I give them the "enhanced picture."  Enhanced sound, on the other hand ... there really wasn't any difference.  Neither TV has nice sound; the speakers are just regular TV speakers, and they just aren't going to give you a full sound experience.  I have a surround-sound system, so I almost never use the TV speakers anyways.My real problem with the 12A came with its internal antenna.  At our house we don't have cable or satellite TV, but there are a few free, local digital channels that we enjoy watching.  For some reason, the 11TA can watch them while the 12TA cannot.  It was strange to see.  With the two TVs sitting right next to each other, my wife and I initiated the channel search on both TVs at the same time, and while the 11TA picked up and showed the local channels, the 12TA claimed it couldn't find anything.  Even when you tried to program those channels directly in, it wouldn't display them.Ultimately, the channel issues and the industrial design of the TV meant that we decided to keep the 11TA in the main room and relegate the newer, 12TA to a bedroom.  Even though the picture is slightly better, the fact that it can't locate local channels and--too be perfectly honest--just doesn't look cool meant that the negatives outweighed the single positive.If you are looking for an affordable flat-panel HDTV, then the TLC brand is a great way to go.  But I would personally recommend the older, 11TA model over this 12TA which is newer but not really improved.

Reviews.Title: MAKE SOMEONE HAPPY FOR XMAS
Reviews.Author: E. T. GAMBLE
Reviews.Content: THIS IS THE BEST TV FOR THE PRICE; I PLAN TO GET SEVERAL MORE TO REPLACE THE BIG BACKS IN MY HOME; THE ONLY PROBLEM I HAD WAS INSTALLING THE UPDATE; WHICH MAY NOT BE NECESSARY WITH THE NEWER MODELS, BUT THAT JUST HAD TO BE DONE WITH THE CABLE WIRES UNINSTALLED; AFTER THAT I HAD NO PROBLEM; BEAUTIFUL PICTURE AND I WOULD DEFINITELY PURCHASE MORE..

Reviews.Title: Not impressed.
Reviews.Author: avid_reader
Reviews.Content: i was not impressed.  i had technical problems with mine from day one.  the unit would randomly power itself on.  there is an auto on feature, but it was disabled.  probably a firmware glitch, but not one i can fix.  the remote had issues too.  my surround sound is an RCA (same brand as this i hear) and i could not get the remote to turn the tv on without affecting my surround and vice versa.  granted, they have a two year warranty and amazon is quick to refund or replace, but these "simple" problems are not the kind you expect to see on a product that has been out for a while.  i bought it because there was only one review where technical issues were mentioned.  now there are two.  had there been two before i bought, i would have looked elsewhere and suggest the same to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this TV!!!!
Reviews.Author: Shawman87 "Shawman87"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV in Feb 2012 because it had the largest screen for the price. It worked fine for 3 months. Then it suddenly refused to recognize any of the inputs - so no DVD player could be hooked up to it. I thought maybe this was just bad luck - some products will be defective in a large production run. However, it's the so-called 'warranty service" that's the problem now. It supposedly has a 2 yr. warranty. But there are no repair shops that will accept it in San Antonio Tx - and this is no small town (in fact, there are only 4 places in all of Texas). I called customer service for TCL and they said they would send a box, I was to send them the TV in the box, it would be repaired and sent back. Not "we will send you a new TV and you put the old one in the box and send it back" as is most common. This was over a month and 3 phone calls ago. To date, no box. I have been without my TV for over a month, and face the prospect of being without for at least another month if not forever. Amazon has been contacted and is looking into the matter with the vendor. If it were up to me, I'd remove their product from Amazon.com. Spend a little more money and get a name brand. These people are turkeys.

Reviews.Title: I already want another one.
Reviews.Author: R. Frazzini "stogiedawg"
Reviews.Content: I'm 64 years old and have set up many TV's in my lifetime.  This one by far was the easiest ever.It has undoubtedly the clearest, most understandable instructions ever and is a virtual breeze to set up.  Even with Super Saver Shipping Amazon delivered the well packaged television very fast.  Easy to unpack.  Sturdy, easy to mount base by simply attaching 4 screws.  The remote control is well organized and easy to use.  The sleep timer is awesome.I have three other televisions, a 50" Panasonic Viera, a 32" Sony Google Internet TV, and a 19" Viore all new with the last two years and this TCL televison has the best picture by far.  Mine was awesome right out of the box without any further adjustment.The price is ridiculously low relative to the quality.  I purchased this television based upon all the great Amazon reviews and the two year warranty and I am very glad that I did.  I highly recommend this television.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a budget consumer
Reviews.Author: Nistler
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about this $320 TV.  So I did research.  There is a reason that this is the #1 selling TV on Amazon.com.  First, one of the user photos shows that the panel is made by Samsung.  In my research I found that TCL is the parent company of RCA.  TCL is the branding they used on other continents while using RCA in the US.  I guess the TCL brand has come to America now.  Also, TCL were contracted by Samsung to produce some of Samsung's LCD panels, thus the Samsung panel in this TV.PROS: You can't beat the price.  The HD picture quality is good.  The sound is actually better than some other budget HDTVs.  In my case, I usually hook up a set of $30 powered computer speakers with a sub to my TVs.  So far I have not found the need to use them with this TV.  As many have mentioned, the base is sturdy and made of glass, not that that's a huge deal.  Plenty of connections and settings to tweak the picture and sound quality to your preference.  Quick and easy set-up.  2-year warranty.CONS: Although the picture quality is good for a $320 40" HDTV, don't expect greatness.  The biggest con to the picture quality is that it is 60Hz.  So, there is a some blurring on fast moving scenes.  I notice it but I'm not willing to pay $100s more for a better TV - this one is just fine.In conclusion, if your on a budget but want a mid-sized LCD, you can't go wrong with this one.

Reviews.Title: Great For the Price, Great for the Product
Reviews.Author: Daniel Paul
Reviews.Content: -So impressed by TCL,I had not heard of the company until I saw their HDTV's featured on Amazon.The tech is sound, and the price is beyond reasonable for a 40" 1080p 60Hz HDTV.-After using the TV for about a month, I feel as though I have run it through the paces,--Watched DVDs, PS3-Blu-Ray/Netflix, no problems, and the picture is phenomenal.-Even my SNES (Super Nintendo) looks good (for what it's worth).--Still have not tried the USB seeing as how the PS3 does basically the same thing).The setup and menus are simplistic as well as modern.-The only difficulty I experienced was screwing the stand into the base of the screen (but it sure looks good!)-The sound fills my living room, and I have not experienced the strange volume fluctuation issues that seem to plague cheap HDTV's (cough!- Vizio).I would recommend this TV to anyone looking for a good value, and a great product.(plus it's hard to beat the 2-year manufacturers warranty)

Reviews.Title: Gamers/Computer monitor folks-virtually no input lag on a suprisingly good all around tv with a Samsung screen!!!!
Reviews.Author: D. Torgerson
Reviews.Content: Just like the title says, there is virtually no input lag on this tv. I went from a tube tv in the bedroom (tube tv's having no input lag whatsoever just straight monitor) to this, and it's practically identical feeling only it's 1080p and it looks great! The game I tested it on is Modern Warfare 3 on my PS3 (the ultimate lag testing game-I can't think of anything faster paced) and I tested it with Halo Reach on my Xbox 360 when I first got it this afternoon to make sure it worked and it did great on that too. There was another review that mentioned he had tested it on a couple games and it didn't seem to have input lag, but he didn't mention WHAT games so I was still unsure as you wouldn't really notice as sharply on most games. I took a chance and I am here to tell you that I felt in control and no lag the whole time- super pleased! Got straight on here to let you guys know because I saw a few people asking about it in the comments on other reviews and its a major concern especially if that's the bulk of what you're going to be doing with it:)I've had the input lag problem with several tv's including my Toshiba 46" 1080P 240hz in the living room that doesn't feel right totally. It even has game mode which basically cancels extra processing and speeds up the image response like .33hz or something to combat input lag. I believe the fact that this TCL TV is 60hz is a contributing factor to it's lack of input lag. No overprocessing which you don't need with a good hdmi signal from the source anyway, just a good solid 1080p responsive picture. Don't get me wrong, this tv has bells and whistles too, but I think the Toshibas problem (only concerning input lag) is the 240hz and the other processing it does to put out an amazing picture- takes more time to think. When I pan my character's view around in a game it's very hard to stop where I want to consistantly. It even feels like it speeds up as you swing around (like the processor's catching up which is typical of tvs with input lag) making it almost impossible to zero in on a specific spot or opponent accurately at least before they get you:) It does totally fine on most games, but split second timing reflexive games I really notice it.For those of you that don't know what input lag is, it's a processing delay in displaying the image from the source (when you move it should move steadily and consistantly) that is really only noticeable when gaming (or using the tv as a monitor for your computer-you'll find controlling your mouse much more difficult etc...) because you are actually controlling the image and know when you told it to do what. It doesn't affect viewing movies or anything of that nature because it could have a 5 SECOND delay on when it displays the movie and we'd never know it. It's only a matter of milliseconds, but completely changes the feel of controlling your character especially in fast paced precision movement type games. The image you see is not accurately reporting what you're hands are telling it to do and it makes it very difficult to play (or at least a very akward and sluggish feeling).On the other aspects: this tv is very vibrant with good color contrast, viewing angles seem to be great, I'm not noticing a bunch of motion blur, and it's a very similar looking picture to my much more expensive tv. I've been looking for a bdrm tv for a while waiting for a good deal and this is BY FAR the best deal I've seen. I would've been happy with 720p at this price. I didn't want to spend too much and was origionally looking at 32" 720p tv's that were around $300, so when this popped up on the screen with 4 1/2 stars from so many customers I was definately interested and started reading reviews.There seems to be a common problem with this TV showing up DOA or with other malfunctions that definately made me nervous. It had me thinking maybe the components inside aren't secured well enough and/or breaking from shipping jostling or some other OEM defect so even if it arrives fine, it could quit working after moving or something. After looking at it though, and putting it thru some initial paces and comparing to the pic on my other tv, I don't think that this will happen. It seems like a pretty solid unit. It could have been a bad batch or being thrown around by the delivery people or anything really, though it doesnt instill a lot of confidence. After seeing it and having all of my requirements completely met and surpassed, I would say that if you get a bad one take advantage of Amazon's awesome return policy and have 'em send you another because I believe you won't be disappointed. If something goes wrong down the road there's a 2 year warranty so there's not much to worry about (although some are saying the OEM's customer service isn't great)- you'll still be able to get it taken care of eventually. A warranty's a warranty. Just come back and tell people what happened on here- that seems to get their attention as one review I read seemed to infer.I just got it this afternoon so I'll update if anything of note happens, but as it stands you can't beat the price and the quality seems to be there too! Great product so far, and an unbeatable price on a 40" 1080p tv!UPDATE 2/2/2012: It's been a week, absolutely no problems, good solid operation. I popped back on to say that I too checked the back of the display panel through the vent holes and it DOES say SAMSUNG on it which doesn't suprise me considering the great picture. I notice motion blur a little watching streaming vids now, but you have to be looking for it and it's to be expected with a 60hz refresh rate. Don't notice it gaming though. Still a great product for the money. Oh, and the buttons on the remote stick for a sec after being pushed...kinda weird but it's gotten better already.UPDATE 4/21/2012: Still going strong after 3 months! I havent noticed it lately, but I did notice it making ticking noises as it cooled down after shutting it off.  It sounded like a baseboard heater popping and cracking (not near as loud but you get the idea). I don't think it's done that for a month or so now. It was probably just "settling in" but I was a little concerned about that for a while.  Overall the picture is still great- it's darker overall than my other one- not as much contrast in the blacks but that's to be expected. Hey, it's a $300 tv, but at least it has a Samsung screen!  Gaming is still as good as ever- perfect control.UPDATE 9/19/2012:  I love this tv.  It's still doing just fine and I tend to watch more of this one than my living room tv so LOTS of hours on it now.  It's still got the ticking sometimes for a bit when I turn it off as it cools down, but it's still great other than that. I noticed the price went up $100 tho since I purchased it which puts it in competition with some other decent brands- not the smokin deal that it was.  I can say that I've had a good experience with it tho and the warranty's pretty cool so best of luck with your tv hunting:)AMMENDMENT: I just saw that there is another prime option for this tv that is $360 so that's only $30 more than I paid and is still well worth it:)

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture, easy setup and plenty of inputs
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Ray
Reviews.Content: I've been waiting to upgrade to an HD television for a number of reasons, chief of which was I wanted to wait until the prices came down a bit. After watching the prices more closely in the last year, I decided the time was right to upgrade.When I saw the TCL L40FHDF12TA 40-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LCD HDTV offered as a Deal of the Day at Amazon, I was torn. I'd never heard of the TCL brand before, and I couldn't envision how big a 40-inch LCD TV was. While I deliberated over the decision, the deal sold out within just a few hours. Determined to not miss the next opportunity, I researched the TCL brand. When I learned that Samsung has outsourced production of some of their LCD TVs to TCL and that TCL also makes the RCA TVs in North America, I was sold.A couple of days later, the same television was back in stock, and again on sale for a fantastic price. So I bought it.It arrived in just a couple of days in very good condition. I started setting it up as soon as I arrived home from work. The hardest part of the whole set up was lifting my heavy old standard definition television off the entertainment center. In comparison, the TCL L40FHDF12TA was extremely light.It does require some quick assembly - you simply need to screw the base onto the television, which was very easy. After that, it was just a matter of plugging everything in, which is a no-brainer. I plugged my Roku 2 XS 1080p Streaming Player and my TiVo TCD746320 Premiere DVR, Black into two of the HDMI ports and my DVD player into the composite input. All devices look fantastic on this television.The TCL L40FHDF12TA sports a decent amount of inputs: three HDMI, two composite, one component video, one RF, one PC video, one PC audio, and a USB 2.0 port.The remote control is logically laid out and very easy to use. I was able to quickly learn the most often used controls by touch.The audio on this television is very good. I'll eventually add surround sound to it, but for now the built-in speakers work perfectly well for me.As for the picture, the colors are beautiful, the picture is crisp and everything I've watched looks beautiful, no matter which device I've used.I want to upgrade the television in my bedroom to HD soon, and the TCL brand is definitely at the top of my list of considerations when I buy another television.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected, TCL is great. If you are "iffy," just buy it - you will be pleased.
Reviews.Author: sp
Reviews.Content: While I was hesitant to spend money on a brand that I had never heard of, I must admit that this TCL television is great. The picture is crystal clear and bright from an almost 180 degrees, so I can watch it from the kitchen and dining room without diminished picture quality. This looks great with both an old DVD player and even better with a high-definition / blu-ray player.As for reliability, time will tell, but with the 2 year warranty and the $300-ish price tag, you can't beat this. You could even buy another one in a few years if this ever breaks, and you would still have spent less money than on the name brands.I did my research on the brand before purchasing it, and as it turns out TCL makes many of the Samsung televisions. So you are getting Samsung quality at half of the price.I have seen other televisions around the same price like sanyo, westinghouse, coby, etc., but the TCL has much better picture than those.

Reviews.Title: Slow Service
Reviews.Author: Rap
Reviews.Content: I bought 3 of these.  Two are working just fine and I am very please with price, picture and the way it operates.  The 3rd one had a problem with the picture after about 6 months.  It took 5 phone calls and 5 emails over a 2 month period to get approval to send it in for repair.  Two weeks after sending it in, they agreed to send a replacement.

Reviews.Title: I'm impressed!
Reviews.Author: LadyKurupt
Reviews.Content: I just got this TV today and I'm actually really impressed with the quality! I was a little concerned after some of the negative reviews but I'm having no problems what so ever. The set up was a breeze and the picture and sound quality were far better than I expected!! I've wanted a big flat screen for years but couldn't afford one. This gave me the opportunity to own one and I'm in flat screen heaven!

Reviews.Title: So far, so good!
Reviews.Author: gamergirl
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews (both good and bad) for this product and I decided to go ahead and give it a shot. After all, Amazon has an awesome return policy. I received email notification that the tv had been shipped on a friday and received it the next day, so first of all kudos to amazon for super fast shipping. When I received the tv, the box was in good shape and the tv was in perfect condition when I pulled it out. Installing the stand and setting everything up was simple. The TV is light enough for me to move on my own but has a decent looking design; it doesn't look "cheap" or generic. Picture's great, remote is very easy to use, my ps3 looks awesome when I play games on this tv with the hdmi cable. Overall, I really don't think you can find a better deal for quality. And a 2 year warranty can't be beat! I've had this tv about a week, and thus far I haven't had any problems with it whatsoever and I love it! It's in my bedroom and works perfectly for what I need it for. I will update if I encounter any problems, but so far so good!

Reviews.Title: Worked fine out of the box, but it's not a computer monitor
Reviews.Author: R. Jacobs
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of negative reviews about this flatscreen not working right out of the box. I was worried that I'd be disappointed, but the incredible price and the Amazon satisfaction guarantee sold me. The flatscreen worked fine, no problems yet, no bad pixels. My only complaint is that I was hoping that, with a 1920x1080 resolution, I could use this large screen as a computer monitor. But it turns out that, while it can show 1080 resolution, for a computer HDMI connection, it's native resolution is 1280x720 and, when pushed to 1920x1080, characters from a computer are not clear enough. So I was disappointed that the TCL could not be used as a computer monitor. Instead, it now sits in our family room and is (so far) a terrific buy on a good TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at an amazing price.
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I read the good and bad reviews of this TV before buying. I was encouraged that the bad reviews seemed to be confined to units that didn't work (which would obviously warrant an easy return/refund), while the reviews of working sets were generally glowing.I received the set yesterday. Set-up was super quick and easy (much more so than the Dynex I had purchased previously), and the picture is outstanding. It is definitely worthwhile to explore the different picture presets, and customize your own, according to your preferences, but the picture is crisp and clear with good blacks (which can be hard to find in a flat-screen). The menus are easy to navigate, and intuitive to use. So far, I couldn't be happier with this set! I can't imagine why it's being sold so cheap... and with a 2-year warranty?? Best deal I've had in a long time (and I'm a deal-hunter)!

Reviews.Title: Great TV compared to any TV at any price range.
Reviews.Author: white cloud "moku6"
Reviews.Content: - Updated sectionEnergy guide yellow tag states $23 annual cost vs. $11 annual cost for LED TV with 5 hours of daily usage.Calibration - This allows you to change color, sharpness, brightness & etc. in "personal" setting, but I find myself using the TV's default "natural" setting the most.Monster GreenPower MP HT H800G - This surge protector will cut-off electricity to other TV related electronics.  I have connected the blu ray to an outlet unrelated to the TV to be able to load the blu ray disk first before turning on the TV.Blue light indicator - I am not sure about other TVs but I don't like the tiny blue light to indicate that it is turned on.  So I placed 2 tiny pieces of paper to cover the light.- Original sectionI have to say this TV is great and not just a great cheap TV.  It is a great TV period.  I used the TV calibration from another website.  Because of the low price, the TV is not less than 1" thick, but thin enough.  The TV's front bezel is not 3 cm thick, but attractive enough.  This TV is not 20 lbs, but it is light enough to hang on the wall.  The speakers are excellent and is better than the speakers from my 10 year old Sony TV.  TV response to the remote is instant.  The remote is acceptable and could have been made better.Initial channel scan - about 4 minutes vs. my 25 minutes from my 4 year old Vizio.Switching channels from antenna - About 3 second.Favorite button from the remote - This is great as you can place 10 of your favorite channels for quick access.  This is a great feature instead of searching through all the channels that I don't watch.My set up in my living room is this TCL LCD HDTV, Terk HDTVa antenna for off the air HD channels, LG BD630, Panasonic DMP-BD85K, and Bell'O TPC361.  The LG blu ray player has a really dim display but I prefer this because this blu player allows you to change audio & subtitles easily.Great TV and TCL will be a great brand if they continue making TVs like this model.  This TV is "made in China" vs. LG, Samsung, Sony, and Sharp selling "made in Mexico" TVs sold in the US.

Reviews.Title: No better value
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: ***UPDATE BELOW***I've only had the television for less than one day, but so far, so good.I have seen the price lower than the $299.99 that I paid for it but I'm still very pleased with the price.  There are no bells and whistles with this set and that's just fine if you intend to use this as a bedroom set like me.  Delivery only took a few days and I paid zero shipping costs. The packaging was standard. Everythingwas intact and  functioning.Attaching the glass base took only minutes. Connecting all the wires took even less.  There are plenty of ways to connect this television to almost any component, including 3 HDMI ports.  I was a little confused by the numbering of the HDMI ports. It seema the 2 port should be where the 3 port is. Set up was a breeze.  Remember, you will need an HDTV cable box.The picture quality rivals that of the 50 inch Panasonic plasma that I bought almost one year earlier.  The contrast on the TCL is superior to the plasma but the color crown belongs to the older set. Definition and detail are pretty even.  The sound on this TCL is adequate. It's loud but doesn't have a lot of depth. Again, for a bedroom set, this is just fine.We will see how this television lasts through the weeks and months.  All things considered (price, set up, quality) I'm very pleased with this purchase.**UPDATE**Two months later and the television its still going strong.  There were a few instances where the screen turned to snow for about one second.  However, I can't rule out the possibility that it was caused by my cable signal and not the television itself.  I also find that the volume button stocks on my cable remote from time to time.  But again, it may be the fault of the cable remote and not the television.All things considered, this purchase was a steal.***UPDATE***After one year of use this television is as good as day one.  There was a period of time about 9 months in where the picture would turn to snow about 2 or 3 times a day.  It would last about 30 seconds to one minute.  This issue occurred for about 1 month then went away as suddenly as it started.  Other than that weird occurrence, I can honestly say that the television has performed beautifully.  Of course, it isn't a premier device but, considering the cost and reliability, you can't find a better value.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good - an outstanding entry level HDTV
Reviews.Author: M. Day
Reviews.Content: One year later update 12.27.2012:Not a single, utter problem out of the unit a year later.  It was worth the investment.  Does it handle fast action, like football, spot on with no distortion? No--its an LCD, so that is to be expected.  But does it handle it outstandingly for the price I paid?  You bet.________________________I had initially decided to wait another year to buy my first HDTV to replace a conventional 32-inch Sanyo bulb set (which stills works fine, I was just ready to move up to flat screen HDTV).  I had even settled in on getting a plasma, probably an LG.  Then I saw this 40-inch TCL on sale as a special Holiday Deal ($259).  I was impressed by the features and the low price.  I ordered it that Thursday morning.  There is still a warm place in my heart for a good plasma, but the price here swayed me.Amazon shipped it so fast that they tried to deliver it two days later on a Saturday.  And that was the free shipping method!The TV came out of the box in good order.  Installation was pretty easy, as I am just using the stand.  And the base is a thick piece of glass, so very nice touch there.I have seen some well written reviews here advising of defective units out of the box, and some reviews from people who, well, let's be honest here, did not sound like they could turn on a toaster without some assistance.  Defective units do happen--read reviews on any product, especially TV's, and you will see more than a couple of valid cases.  I had my concerns.  But, I've had it hooked up for two days now, and have to say I am truly amazed at the picture quality for the price of the unit.  After tweaking the picture settings I can say that I have not seen as good as an image on some more expensive, non-LCD sets.  I really have to wonder if owners of the name brand LED sets don't bother to adjust the factory settings much.  Now, I am aware that if you put this TV next to a good Sony that you would be able to see the difference in picture quality.  But it won't set you back the $ that a good Sony LED or even LCD will.On the sound quality, with just about any flat screen TV, don't expect much out of the speakers.  You should plan on having a surround sound system or home stereo hooked up to the unit, or else the beauty of 40-inch HDTV will be marred by flat sound (though it does have an equalizer that can & should be adjusted to make the most out of the on-board speakers).So, after a few days of use, I am floored by the quality relative to the low price of the unit.  And I am comforted by Amazon's 30 day TV return shipping policy and also by TCL's Two Year warranty.  Hopefully I will not need either service.This 40-inch TCL is a great HDTV picture on a budget.

Reviews.Title: Can't believe what I paid for this TV! What a buy!
Reviews.Author: Icydog
Reviews.Content: I ordered it on the Gold Box on Dec 23rd and it was delivered for free on Christmas Eve. That was quite a surprise since my delivery date was to be Dec 27th!My son in law set it up in minutes.  The picture is great.  I was able to sync it to my Comcast remote after several tries using RCA codes.  Thanks to the poster who suggested that!This is a wonderful TV.  I'll post back in a few days when I have more opportunity to try out its features. So far I absolutely love it

Reviews.Title: Great picture and sound from a $260 40" TV
Reviews.Author: Peter Thomas "Windsurferpete"
Reviews.Content: I was concerned that the TV might be low quality.  But when I received it and set it up the picture was beautiful and the sound was as good as my Toshiba 42" TV.  I was impressed mostly with the quality of the picture which was laser sharp and had great contrast and color accuracy. I understand that it uses a Samsung panel. The remote is simple and easy to use.  The analog tuner works great for broadcast TV and picks up all the channels that it should in my area.  Amazon delivered it free of charge in two days.  This is a great product and I plan to buy another one for my mother.

Reviews.Title: No Issues
Reviews.Author: S. Ausdahl "Galiant Gamer"
Reviews.Content: When I purchased this TV I was worried due to the amount of DOA reviews. However I wasnt thinking and did the one day shipping and became concerned that in the rush to ship it, it was more likely to become damaged. Yet it showed up on time, and works great. I love this TV, now I am just hoping that it lasts. I mostly do gaming with my 360 or Laptop and it works great for it. The built in speakers arent nearly as bad as I thought they would be. I have no problem whatsoever just listening with the built in speakers, though for online games I use my headphones. All in all, I am very pleased with this product at this point. Also, keep in mind that more people are likely to post a review if they have a bad experience rather than a good one. So I am making this count as a positive review. :)

Reviews.Title: Great picture for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a really good price/performance TV deal. I just received it, so I cannot comment on it's durability. But I just bought an LG Infinia 60PZ750 60-Inch 1080p 600 Hz Active 3D THX Certified Plasma HDTV, so I do have something to compare as a performance reference (the LG being a rather well reviewed plasma TV).The picture is bright, contrast is good, viewing angle seems very good for an LCD. I am using it in our bedroom, so 40 inch is an appropriate size given the space. I agree with some that the styling is not quite state of the art (which is subjective, granted), but it's subdued enough and not really noticeable when you're actually watching TV (as opposed to staring at the powered off set). It has no real "Internet" features - but it's connected to my LG BD570 Bluray player that offers plenty of that, so I wasn't concerned. It's very nice to have those, but there is more than one way to skin a cat, so to speak.Thanks to another reviewer, I was even able to easily program my Comcast remote to control it (it was the first code he listed - 11447) and I can control volume, power, even the sleep timer(!) - all the necessities for a bedroom TV.It seems very light, but I imagine that's just compared to the 60" plasma I just unboxed a month ago. Packaging was really very sturdy, with nice braces to frame the box, and unboxing it and attaching the stand (which only mounts one way, a nice touch, with just 4 sturdy screws) was no issue at all for just one person. It seems well balanced and very steady on the stand.Hey, I can't comment on the durability - I just got it.
