My experience with these panels is strictly from my life as a software engineer, which I seem to notice they usually fail out of the box or shortly afterwards and then last far longer than my desire to keep it. So far I'm pleased with the performance, and VERY pleased with the price ($260). I'm sure people who bought Vizio's and LG's years ago were hesitant, too. A little research indicated that TCL is the world's 6th largest panel manufacturer, and OEM'd some other (granted, less desirable) brands like RCA. Hey, you might spend this much on a sushi dinner with friends - I thought it was worth a chance, and so far, for the money, I highly recommend this particular model.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat this deal...
Reviews.Author: RiderS
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for our bedroom. It was shipped very fast and was very well packaged. Set-up was a breeze and the picture is very good. Sounds is okay, fine in our bedroom. If you have it in a large room, probably will want to add a surround sound system. We haven't had it long, but so far so good. No automatic turning on like others have reviewed. Maybe they have that glitch fixed.A two year warranty is nice as well.I bought it for $319.99 and then saw it was $299.99 so Amazon adjusted the price for me with a quick email. So much easier than having to mess around with Best Buy or one of the big box stores.$299.99 is an awesome deal for such a nice TV. I'm completely satisfied and still amazed that they can make this product and ship it to my door in 2 days for less than $300. Might have to get another one for the garage!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Duane S. Wood
Reviews.Content: Got this as a Gold Box deal.  Free shipping with Prime.  I also bought the Sony universal remote (RM-VZ320) that has codes for this TV and my Comcast DVR.  Incredible TV for the price.  Very happy.

Reviews.Title: Good deal, nice product, 4.5 stars
Reviews.Author: Brisa Knopf "B. Knopf"
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived in good shape and was very easy to setup, although finding a "TCL" code for directv, was impossible. I searched online and used an RCA code insteadAlso it needed a USB firmware update which is still problematic (TV couldn't read my USB) and might be my fault, I haven't used a flash drive before.TV is excellent for the price,great picture, good imputs, sound is good. Just downgraded due the need for a firmware update to avoid a software glich in the TV.

Reviews.Title: Doa
Reviews.Author: sanfrantreat
Reviews.Content: Order this tv with fast shipping. Unfortunately it was Dow and all I got was a blue light. The power on buttons just seemed to really not want to work. Ordered a replacement and hopefully it will arrive very shortly. This issue needs to be pressed and people must be well informed and warned. It's more common than you think for doa tcl tvs if you read all their low starred reviews. I will update when I receive my replacement.

Reviews.Title: Works great, nice size, watch shipping
Reviews.Author: E. Plaga
Reviews.Content: This TV was an exceptional value as deal of day. $260 and free shipping for a 40" is untouchable. Even costing more, this is a good value.Many reviews mention issues. I had too with my first one delivered. But believe it was related to being mishandled, not the TV itself. It was delivered with no straps securing the box together and when I went to carry it in, the top of the box simply lifted off exposing the TV and making it vulnerable. I doubt I was the only person this happened to as it was in transit. The illustration on box clearly showed nylon straps being used to hold box together. I plugged it in and it had massive pixelation which transitioned into a black screen with white lines racing about. Horrible.Amazon quickly sent a replacement and gave me the packing slip to mail the damaged one back. As always, great service.The second TV came packed securely with straps and works great.TV screen size at 40" nicely fits my family room. Multiple methods of hooking up peripherals. Have my PS2, DVD and VCR all hooked up and works perfectly.There are sufficient options in menu to adjust all the necessary details like sound, contrast, brightness etc. Sound has equalizer presets, but I preferred setting my own which was also available. Sound is disappointing unless equalizer is set. After it is totally fine in my opinion.When watching the TV from my couch i don't notice the brand name on the TV. Only the picture and sound quality. And this TV meets my needs completely. I would easily recommend it. Just watch the way it's packed because shipping seems to be an issue with these things based on similar damage others had as I did with my first one.

Reviews.Title: Best Bargain of the Year!
Reviews.Author: Robert H. Derga Jr.
Reviews.Content: I bought this set as a gold box deal on Dec 23 and boy am I glad I did. It is without doubt one of the best bargains out there. I was not aware of the TLC brand until now but the more I research this specific set and the TLC brand the more impressed I am. TLC is the 7th largest TV manufacturer in the world and is #1 in China. They use a Samsung LCD panel in this set. TLC also manufactures some TV modules for Samsung. The fact they have ties to Samsung is a good indicator of the quality. They also manufacture RCA TVs. The Amazon delivery was unbelievable - I had the TV on my door step on Dec. 24th - only 26 hours after placing the order! I had opted for the free Super Saver shipping so this quick of delivery by Amazon and FedEx was just fantastic. I fired up the set tonight for the first time. The setup was easy and went perfect. The menus are pretty straight forward and give a good amount of control of picture and sound. The picture out of the box is sharp and the colors spot on - just as good as my 3 year old 52" Samsung set that cost almost 9x the amount of this set! This TV will go in our exercise room. I was looking for a low cost solution and this far surpasses my expectations on all fronts.I am totally impressed with this set. The 2 year warranty is icing on the cake. This set would be a bargain even at $500.

Reviews.Title: Dead on arrival
Reviews.Author: Joom
Reviews.Content: Received this unit on Christmas Eve.  Was very excited and drove 30 miles to my dad's house to surprise him with a new TV.  Once I got there, I unbox the TV and plug it in.  Wham!! seem like no electricity go through it.  It wont turn on.  Have to repacked it and drove 30 miles back home.  Thank god Amazon got a good and easy return policy.  Hope the new replacement one will turn on.

Reviews.Title: Horrible TV Even Worse Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Samuel Kolakowski
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV on the 5th of March, 3 months later, to the exact day, it decided to stop working. I was watching TV in the afternoon when it just decided to shut off. Tried to turn it back on with no luck, plugged it into three other outlets and did a hard reset to no avail. Onto the customer service, I called on July 6th only to be greeted by a woman who was speaking very broken English. After 15 minutes of information trading, she tells me that this was the wrong number to call and that I would need to call another number. So, dialed the new number to be yet again, greeted by a woman who I could barely understand. After wasting another 15 minutes for info trading, I'm told that it would be 7-10 days before I would receive the parts needed for the repair, and on top of that, it would be another 2-3 days for a technician to come out and fix it. Then I'm asked to email my proof of purchase to them, because apparently the serial number and all personal information isn't enough, so I sent that through email not 2 minutes after I got off the phone. So at this point I am very cross towards this company, but at least it'll be fixed soon...right? WRONG. A week goes by with no parts, but an email. An email that thanks me for sending in the proof of purchase and asks me to provide the issues I am having along with the serial number. So I call back to see what is going on...Now, I'm told that my information nor the order for the parts are even in the system, ARE YOU KIDDING ME? So once again I have to give my information, give the serial number, explain the issues, and email the proof of purchase. I was told that it would be at least 2 business days to get the order processed, then up to 7 business days to get it shipped, and then another 2-3 for the technician to come out and fix it. So by the end of all of this, 1/4 of the time I have had this TV will be in a broken state. NEVER again will I even consider this company for any product. I advise you to do the same and save yourself the hassle.

Reviews.Title: you get what you pay for and i paid for a pain in the butt
Reviews.Author: shan
Reviews.Content: After almost 4 months the tv just died. I tried to contact company and after 5 days finally spoke to someone who sent me to a level 2 which then said to email them and send receipt, then a day later was told they can't do warranty due to seller being a whole seller. I would advise not to buy this thinking the warranty will actually be of any use as I did.. I took matters into my own hands and contacted amazon who is paying to ship back and refunding me. The company is lying and false advertisement saying it can be warren tied at all!

Reviews.Title: Gift Ruined
Reviews.Author: JenKen
Reviews.Content: I had bought a T.V as a gift for my sister for her first house, and when she opened and install the T.V.,it didn't work at all, the buttons on the T.V. frame didn't work as well, there was no picture or sound. She called the technician, they couldn't help as well. I am so sad that my sister had to go through so much trouble to find out what is wrong with the T.V. that I bought as a gift for her :(

Reviews.Title: cant beat it
Reviews.Author: yazzam
Reviews.Content: I snatched one in Dec. 2011 when Amazon had some in stock. I went from a 27" CRT to this, so my review may be biased. Anyways, I was blown away when I first saw the picture, and I'm still lovin' it 5 months later! I've had no problems as of yet. You can't go wrong with it, if you're someone like me just looking for good picture, and not obsessed with TVs. Its 40 inches of 1080p. Sometimes I stare at it and wonder how I got it for $320.(sorry if it's out of stock guys...be patient)

Reviews.Title: under 350 bucks and amazing
Reviews.Author: S. Grieb
Reviews.Content: bought this to replace a dead old 18in lcd computer monoitorfor playing games watching streaming video it works better than i had hoped for.for the price ( $320 ish when i purchased it ) there was nothing even close to this.i can't comment on the audio .. i haven't tried it yet , i have this hooked up to my desktop via a hdmi cable from my geforce 460picture quality is great barely notice a difference in color when comparing to other computers 20in led monitor.firmware was up to date on the model i received and haven't had a single issue with it in the month i have owned it thus far.to get 1080p did have to take a whole 3 minutes to adjust the settings in the nvidia control panel otherwise it starts out right at 720p. after changing there never had to mess with it again. i did change the picutre to cinematic since this is in a bed room and it is more than bright enough.. even with the sun showing in the window there is no glare to be seen.shipping was fast ... and right on time sorta .. ups decided they wanted to try to deliver to the town home across the street.. so i had to wait til the next day (sadly even saw the guy walk over there with the smaller hdmi cable i purchased to go with the tv).. next day new delivery guy no problemsall in all for the purposes i have put this tv to it works like a dream.recomended to friends and would buy again.

Reviews.Title: NOT FOR PLAYSTATION 3 SLIM
Reviews.Author: review review review
Reviews.Content: The TV was what I expected. Like other review I noted that the base seems very cheaply made and has no swivel, but in my opinion a good sacrifice for a cheaper TV.  Has plenty of hook-ups for anyone.  The sound is not the best, but not the worst I have heard.  The sound will do for a small room.  But like other reviews have said, any TV could do with an external sound system.  My TV was not dead on arrival so no complaints there.  It also arrived very quickly, though the packaging seem damages and not very well done, this could be the delivery company or whoever packaged it.  My normal dvd player worked great with the tv.The PROBLEM I had was with my PlayStation Three.  I plugged it in and used the "hold the button" method to reset the output.  The PS3 located the TV's HDMI 1080p just fine.  But on the screen it was "snowy" dots all over the screen, and the sound did not work very well at all.  I switched the PS3 to 720p and it worked just fine, lower quality, but worked just fine.  The problem was not with the PS3 because I have been using it with other flat screens successfully.  So I decided to test the 1080p with a 1080p player.  Plugged it in and it had the same problem.  I did some research and sometimes slim PS3s don't work on every TV, so I do not know for sure that the TV was having a problem.  But because of the problem I had with it, I have returned it and I will save up for a different TV.As a note, Amazon was very fast in returning the TV.  So I rate Amazon A+++. This TV just would not work for me.

Reviews.Title: Great Value and Quality
Reviews.Author: rtscadd
Reviews.Content: I now understand why this TV is averaging 4.5 stars. I'll admit I had my reservations about buying the TCL brand TV but all I can say is that I am incredibly happy with the TV and all of its features. One thing that came as somewhat of a surprise is the built in guide that will only allow you to see the upcoming shows on the station you are watching but was again one of the added unknown benefits. Picture quality is comparable to even some of the professional series TVs that we have setup in our conference rooms at my work as well as other friends and family members homes. This is by far the best bang for your buck in terms of price and picture quality and I'd have no hesitation recommending this TV and the brand to any friend or family member.

Reviews.Title: TCL IS A GREAT ALTERNATIVE TO HIGH END TV'S
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: The sound is very good on this tv. The picture quality is also surprisingly good. Through research I found out that Samsung makes the screens. If this is true that would explain it. Takes some tweaking of the settings if your picky  if not between the multiple factory presets you'll find one for your taste. Great TV!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: DaveM
Reviews.Content: With some reluctance I purchased this "off-brand" TV.  Was originally going to get a Samsung or LG.  Turns out to be a fantastic TV!  Paid $299 with free shipping.  Still can't get over how vivid and clear the picture is.  TV was easy to set up and has plenty of HDMI inputs.  Even has an input for a computer which I recently hooked up to a laptop.  Also use with a Roku video streaming box.  Have everything going through a home theater system which works perfectly (HD and surround sound).  Only difficulty was getting the correct code for my Comcast remote control.  Called Comcast and they suggested a couple of codes, but they didn't work.  So I did a scan for the code and that worked.  I highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Better than the reviews state!!!
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: I have to admit this is my first flat screen television. I have always been skeptical about the durability of this type of TV. I read all the reviews (mostly good) about bad speaker quality and the TV's not working and needing firmware updates.I have to say that this TV is AWESOME!!! It took me all of 10 minutes to setup and configure the stations. I never had to install the firmware update or change any settings. The picture is great and the sound quality is awesome in my 12x24 bedroom. I am not sure what the complaints are about the sound but it is good and the TV looks sharp (12 model).I have also watched movies and football games on it with no problems. Sorry haven't tried video games.For anyone looking for a great TV or better yet a great TV with a low cost then you have to go with this one.

Reviews.Title: I like it so much, I just bought another one!!
Reviews.Author: Tessa Noel
Reviews.Content: We bought one of these when they were $299.  My hubby was kinda iffy on it only being 60hz (being the gamer he is), watching it for a few hours and then playing his shooting games on xbox, he can find nothing to complain about.  We like it so much that we just bought another one even though it's $30 more now.  Still a great price for this awesome tv!

Reviews.Title: What a Deal
Reviews.Author: William Ferguson "Big-Wheel"
Reviews.Content: First I was worried about this 40" LCD HDTV because I never heard of this brand (TCL).  Glad I bought it. Best TV, I owned so far. Clear Picture (1080p) and with a 2 Year Warranty. Price was only $259 with Free Next Day Shipping. Only owned this TV so far for 1 month and just love the size and picture.  No Problems what so ever. If I see this price again ($259) I would not hesitate to buy another.  Thanks for such a good deal Amazon... You are the best... A+++++

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly Pleased....
Reviews.Author: State of Michigan
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review for a product before, but I thought I would for this one.  I have been searching for a television for a minute--a long minute that is. I have read tons of reviews here and on other websites.  I had seen this television many times here on Amazon - and had read the reviews too, but because I was not familar with the brand... I continued my search. One day I revisited the site to review the television again, the price had increased and so had the purchase number; I decision to read the current reviews again "good and bad" ones.  Finally, on Jan. 14, 2012, I decided to try it out.  I knew if I had a "DOA" model I could return it...So I rolled the dice and took a chance...  When I received it...the pic was on analog cable ...it was fuzzy ...just not good. So I went to my cable company and hooked up some "real cable" with "HD" capability.  Now, the picture is beautiful...clear and vibrant.  The sound is fine too. Picure quality is just as good as my Vizio and Samsung. I really love this TV. I would give it "5 stars" but it does not have all the functions I would like.  But, for the price, and for the functions it does have, It's well worth the "4 stars" I gave it.  Hopefully, it will last past the 6 months someone else stated early in the reviews...LoL ...Nonetheless, I am very happy with the purchase.  Hopefully, this review will help someone make that final decision to purchase and try it out. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: A very solid TV for an excellent price.
Reviews.Author: S. Thomson
Reviews.Content: The TV itself looks good and had no damage to it, or the screen when it arrived.  The box was falling apart at the bottom and I had to help the FedEx guy bring in the box.  The package arrived a day later than Amazon had predicted.Tv Looks:  5 StarsIt's a good looking TV.  It's thicker than you would expect.  The base of the stand is made of glass, but is sturdy.  Attaching the base seems a little off.  You have to screw in the 4 screws up through the bottom of the stand.  The screws themselves seem Janky and out of place, but are not visible once set up and seem to attach the base well.  The shiny black plastic around the TV looks nice in contrast with the silver lining the bottom of the TV.  The black tempered glass bass fits well and is plenty large enough to hold the TV firmly.TV Picture:  5 Stars (For the price)It's a pretty good picture with the help of calibrating from those that have reviewed this TV before.  It's 60Hz which you will notice with sports and movies but the overall 1080p does look a lot better than 720p.  DVD's look good (The Dark Night), cable looks like cable should, and the Wii looks just like the product it is.  Netflix looks better on this TV for some reason.  The darks are just dark enough.TV Set up:  4 StarsPlenty of quality inputs make it a breeze to get up and running.  The base is pretty easy to install.  Calibrating is easy thanks to the lack of options that a higher end TV would offer.  The actual TV setup process is quick and easy.  The base screws (silver and cheap) should be black and strong to match the TV's aesthetics, and a few more options for the TV picture calibration would have been nice.  Maybe a "gaming" option for screen picture would have been nice, but "Cinematic" looks fineTV Sound: 4 StarsThe TV for a flat screen actually doesn't sound as bad as I expected.  The speakers are downward firing and though they lack bass, they sound clear and get loud enough.  The thickness of the TV probably allows for bigger speakers.  Compared to other flat screens, it sounds as good as the others, but not great.  Get a surround sound....Overall I'm very happy for the money.  It looks and sounds better than what you would expect from a 40" LCD Tv for the price.  I highly recommend.This is comparing it to:LG Scarlet 42"Sony 40"LG Plasma 50"That we use in the house.  Picture compares well, and is a great bargain find.

Reviews.Title: Best Deal in Television
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing deal for a 40 inch LCD. Reviews here are all either love or hate on this item, which left me a little worried when I made my purchase. I took the plunge as the price is unparalleled anywhere and it is from Amazon's fulfillment center. I know first hand how great Amazon is for returns. I felt absolutely confident that if I got the lemon, a return would be hassle free. And from the reviews it kind of seems to be a crap shoot whether you get the functional or non functional one. When they work no one has any complaints, so I crossed my fingers and waited for it to arrive.The FedEx driver asked me to come out to the van and decide if I wanted to accept the delivery a the package was damaged which worried me. Damage seemed superficial to package and trusting Amazon's excellent customer service I accepted package. And luckily mine is perfectly functional. This experience, however, leads me to think MANY of the issues with this TV that have been reported on reviews, may very well stem from FedEx employee's heavy handed treatment of TV when they unload it from planes and load it onto trucks, etc. But who knows on that score.I only have two issues on this tv. I have purchased two antenna's for it and have been unable to receive ANY reception. I previously had a computer monitor hooked up to my Roku and Bluray, so I never watched broadcast television. Since this is an actual TV I figured I'd go ahead and check out broadcast television after a many year hiatus, but mine will not receive reception. I live in a city and can find no reason why two separate antenna's would fail to function. But as I am already accustomed to life without broadcast TV, I don't find it an adequate reason for the fuss of an exchange. But I do find it an adequate reason to give it 4 stars instead of five.My second complaint is that some older DVD's look appalling on this screen. So pixelated and grainy, it seems lower quality than a VHS tape. I tried these DVD's in both blu-ray and Xbox and reduced image to 480, which did not help. Though this is not necessarily a fault of the television, it is worth noting that upgrading your hardware may also necessitate upgrading your software. Otherwise my bluray discs and my Xbox games look FANTASTIC. Gaming is significantly improved with clarity of image and large size of screen.Good luck on your purchase! Just cross your fingers and repeat "No whammies! No whammies! No whammies!"

Reviews.Title: Best 40" for the price!
Reviews.Author: Keith L "Keith L."
Reviews.Content: I had debated for a few days whether or not I wanted to take a chance on this set. I am glad I did! While I have not quite tuned the picture completely to my liking, within 10 minutes, I have it pretty close. I set the zoom to no overscan as has been mentioned in previous posts to get the full picture, and set the standard "V" equalizer for the audio.This particular set was bought as a secondary set for TV viewing, as well as the primary set for Xbox and Wii gaming. I am quite impressed.For the low star reviews, I would say that in any piece of electronic equipment, there will be a few that fail out of the box, and some that fail within the first 90 days. It is just a matter of how well the return is handled. I cannot attest to that, and hopefully will not have to. My has been operational the past week and I believe it can keep pace with a set twice the price. And with a 2 year warranty, I do not worry about not getting my moneys worth!

Reviews.Title: LOVE this TV!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd LCD TV, the first being a 26 inch LG that's in my bedroom, that cost $300 and was a bargain at the time it was purchsed. To think that I got this TV delivered to my door for $299 total is insane! I absolutely love it. The picture is fantastic. (I will say I had to use it for a day without HDMI cables cause I was waiting for them to be delivered- the picture was CRAP before the HDMI cables were hooked up) but afterwards, all I have to say is WOW! Its also very easy to configure your picture settings (brightness, contrast, etc) how you want them. I have no complaints about the sound (in fact I think it sounds great) or anything else. The glass stand looks very nice too.  I really am 100% satisfied with this TV and can't believe I somehow got it for only $299.  What a fantastic deal and great addition to my living room! Would buy again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: Completely Satisfied & What a deal!
Reviews.Author: John Boggs
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews on this TCL 40 inch TV before I bought it. I was attracted by the low price of $319 inc. shipping for a 40 inch HDTV.SHIPPING:Shipping was VERY impressively speedy. I ordered January 3rd and 48 hours later it arrived.SET UPI had it out of the box, connected to the stand, plugged in and hooked up, scanned for available channels and was watching TV all within about 10 minutes.PICTURE QUALITYThe picture is indeed stunning - bright, crisp, and clear. I got it for our basement, but liked it so much that it went to our bedroom instead.REMOTEThe remote is nice and easy to use and includes a "Guide" button which displays TV programs and times (a nice feature I didn't have on my other two TVs)HOOK UPSI hooked it up to our DVD player for a quick test and it worked great.Hooked up a "Rabbit Ears" antenna and it brought in 8 stations (ABC, CBS, FOX, etc.) Again, picture quality is stunning. Haven't tried all the hook-ups yet, but I'm not worried.WHY BUY?I've been watching TV deals online and at stores for awhile now and I read ALL the reviews for this one before I went for it. Here's why I bought it:  1. The price is unmatched anywhere.  2. The majority of the positive reviews are VERY positive in what they said and most negative reviews were because of DOA issues.  What "sold" me was Amazon's wonderful highly rated return policy which reassured my that if I did get a "dud" I wouldn't be out of luck.I've only had it for two days, so time will tell how good this deal really was in the long run, but for now, I really don't have anything negative to note. I would happily buy another one and would have no hesitation highly recommending it to others.LATER: I've had the TV for three weeks now and I like it just as much now as I did the day I bought it - maybe more as it is starting to be a little bit tested.

Reviews.Title: Really good for the money.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: OK, I just got it today, a few days earlier than expected. FedEx was very nice and helped my daughter bring it in, as I was away at the time.Set up was very easy. Re-arranging my entertainment center was hard.The connections were easy to set up. At first, my DVD player was not getting captions. The manual mentioned that HDMI-connected devices would not be captioned unless the device had the captioning built in. I took out the HDMI cable and connected it up via composite connections, and the captioning returned.***Did the firmware update. Ran into problems. I followed their directions exactly, giving a bit more time when it said to wait. All the screens that appeared were exactly as depicted. When it said it was complete, I waited about 15 seconds before removing the USB drive and turning it off. The blue "on" light came back on, but nothing else did. I could not turn it off or on, the remote would not work, the buttons on the TV would not work. Tried many combinations to no avail.RESOLVED: Turned it off. Waited 10 seconds. Put the USB drive back in, turned it on.Blue "on" light started blinking. After a few seconds, the remote was able to turn it back off, but not back on again. Unplugged, waited 10 seconds, plugged it back in, got the TCL logo, now it works. Had me scared for a bit, I thought I had killed it.***I tried the sound set up that another reviewer had posted. It does seem to help the sound. Still doesn't sound great, and I will probably run it through the good amp and speakers.4 stars because it really has no special features. It does have a USB port, but only plays media (I saw another that would let you pause streaming video by buffering it to a USB drive). No SRS sound or any other cool goodies. But the picture is very good, and viewable from waaaay off center. 178 degrees seems right. Lots of inputs, more than I needed. Also because of the firmware problem, even though I got it fixed. I do hope that if someone else has this problem, it helps them to resolve it.If I run into any other problems, I will come back and edit this. I will also edit this when I hear back from customer service. I have heard that they are pretty good.Yes, I would recommend this TV to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Great Item, Great Price
Reviews.Author: A. Hu
Reviews.Content: Pros:- CHEAP! (for it's screen size)- Quality a lot better than expected!- EASY setup (Took no more than 10 minutes to set up, plug in, scan, and watch [see review under for more details).- Energy Saver! (Estimated yearly savings is a lot lower on this TV than many others [or so they claim).- 3 HDMI ports, one on the side (HDMI port 2), a USB port on the side, and many other plug ports in the back.- GLASS stand instead of plastic (as people have stated the past model of this TV had either a plastic or metal stand).Cons:- Wider than most flat screen TVs; about 1 and 6/8 inches wide (excluding the rounding part on the very back), considerably, but no overwhelmingly, wider than most.*- Will update if anything wrong comes up with the TV; along with the time frame of when it happened / how far from the purchasing point.Highly Recommend this product for those of you in need of a cheap, yet decent (if not, good/great) TV, with 3 HDMI ports. I will update if anything wrong comes up. More details in the review under this.So I was a little skeptical about purchasing this TV initially after reading a lot of reviews about negative aspects (such as the TV not turning on at all, blanking out, horrid customer service, etc.). Despite this, (as the same as a lot of the products I purchase from Amazon), I figured that with the price (I bought it at $300) for a 40" being very reasonable, I thought that I'd go ahead and try this TV out; and boy was that a great choice.The TV was supposed to arrive on the 29th, but it arrived on the 28th (props to Amazon for the speedy shipment; Amazon Prime), so that was a plus. When I opened the box, I was pretty surprised to see that the TV was a little wider than I had expected; the TV was about 1 and 6/8th (approximately) inches wide, excluding the rounding back area, which is considerably wider than most LCD's nowadays. Ex; My Samsung 46" is a lot thinner, nearly half as thin as this. Despite this, I was not too disappointed about the width. As for the set up:The setup was relatively fast, and easy. To set it up, you simply had to take the TV out, place it on a carpet (or the flattened box) upside-down, place the glass stand in it's place, and screw it in. Yes, Glass stand which is a lot better than the plastic ones I've heard the past TCL televisions obtained. Screwing in the glass stand took no more than 2 minutes, and my TV was in place within minutes.Another plus about this television is that, compared with a lot of other Televisions that are 40-46" + 1080p, this TV has 3 HDMI ports (from my knowledge [considering the price as well], most have 2 HDMI ports), including one on the side with a USB port included. Plugging in my cable box was also quick and easy, as it took less than 1 minute to simply screw it in. Now for when the TV was turned on;After turning the TV on, I was prompted to pick a few settings. The TV channel surfing was rather quick to my pleasure (I'd say about 3 minutes or so), and my TV was ready to watch in 4-5 minutes (Grand total of 10 minutes or less to Set up and watch my TV). Initially, I was disappointed with the picture quality, but after browsing through the TV settings, I noticed that the Television was in ECO mode for picture, and after switching to Vibrant, the quality was fantastic! The sound was also clear, I had no problems and had no need to update firmware as past reviewers have stated doing so.As the final test, I plugged in my PS3, and for the first time, used the HDMI cable to get the best quality I could get. Simply plugged everything in, plugged in the HDMI cable, switched to HDMI 2 (which is the HDMI port on the side of the TV), and my PS3 was ready instantly. Overall this TV is great, so far I have had no problems with it, and I highly recommend this TV for those of you with a budget, yet are in need of a decent, if not good, TV. I will update if anything wrong comes up.

Reviews.Title: Great TV. Unbeatable price
Reviews.Author: Beerlvr01
Reviews.Content: I have been looking around for a 40 inch flat screen for my bedroom. The price for 40 inch seems higher then 42 inch most of the time. My space is limited so I had to have a 40 inch. I found this TCL brand on amazon and I was a bit worried about buying it since I have never heard of the name. After reading most of the reviews I bought one. Ordered it late Thursday night and had it up and running saturday morning. Fedex shipping was great. Mine turned right on and has been on for 6 hours now whitout a problem. I did download and install the latest firmwware update and it was really simple. As for sound, a lot of people complain the sound is not good. If you are trying to blow away a 30 by 30 room with sound from a TV...Good luck. But the sound on this is better then I expected becasue it has an equalizer that you can ajust and it fills my bedroom with ample sound. If you want kick butt sound get a home theater system and pay for it. I have a 48 inch Sharp Aquos in another room and the TCL looks just as good. Know your hook ups and know what you are looking for. This TV is a great buy at $303.98 shipped to my door.2 weeks later... TV on about 5 hours a day with no problems. The only problem I see is I have my input to HDMI1 and if the TV is off for a long time, I have to select that input before I see a picture. I think it should remember your last setting and keep it. I will keep updating.

Reviews.Title: Definitely worth the price...
Reviews.Author: stoberto
Reviews.Content: I, like many others, took a chance on this tv because of the price. I was a little nervous, but felt like I couldn't go wrong with Amazon's return policy. I just received it, and so far am very pleased.Pros: You really can get a good picture working with the settings. There are moments that you can tell it isn't pristine, but the picture is as good as any tv close to this price range that you would see hanging on the wall in a big box store. The design is fairly low profile and modern, and the remote is fine. Obviously the price for the size is a plus.Cons: The sound is pretty poor in my opinion. Before using the EQ it's awful, so thank goodness that setting is available. After the custom EQ it is bearable, but I have some bookshelf speakers hooked up that I will probably use 99% of the time. And again, there are moments when things look a little washed out...I'm not an expert but it seems like when there is a brighter background you lose a little definition.Overall, don't be scared to buy the tv. Only time will tell about the durability, but initially I am very pleased with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Quality for the price can't be beat.
Reviews.Author: Joseph Wagner
Reviews.Content: First, this TV looks great.  The picture doesn't do it justice.  Second, it works perfectly.  I downloaded the firmware update from tclusa.com support area and installed it on the TV.  It was simple and took about 10 minutes from when I visited the site to when the TV was updated.  You need a USB flash drive to put the update on.  There are simple instructions on the TCL download page for the update.I paid $319 for the TV and for that price there is no better TV.  I spent about a month shopping around and I am happy I purchased this one.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Bryan Crnarich
Reviews.Content: I got this TV as the Gold Box deal and couldn't be happier. I mostly use this TV for the XBOX and Wii and the picture is fantastic. I only have standard "screw-in-the-wall" cable on this TV, so I won't be able to comment on the picture quality on that front. Well worth the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: Really great TV for the price.
Reviews.Author: Cory M. Hull "Martin Rabe"
Reviews.Content: I have not had any issues with this TCL HDTV since I bought it last Christmas.  It has been really great despite the off brand look to it.  If you want a big TV for a third of the price.  Go with this.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: denise
Reviews.Content: GREAT TV -  Had it for a year! Great Picture adapts to game systems- streaming capabilities- Purfect picture- could not be happier with my choice, Gonna buy another one!

Reviews.Title: Very pleased.
Reviews.Author: navajoe7071
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my son for Christmas. I had it sitting in the closet till Christmas morning and to be honest was a little worried that it would not work properly, since it was a brand I had never heard of before. I was surprised to see that this TV was a good as the Toshiba I have in my bedroom. Very pleased with the product and would recommend it to anyone for the money. It is a great value for a 1080p LCD, for almost half the price for a name brand LCD. I would recommend this to anyone who doesn't have to have a brand named product.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money
Reviews.Author: clw
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV on Dec. 23, 2011 on Amazon's deal of the day for less than $300.  The picture, sound quality and color quality is great.  I got it shipped to me in one day for $9.99 and had it set up and running by Christmas Eve.  My entire family watched the Packer game on it on Christmas Day and couldn't believe how little I paid for a television with such outstanding picture quality.  Definitely a keeper.

Reviews.Title: One good one, one dead one
Reviews.Author: Al
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these for a new vacation condo and it worked well--easy to assemble, except it's a little hard to turn the screws used to attach the base-- which is a very nice base, and easy to set up.  I liked the value well enough to buy a second one for upstairs.  Wasn't so lucky the second time. Hauled it up a narrow staircase, assembled it, and pushed remote's on button. Nothing. TV was dead on arrival. I think the problem must be fairly common, and I don't think the manufacturer wanted to deal with it.  The representative I talked to immediately knew what the problem was, said that if I didn't want to return the TV to Amazon, he would first send me the part needed to fix it, which would take two weeks to arrive, then I could make an appointment with their repairman to put the part in {no charge}.  So if you order one of these and it fails within the Amazon return period, all you have to do is take it apart, repackage it, and send it back to Amazon, who will have UPS pick it up.  If you have a problem that requires service from the manufacturer, I hope you have better luck than I had.  I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Great Value but temper your expectations
Reviews.Author: Ken "Ken"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for $259.99 w/ the $9.99 overnight shipping.  It was an incredible deal -- too good to pass up.However, I think for people who are considering buying this TV, my advice to you is to temper your expectations.Sure, this is a nice, simple TV -- easy to set up, easy to install, fairly lightweight, and looks decent enough.  BUT, it's not a Samsung or a name brand and that means you should not try to compare it's features to that of a $1000+ LCD TV.Seriously folks, those of you comparing this TCL 40" with a Samsung 40" are out of your minds.  This is a $259.99 TV!  What you get for this price is GREAT.  It's a 1080p, 40", new (not a refurb), and has a 2-year warranty.  I can't comment on the warranty part but most TV's come with only a 1-year warranty.The picture is great but there is some motion blur when there is a lot of movement on the screen.  Also, you'll have to adjust the settings quite a bit.  They have several pre-set modes such as Sports, Cinematic, Natural, ECO, etc.  However, depending on what channel you're watching, it's a bit of a pain to keep switching picture modes.For example, if I'm watching an NBA game, the "Sports" mode is clearly better and more clear to watch than let's say -- the cinematic mode.  And if you're watching a movie on Cable, you probably want to use the Cinematic mode rather than the Sports mode because it'll be easier on your eyes.  It's definitely a bit of a pain to keep having to switch.  As far as I can tell, there's no "one-mode-fits-all" type of settings for the picture settings.  I believe this is one of the weaknesses of the TV and the reason why the TV manufacturer TCL decided to pre-set the different picture modes in the first place.  It's a good effort to mitigate the issue but still a bit annoying nonetheless.In any case, the bottom line is -- this is a $259.99 TV.  For that kind of price, you're getting a steal.  There are weaknesses such as lack of a one-size-fits-all picture setting, some motion blurs and the sound is average (at best) when compared to a premium TV like a mid-high end Samsung, but for the price, it's a terrific TV that I would highly recommend if you're looking for a bargain.Hope this helps some of you folks.

Reviews.Title: Hauled this baby across the country and it's running fine.
Reviews.Author: J.Steve
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV about 2 years ago and it's the best TV I ever bought.  Not sure if it's still a good buy but at the time it was a steal for the price.  High Def channels look amazing, it's tough to imagine them being any cleaner on another screen.  Really just no complaints about this TV whatsoever.  Plenty of HDMI ports etc.  My one recommendation would be that the TV should make some type of startup sound because it's occasionally not clear whether or not you've successfully turned it on after pushing the power button so on rare occasions you'll mistakenly turn it back off not realizing that your first command registered.  If this sounds trivial to the point that you won't notice or care then it is.

Reviews.Title: Good for me
Reviews.Author: Jade-Roy Huntington
Reviews.Content: Had a small LED tv before this and just needed something bigger. This does not have the exact same picture quality as that LED tv but the size makes up for it, great tv.

Reviews.Title: Whoo Whee... Fantastic Product Deal
Reviews.Author: PacBoi
Reviews.Content: Bought Dec 2011. Still going, no problemo!!And thats with use as a TV, Computer monitor, games screen. By 2 adults and 3 kids. Daily! - tough, well built for the price ($260 - Intro offer).On the following keep in mind that it's in relation to the price paidPic quality great!Functions - greatInputs - HDMI, PC, RF - greatSound - GreatLooks/Quality - greatRemote- GreatOnly thing that would have improved it would have been a swivel stand (it comes with a fixed stand) but there are creative ways to take care o' dat!Fantastic Product!! Thoroughly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: Good Customer Service, Bad Product
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "unkongab"
Reviews.Content: This TV lasted about 19 months and was working just fine when one day vertical red lines started showing up on the screen. I called customer care and I talked to someone, went through a few troubleshooting measures to no avail, about a week later they sent a box for me to ship it to get repaired. They called me a few days ago and told me that the TV could not be fixed so they were going to send me another one in a few days. Customer service so far has been good but the product has been disappointing.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY ANYTHING FROM TCL.  WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER.
Reviews.Author: Mark Heintzelman
Reviews.Content: I bought a TCL TV from Amazon that had a 2 year warranty.  After about a year the TV started to have blurred lines on the left side of the screen.  TCL asked me to send in a picture of the TV so their tech can see the blurred lines.  I sent in the picture and they told me that the TV had been hit with something and that is why the screen is out so they have to void my warranty.  I told them that no one hit the screen and that they could not possibly know that from looking at a picture.  At some point through all of this I was transferred from TCL to A&D; Electronics, LLC.  So I sent Suzann Larson a video of the TV and the screen showing that it was in fact not damaged on 7/9/2013.  In this email I asked her to review the video and let me know when we can expect a replacement TV.  On 7/23/2013 I had not received a response.  So I sent Suzann another email asking her for an update.  That day she wrote me back and said she couldn't open the video so I sent her another one in a different format.  She said she would check with IT about what format they needed the video in.  On 8/5/2013  after not hearing back from her, I wrote another email asking for her supervisor's email address.  I then get a call from a Jolene at viziotvparts.com.  I have no idea if she is with TCL, A&D;, or where.  She tells me that the picture that I sent to TCL from the very beginning shows that the TV is damaged.  I tell her that the TV is not damaged and that I sent a video showing just that.  She told me that they can't view videos on their computers.  I am waiting to hear back from her but I don't expect it to be anytime soon.  The warranty will be up in December and it feels like they are just pushing me off until the warranty is in fact over.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality. Forget about 2 year Warranty, it's useless.
Reviews.Author: Iggy
Reviews.Content: I have 40" LCD TCL TV, it stopped working (won't even turn on), after very little use for 9 months. Called TCL TV they escalated my issue to A&D; Electronics LLC (TCL's 3rd party vendor that handles their warranty repairs). The day I called them I was promised replacement parts shipped to my home in 1 week, then a technician will come and repair the TV. Its been over 3 months, no parts, no technician, no fixed TV. Each time I call them I'm told I'll receive the parts in 7 days, our shipment is in customs, your parts haven't shipped from China, our warehouse has your parts, someone will call/email you, etc... Clearly lies, how can customs have the parts if they haven't been shipped from China? How can they ship parts in 7 days if they haven't shipped them yet? Reading TCL and A&D; Electronics reviews it has become clear that this is their standard practice. Delay hoping the customer just stops after a while. If you want to purchase this or any TCL products don't do it because of the 2yr warranty, they don't honor it. Their TVs seem to be of poor quality, died after just a few months. Once TCL TV escalates it to A&D; they don't assist you at all, they just refer you to A&D.;Update:I filed complaints with BBB & CA BEAR (California Bureau of Electronic Appliance Repair, Home Furnishings and Thermal Insulation). It took complaints with BBB & CA BEAR and over 6 months for A&D;+TCL to finally fix it. I had to ship it to them to get it fixed. The TV did comeback with 1 dead pixel, some scratches on the TV body, and missing screws. I can live with that because I didn't think the TV would ever work again after the service I received from TCL and their warranty firm A&D.; Hopefully this lasts until a few more 4k TVs hit the market so I can buy a 4k to replace this.After my experience with this TV, I wouldn't buy or recommend any TCL products.

Reviews.Title: chalk one up for the trees
Reviews.Author: dabrwo74
Reviews.Content: I have an amazing new development in the ineffective 3 month long repair of my 40" tcl.  After 2 weeks of waiting for a return box to ship my tv back in, I called tcl (since they obviously weren't gonna call me).  I was told the delay was due to................................................wait for it...........................................wait for it............................................no boxes were available. I repeat no boxes.  The company that makes tvs and ships them out to people have no boxes.  Since being told this every time I walk by a tree I can hear it secretly snickering.  Their like "Hey there's the guy that needs a box, NOT TODAY mister. There will be no boxes today. We (the trees) can finally live in peace knowing there will be no more boxes shipped by tcl."  So chalk one up for the trees. They have had a hard fought battle but they have finally won. No more trees need worry about being savagely cut down, which severely effects their mental stability, sent to a paper processing plant and shaped into 40" tcl boxes. Trees 1 David(me) 0. Final score.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: grace10
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV because my roommate was moving out and taking her TV with her.  She had a 42" Samsung.  While I definitely noticed the quality difference, it wasn't anything that would make me shell out the extra money.  The TV does take some time to switch on and the sound isn't the best.  However, I've had this for 10 months now, and the quality is still the same and I've had no problems with it.  Also, It's light to handle, which comes in handy when you're moving.  I would definitely recommend this to anyone who enjoys watching TV, but doesn't want to spend a lot on it.

Reviews.Title: 6 weeks for repair/new unit and worst customer service ever!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: angelak
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv in feb of this year. Within 5 months the screen went out. I contacted TCL and was referred to their repair company as higher level incident. For a couple days I was unable to speak with anyone (got hung up on about 4 times). Once I was able to talk to someone they went through the whole process of turn tv off and back on, unplug units etc. Nothing worked. So they informed me they would be sending a return box to me immediately so they could get it in for repair. Almost 2 weeks later a box shows up, after calling and finding out that my order had been cancelled and they needed to reenter it. Once I got the box I figured out how to package it (not that great of instructions or materials). They did not send return label for FedEx to pickup so I had to squeeze in my car and take to postal office myself. Pretty awesome! Once they received it they said would be couple days to repair and they would ship back. A week passes with no sign of tv so I call and they inform me that they can not figure it out and that they will send me new unit instead. I thought "Great, that is nice" but was too good to be true. After waiting another week and no tv I call and they informed me they were waiting on new units to be shipped to them and would prob. take another week. Another week passes and no tv so I call and what a surprise, somehow my file did not show that new unit would be shipped, instead it was waiting for a panel that they informed me would take about 60-90 days!!!!! but don't worry they said we will send a new one as soon as they come in which now was another week. Just received my TV today and in no way is this a brand new unit. The border is completely scratched up and screen looks to have scratches also. So now waiting almost month and a half I now have a scratched and what appears to be used tv. I know price seems like a great deal but it is not worth the hassle. I will definitely be returning this all together and paying the extra at Best Buy or other retailer that can take care of their customers and guarantee their products!!!

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected...
Reviews.Author: xtragr8ful "Laura"
Reviews.Content: I received this as a gift December 2011 and since that time I have not been exceptionally happy with the picture. It looks as if the picture distorts and it does not look crisp. I recently realized that it is supposed to be a 1080p and this television is a 720p resolution. I have also become aware of a pin sized mark on the screen. I was told that I should have returned it immediately as a result of this defect alone but it did not bother me that much. However, I would not purchase this television again and I do not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Having Problems
Reviews.Author: HarleyPark
Reviews.Content: TV comes on as if it  was set for a timer , we have followed all suggestions and we cannot disable the timer

Reviews.Title: It's like a Samsung - at half the price (literally)
Reviews.Author: Fish
Reviews.Content: I snagged this for $299, where it appeared to be for a long time. TCL contract manufacturers some base model Samsung TV's - and if you look in the back grille, you can see the Samsung logo on the panel. This thing - for intents and purposes - a Samsung. No, the on-screen menus are not Samsung beautiful, they're simple and clear.There are several inputs, the remote works great. Picture quality is really good (little bit of light bleed on the corners noticeable when dark, but not bad at all). Sound is okay. The really stunning thing is the build quality. The base is metal and glass. The speaker grates area actually metal. There is a piano-black high gloss plastic for the bezel. Really great. It's 4" deep - not as thin as some - similar though to my Panasonic Viera LCD of similar vintage.It won't stack up against $1000 sets, they'll obviously look nicer. Compared with $600 sets though, this is every bit as good - with a 2-year warranty thrown in for free - and a much better price.TCL made RCA's for Walmart - and you can use the RCA codes on universal remotes for these.I could not recommend this thing enough.

Reviews.Title: TV broke after 3 months, horrible customer service
Reviews.Author: kimberlym "Kim"
Reviews.Content: We received this TV Jan 31, it worked great, easy to set up and picture was good.  Sound was so so but acceptable for the price.  Less than 90 days later the TV went to a black and white screen then would not show anything.  Thankful for the 2 year warranty I called customer service.  After being sent to several different "levels"of customer service where I had to completely restate the problem and give all my info  I was asked to send in pictures of the screen.  I then had to mail the TV to a Riverside, CA repair facility, AD Electronics, as the repair facility listed on the TCL website in my town had never heard of TCL.  After a couple weeks I emailed to ask about the status of the repair and was told the TV was unrepairable and I would be getting a new one sent shortly, it had been ordered and would go out the next week.  The next day I received a TCL TV on my doorstep, however this TV had gouges in the speakers and several scratches on the screen.  It also had a sticker on the box saying it was a refurbished device and came with a 1 year warranty.  Well my original TV had over a year and a half left on the warranty so I was not happy about that either.  My TV was less than 90 days old when it broke and I wanted a new one, or at the very least a refurbished model in good condition .  I immediately called the repair facility who asked me to send photos of the damaged TV- the girl I spoke to was very nice, apologized and said she would send the photos and the info to upper management.  It has now been almost 6 weeks and I have tried to contact them with no response what so ever.  I did not want to write a bad review, I wanted my TV to be repaired or replaced but that has not happened.  Beware when buying this product!  I would not purchase from them again and feel that I have been completely ripped off.

Reviews.Title: Terrible customer service with warranty
Reviews.Author: dcdubina
Reviews.Content: Within 3 months of buying the TV, it was not functioning properly. For the past month I have recieved the run around being transferred from person to person and still awaiting directions for sending my TV back to be fixed or recieve a new one. Terrible way to run a company, hopefully my experience has been an exception and not the rule, but I wanted to post my story. I will avoid buying TCL in the future.

Reviews.Title: 40" TCL
Reviews.Author: djpdorf
Reviews.Content: Purchased thru Amazon in Jan. 2012, the clock won't stay on time+ automatic turn on keeps coming on, when I have disabled. Called a couple, 3 times, and was told to down load update for this unit. That was done and tried, TV will NOT accept te down load,tried several ways What next??? Call on phone and wait & wait some more!!

Reviews.Title: Don't be scared of the no name brand!
Reviews.Author: Inspiring Insomnia
Reviews.Content: I was very late to the HD world, but when I saw this 40" TV was a $260 lightning deal in December 2011, I had to buy it.  Five months later, I'm still incredibly pleased.  The picture is crisp and clear after some tinkering based on other reviewers' recommendations.  The sound is good, not great, but perfectly acceptable in this price range.  I bought Panasonic DMP-BDT220 Integrated Wi-Fi 3D Blu-ray DVD Player and AmazonBasics High-Speed HDMI Cable (6.5 Feet/2.0 Meters) - Supports Ethernet, 3D, and Audio Return [Newest Standard] to use with the TV, and I regularly use it to watch movies with my Netflix and Amazon Prime accounts.The base was easy to connect by myself.  In fact, the only problem I encountered was when programming it with my Time Warner cable box.  The TW guide, with many (perhaps hundreds of) manufacturers, did not list TCL.  So, yes, TCL is pretty obscure.  But I took a risk on a no name brand, and I'm so glad that I did.

Reviews.Title: Bad Color and Dead pixel after only 1 month
Reviews.Author: Amanda Forsberg
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the great reviews on this TV, I had to get it and I must say I was disappointed.  Maybe I just got a lemon?  The picture isn't clear and is very dark despite changing the settings.  I bought this on February 7th and within a month I had a dead pixel right in the middle of the screen!  It's so annoying!  I have not yet contacted customer service because I have been very busy, and I will update this review if they fix the issues.

Reviews.Title: 2nd times a charm
Reviews.Author: DR
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV despite some of the comments about it coming DOA. The price was just too good to pass up. My tv set up just fine and looks great! The only issue was that it would decide to turn on, on its own. After confirming it was doing this daily I contact Amazon and they sent replacement and picked up the old tv with no problem. I have had the new set for a few months with no problems whatsoever. I hope it stays that way because it is a great tv!

Reviews.Title: Screen Flickers Black then turns Back On...
Reviews.Author: Mon
Reviews.Content: I bought TCL L40FHDF12TA 40-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LCD HDTV with 2-Year Warranty (Electronics) in January there have been no problems until yesterday twice. I saw in the forums it was a past model issue the screen flickers for a second goes black then comes back on I emailed TCL with the problem nothing yet. Is there a firmware update for this model? I was worried about ordering online. I hope this gets fixed soon I don't want to have to return the TV and buy one local...I contacted BBB about TCL and finally got a response from TCL. I told them I didn't haven't the time to spend hours on the phone and wanted email. Nothing happened, its a handshaking problem my TV is having the solution I've seen online is a firmware update which they aren't doing. Amazon offered to take the TV back, I think  is good customer service but what will I use in the meantime waiting for my refund. The TV works for now, the handshaking happens every other week and so I might not buy another TV online. Amazon's customer service is really good its too bad these other companies aren't but they should if they want to sell their products.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Gnomer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV in December of 2011, and I really like it! I was uneasy about purchasing a brand that that I had never heard of before, but it has been money well spent.Picture:Sharp images, vibrant colors, and nice back lighting. I have done a lot of fiddling to get the calibration right, but I can generally get it to the right place depending on the movie and room lighting.Sound:I live in an apartment, so I generally keep my TV rather low. So, the sound has been fine for me. However, I did find that with one movie with particularly poor sound quality, I could not get the volume up high enough, but I think this was due more to the movie than the TV.As far as the quality -- it could be better. You probably will not get all of the nuances that you would with a nice speaker system. I have managed to resolve this issue by running the sound through my computer which has Dolby surround and headphones.Inputs:I primarily use a single HDMI port to connect the TV to my laptop. Perhaps it would be ideal to have wireless connectivity, but I can live with this setup for the cost.This TV really is a bargain! I bought it knowing that I had 30 days to return it, and I was fairly certain that I would need to. Now here it is 4 months later, and I am still very happy with this TV.I have not attempted to contact warranty support, so I cannot comment on that issue. I hope they will be helpful if I do need to contact them, but I made my purchase with the knowledge that I may not actually have a real warranty.

Reviews.Title: Happy with TV
Reviews.Author: Becalyn
Reviews.Content: Purchased for $329 Jan 2012 with free shipping.  I read multiple Amazon reviews of this product (even the bad DOA ones) and decided to purchase even though I'd never heard of this brand before, mainly because of the 2-yr warranty and the customer service described by others when they needed to use the warranty.SHIPPINGTV arrived ultra-promptly.  Purchased late night on a Wed, arrived via FedEx Fri.  I wasn't expecting it so soon, I had free super-saver shipping and wasn't expecting it for 1-2 weeks as I live in the mid-west.PACKAGINGI was concerned about purchasing such a large TV over the internet and having it shipped but the TV was well-secured and heavy-duty-cardboard boxed.  Nothing was broken or scratched.  2 large yellow thick-plastic-type straps were secured around the box which made it easier to carry.  The straps didn't dent the cardboard much which showed how solid the cardboard was.ASSEMBLYOnly thing needing to be assembled was putting the glass stand on the TV.  Took just a couple minutes with the screws that came with it.  It's nicely-sized and thicker glass so it worked well.  I ended up mounting it on the wall so took the stand off ultimately.OPERATIONI like this TV.  I'm not a big electronics guru that has to have the latest stuff so the easy plug n play feature was great for me:  movies on DVD, antenna cord hookup, Atari Flashback, and headphones are all I needed to plug in.  I like the various input/output options too...you can hookup on the side or in the back of the TV (as shown by the Amazon.com pictures).The visual and audio are great.  I sit about 12-15 feet from the TV and I get a clear picture and sound.  I can change the picture mode based on what I'm watching (natural, sports, eco, vibrant, etc).  I really like changing the screen from full-screen to normal to zoom to expand; it feels like I'm in a movie theater watching movies when I pop a DVD in.  Only thing I don't like about that...putting DVD subtitles on when it's in full-screen/cinematic view.  The subtitles appear below what appears on the viewable TV screen so you can't see them to read them.  Odd quirk, not a big deal though.  Just switch back to 'normal' view and you can see the subtitles appear.REMOTE CONTROLThis control is easy-breezy to use.  Keys do not stick and it works from 30 feet away, don't need to point directly at the TV either.Happy with this TV.  The price especially, but also the ease of use, not overly complex, and it works well for me.

Reviews.Title: 40" tv
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was extremely happy with my purchase. It arrived quickly and was in perfect condition. The picture is amazing. I recommend TCL brand tv for anyone in the makrket for a new flat screen.

Reviews.Title: TCL 40 inch tv
Reviews.Author: gut
Reviews.Content: WAS SKEPTICAL ABOUT BUYING THIS TV BUT DECIDED TO TAKE A CHANCE AFTER READING THE MANY GOOD REVIEWS. ONE OF THE BEST BUYS I HAVE ENCOUNTERED FOR THE PRICE. SUPER SHIPPING AND EASY TO HOOK UP,,GREAT PICTURE AND PERFORMANCE. WARRANTY SOUNDS GREAT AND HOPE I NEVER NEED IT.BOB IN OH/FL

Reviews.Title: TCL TV is an outstanding set
Reviews.Author: Jay D. Weaver "Old Professor"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this set after extensive research on the internet as to features and quality of reviews. I was impressed with the number of reviews this set got and how many of them were five-star.This set does everything that I had hoped for, has excellent features, and a remarkably good picture both on Analog and HD.I am on a private cable system with less than perfect transmission. Yet my HD digital channels are perfectly clear and sharp.Even though this is not a well-known brand it is a quality item.

Reviews.Title: You will love it!
Reviews.Author: Danielle N. ALberts
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv a little over two weeks ago, received  free shipping and got it on sale. I was shocked when I received the unit and set it up!  I have two flat large screened TVs and needed one for my den. It turned out that compared to my Sony in my living room it's just as good if not better in picture quality.With free shipping It still shipped in one day and was received in great shape. It's looks are very handsome and it was easy to put together even for a 60 year old grandma who lives alone and did it myself. With a two year warrentee  it's a no brainer. I have never written one of these before but because of my past experiences I was presently surprised that in this day and age sometimes you do get an item that is worth what you paid for it and maybe more

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Bang for the Buck
Reviews.Author: Aaron
Reviews.Content: First of all, I was incredibly nervous about purchasing this television. Who wouldn't be? At such a low cost for the size of the television, you would think something would be wrong with it. NOPE! I have this tv mounted in my man cave with all current gen consoles hooked up to it, and haven't had a single problem yet!The glass stand is very nice, but sadly sits in my closet unused due to the wall mount.Gaming:I've had no issues with ghosting or anything yet. I've played multiple FPS games on it (MW3, Halo Reach, BF3) and all have looked beautifully.This TV owns cinematics as well, such as the ones in Final Fantasy 13-2. Just comes to life, especially in the dark! That being said, you may want to toy with your settings to get the look you desire ( I had to do this ) The Wii looks very good too, so long as you hook up with the component cables.Blu-Ray / HD TelevisionExceptional quality for both spectrums. I stream netflix and Hulu Plus in HD and the results are fantastic. I still cannot believe the bargain I got on this TV.Sound:The sound is a bit left to be desired. Sometimes the volume seems to go up and down. It might just be me. I suggest toying with your sound settings before you do much viewing. The music can be a bit loud on it, with voices being a bit lower. This can be fixed through settings.If you're looking for a bargain Television, than look no further! This is the one for you! Don't be worried about the generic name brand, Samsung makes the screen!

Reviews.Title: TCL 40-inch 1080p LCD
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for my Dad who lives out of state the Tuesday before the Superbowl.  He received it on Thursday via UPS, and I had the cable company contracted to come in Friday to hook up High Def.  He watched the game on Superbowl Sunday and has been thrilled ever since.  I have not actually seen the TV, but according to my Dad the picture is so great he doesn't have to wear his glasses any more while viewing. For the price and the ease of shipping I would definitively recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Be sure it works
Reviews.Author: marathoner
Reviews.Content: Item was shipped quickly but was DOA...did not work at all. Several calls to manufacturer were frustrating. However, Amazon has their own policies allowing me to order another unit and they pay for the return of the original item. The replacement arrived quickly and worked just fine. Happy with the picture/sound of the new/replacement working unit. As long as Amazon stands behind the product it's hard to go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Its value is much higher than its price!
Reviews.Author: meofcourse
Reviews.Content: After through a lot of comparisions with different brands at major retail stores and online shoppings, finally decided to go for TCL. I'm amazed its quality and can't pick on it any at this price range. I'm feeling lucky to make the right choice afterall.

Reviews.Title: What a great set
Reviews.Author: marvin katz
Reviews.Content: At first i was a little concerned because it came set at 720p, but with a quick review of the settings brought the set to 1080p.  The other reviewers were so helpful to let us know that (at least for comcast) you use the RCA number and the remote works perfectly.  NO regrets, just waiting for another sale to get one for our son!

Reviews.Title: Love this tv!
Reviews.Author: Frank S. Freeman
Reviews.Content: We were planning on putting this tv in our bedroom because I wasnt expecting much for the price we paid. This tv supassed my expectations! We put it in the living room, the picture is great and the sound is not bad for a flat panel. What sold me was the warranty. Ive done alot of research and nobody else offers a 2 year warranty. If I have one complaint it would be there is no TCL code yet for my Directv remote. You have to use the rca codes which work but not perfectly. The rca code turns the cable box and tv on simultaneously but they have to be turned off individually by moving the slider over to the tv position. No big deal but my wife seems to have a problem with it. Great tv, may buy another one!

Reviews.Title: Awesome television!
Reviews.Author: Eddie Dennison "Jrdenn"
Reviews.Content: I won't write a long review, I just want to state how highly I rate this television which is incredibly high. The picture on this television is flawless, immaculate, bright, crisp, amazing. I have owned at least 20 television's of all shapes and sizes and brands; well, this 40 inch TCL is the best I've ever owned by a mile. If your contemplating purchasing this television, don't hesitate any longer -- buy it!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Value
Reviews.Author: jree78
Reviews.Content: This TV was an outstanding value purchase, it's 1080p but 60hz, but I can't really notice any blur while watching a basketball game. Harry Potter looks amazing in 1080p, and an anime movie like Evangelion 2.2 looks amazing. I highly recommend this TV if you are buying a TV for good value.

Reviews.Title: great buy!
Reviews.Author: Casey A Martin
Reviews.Content: We have had this tv for about a month now and have absolutely no complaints. The picture quality is great and the sound is good. Great buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: TV was DOA
Reviews.Author: m. brand
Reviews.Content: I received this tv yesterday. We set it up this morning and it was DOA. The blue light came on to signify that power was running to the unit. But, alas, the tv doesn't work. UPS should come to pick it up Monday. And I've ordered another set, same exact model. We'll see if that one works... I'll report back but this certainly makes me dubious about the longevity of its life. I hope I'm not making a mistake.UPDATE UPDATEWell I got my replacement tv. Same model. Plugged it in. Works great. The picture is excellent and the sound is very good. I was a tv editor for 15 yrs so I have a solid background in A/V devices. I'm still nervous about the longevity of this product. Will report back in a few weeks.I'll note that there is some light bleed in the upper corners (as other reviewers have said). But that only happens when the screen is all black (eg. during the end credits of a movie). Otherwise, I can't see the light bleed at all.

Reviews.Title: TCL 40 inch Television
Reviews.Author: anno
Reviews.Content: Arrived as promised, good looking TV, nice picture. Problem, the set makes a "whistling" noise, all channels, all volumes, like having tinnitus, ringing ears. Multiple, multiple calls to company have yet to yield results. Still waiting for a "technician" to set up a "house call." Second problem for this company is that we live in Maine...no TCL technicians in this state??!!!Now they don't even want to take it back!  Have taken the matter up with our credit card company instead.  Doing business with this company is not worth the trouble of an inexpensive, made in China TV. Buyers beware!!!

Reviews.Title: Su
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Wang
Reviews.Content: I don't buy TCL brand TV anymore, after mountng the TV on the wall, I found out the IR remote was not working, I called the TCL TV customer service and telling them I need a new remote, they told me taking off the TV from the wall and put everything back in the box and shipped it back for replacement at the buyer freight. It took me 3 hours to hang the TV on the wall and setting it up, and right now they asked you to ship it back. It does not work in this way, Jose! The 2 year warranty is not true.  Hey! Be careful!!! TCL TV buyers.

Reviews.Title: TCL TV
Reviews.Author: ptclerk
Reviews.Content: I have never purchased a TV on line. I was pleased with my order, the TV was delivered in 2 days and was handled very carefully. The performance of the TV is excellent so far. Did order HD thru my DISH provider and the picture and sound is excellent. Well worth the price and the convience of ordering on line.

Reviews.Title: Buy this immediately!
Reviews.Author: Smv
Reviews.Content: I had been looking for an affordable big-screen LCD for quite some time, and I've been scouring deal websites to try to get something in the lower-$300s. Can't believe it took so long to find this TV. 300+ reviewers and 4.5 stars is a rare and beautiful thing to find on Amazon, and this won't let you down.Don't be put off by the relatively unknown brand name (in fact, TCL Corp is globally the sixth-largest TV manufacturer - known in the Americas as RCA - and Samsung even outsources some of its TV production to TCL) or the suspiciously low price (I paid $320; I know it has at times dropped to below $300 but that's still a fantastic deal for a 40" LCD).Some reviewers have mentioned that the item's packing arrived battered and torn up from shipping. My box was spotless, but regardless the TV was packaged so well that I'm sure the box could take a beating without affecting the TV at all. There was lot of compressed Styrofoam and reinforced cardboard to protect the device.Installing the stand took about five minutes. The stand itself is very impressive, made of glass with black glossy paint covering the top and bottom, save for a stylish thin clear glass border running along the sides. I love this look, but it should be noted that the stand in the picture looks like it's silver. Mine was black. The stand screws in flawlessly and sturdily using four provided screws, so be sure you have a Phillips screwdriver.The TV itself looks great, with a glossy black border and a soft blue light in the bottom-left that illuminates when the TV is on. This is fantastic for me; Samsung, LG, and other big manufacturers have a habit of putting their giant illuminated logo right beneath the screen or something annoying like that. If you prefer not to have the logo shining in your face while you're trying to watch something, this is a great plus.Connecting the device was a breeze, thanks to the numerous ports on the side for easy access (there are also connectors on the back for your more permanent fixtures). I lost count of the number of HDMI and RCA inputs, but it all felt very solid (some TV backings seem to cave a bit as you apply pressure to insert a cable). I did feel that the power cord could be longer; I don't know exactly how short it was (maybe it's in the product specifications), but consider buying an extension cord or longer power cord if you'll be placing the TV more than 4-6 feet from a power source.Once turned on, you might need to toy with the screen to get it to look as bright and vibrant as you want. There's a great review in here (currently it's rated as the most-useful, so hopefully ou can find it there) that provides some good guidance on what might work for you, but keep in mind it all depends on factors such as other light sources in your room, proximity to windows, etc. I've had my TV for four days and still occasionally play with the color settings, depending on what I'm watching. It's a little finicky, but I'm sure I'll settle on something soon enough, and it's better to have more control than less. But the screen is crisp and bright, especially when I'm hooked up to my computer via HDMI in full 1080p high-definition glory. Changing inputs (I'm regularly bouncing between HDMI input and standard composite RCA - that's the Red/White/Yellow cable) is a quick process; some other TVs take a few seconds to load the new input, and this takes less than one second to recognize and display the new input.I don't use the remote control (synced the TV with an RCA universal remote), but it came with provided batteries and initially worked fine. Keep in mind that RCA is a very popular universal remote manufacturer, and as TCL owns RCA, you'll have no problems at all syncing RCA remotes with this TV. I also don't use the built-in speakers (running through a receiver and independent speakers), but I'll echo that they're not fantastic and would better suit a casual listener, perhaps in the bedroom, rather than an enthusiast in an entertainment room.Finally, the included 2-year warranty is terrific.
