Having all of the different types and quantity of input options was important for our setup.  Not many TVs at any price have this number and range of inputs.  Setup and updating software was very easy.  The only downside is that the TV is slow to turn on and there is a noticable lag when changing inputs or changing channels on either the built-in tuner or through the cable box.  The lag is definately longer than on our Toshiba LCD TV.  If you are a channel surfer the lag may be irritating.The first TV Amazon shipped to us had a damaged box and the TV casing was cracked.  Amazon shipped us another TV the same day for next day delivery.  The second TV was fine.  My only complaint was that I had to bring the broken TV back to a UPS location for return.  Amazon did not arrange pickup of the broken set at my home.

Reviews.Title: So-Far So-Good
Reviews.Author: William Baker
Reviews.Content: I have this 40" TV-set just about two weeks and so far it is working perfectly (I am happy with it).  I really wonted a 50" but did not have the funds at this time.  The remote is quite sensitive and perhaps some vibration or pets pushing it around is the reason some people say that the TV-set turns-on by itself.  I hope that if it's necessary to use the two-year-warranty the repair-shop is local, or is it going to cost a fortune to package & ship.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a Great Price
Reviews.Author: TChastain
Reviews.Content: TV is very nice. Picture is great. This TV replaced a Samsung flatscreen in our home, the sound isn't as good on this TV as it was on the Samsung, but we are not dissapointed at all...this TV is a great TV and very affordable.

Reviews.Title: Solid So Far
Reviews.Author: James R
Reviews.Content: After owning for two days, the TV is everything I expected (and more, especially from a $320 40"). The stand is sturdy, but removable. However, if you're going to get a wall mount, bundle it on Amazon; I searched all the stores (Wal-Mart, Best Buy, etc.) and the lowest, both in quality and price, is at least $50. But as far as the TV is concerned, so far, so good!

Reviews.Title: Great flat screen tv for an amazing price!
Reviews.Author: new york girl
Reviews.Content: I purchased this television when it was showcased as the Gold Deal of the Day - the price was amazing.  The picture and sound are of very good quality.  I have had no issues with it's use and have been enjoying this television for over a month. I love the HD 1080 as well as many other features.  I am extremely satisfied with my purchase and TCL.

Reviews.Title: Greatly satisfied with the TV for far
Reviews.Author: Pradeep
Reviews.Content: Got mine 2 days back and was happy to see the Samsung logo on the LCD panel as seen through the back cover. Tried a few HD 1080p videos from youtube and I must say they looked great, specially in "vibrant" picture mode. Also Confirmed through "info" button that it does play 1080p video source in native 1080p format as claimed by the spec. Would also like to mention it didn't need a firmware upgrade as it already had the latest firmware version.I am fully satisfied with the buy so far. Although the price has gone up by $10 since I bought it (which I believe is the result of the response it is getting), I would still recommend this as a deal worth going for.

Reviews.Title: Good bang for the buck.
Reviews.Author: Gman1024
Reviews.Content: I bought this television for my Son, who is using it primarily for playing Playstation 3. This HDTV serves this purpose perfectly. There was no lag, shifting or flashing during any of the games we enjoyed (Call of Duty Black Ops, Castlevania, Gran Turismo 5). The only gripe, if someone put a gun to my head and made me complain, was that the audio is just ok. I absolutely expected this as the only television I've heard reasonably good sound from is my Panasonic 65VT30, whose speakers have Coneq technology, that produces great acoustic sounds for television speakers. I would recommend this HDTV to anyone looking for one in its size everyday, all day. Beautiful picture, easy to use, plenty of features, excellent quality, all without the large yellow Magnolia room price tag.Side Note: Fast and efficient Amazon processing and shipping as always. The price fluctuated between $320 and $300 when I bought it Christmas 2011.

Reviews.Title: Good enough for the playroom!
Reviews.Author: bionichands "procrastinator"
Reviews.Content: We needed to replace the tv in our basement - the kids' playroom.  I was surprised to find this 40-inch available at such a low price and even more surprised to read so many favorable reviews, so I gave it a shot.  I have to say I am proud of myself for being so thrifty now.  Could have spent a few hundred dollars more for a more expensive tv, but why?  The kids don't even care whether they are watching the HD channels or not.  They have a nice, 40 inch screen in their own room and keep their grubby little paws off my Sony!The TV arrived quickly in easy to open packaging.  Set up is a snap.  I couldn't find remote codes for TCL on my FIOS remote, but the search feature on the remote seems to have worked ok.  We can turn the tv on/off, control the volume and inputs with the FIOS remote.  The hardware seems sturdy and looks good.  I think it has 4 HDMI inputs in all which is good, but I wish there were more than two on the back.  I don't really understand the side inputs for HDMI.  Also, the default picture quality for the TV seemed to be something called ECON which I would guess is "economy" and looks really dark and bad.  Changed that to VIBRANT and the tv looked good.Anyway, if you're the ultimate digital snob looking to enjoy your collection of high definition blu-rays at the highest quality this is probably not the tv for you.  If you're like me, maybe replacing an old tv with a flatscreen in a kids room or for your parents or something, this seems like a good tv for the price.

Reviews.Title: No complaints so far
Reviews.Author: darwinator
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv because of the unbelievably low price right before Christmas coupled with the excellent reviews here. Within 15 minutes of opening the box we had everything we needed set up and were watching an HD movie (be aware that you will need to supply the HDMI cable for full hi def; we bought one for less than three dollars here on Amazon). It was very easy to set up our DirectTV, DVD player and Xbox 360 inputs, as well as switch among them as needed.The picture needed very little adjustment out of the box. We identified three scattered dead pixels on the edges, which is not bad on a 40" screen. We would never have noticed them without closely examining a completely black screen. The viewing angles are really excellent compared to many LCDs I have seen. You have to be far off to the side (far enough to clearly see the cables in the back) to see any changes in picture quality.We never had a separate speaker system with our previous tv so we are quite happy with the sound, although it is certainly not theater quality. There are multiple ports to hook up an external sound system if you want one.Since I gave this a 5-star review you can guess that we haven't dealt with customer service at all. Obviously we haven't had the set for long, but at this point, we couldn't be happier. If anything does go wrong, I will update this review.On a side note, I bought this tv as a surprise Christmas gift for my husband. I saw the special price on the 23rd and jumped right in. I paid ten dollars extra for rush delivery and received the order on Christmas Eve (I have Amazon Prime but I also live in a rural area). You rock, Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Love it! Better picture than my VISIO
Reviews.Author: Shawny B "Shawny B"
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this product.  I am loving the quality of picture.  I put it in my bedroom and I end up spending more time in there than my livingroom where my Visio is.  Can't go wrong at this price.  High quality.

Reviews.Title: Huge Bang for The Buck
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: TCL L40FHDF12TA 40-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LCD HDTV with 2-Year WarrantyFirst this isn't a bargain, it is a steal.  I got it at Amazon for $319 including shipping.  It is a measure of TCL's confidence in their product that they have a 2 year warranty included.  Some TV's have as short as a 90 day warrantee which to me means they don't have a whole lot of confidence in their product.Packaging on this TV was superb.  It was well protected and if I would have looked at the diagram on the box, I would have just cut the shipping straps and been able to lift the box off.  Instead, I pulled the staples and lifted the TV out to discover how difficult I made it.  Alas, such is life.Setup was simple and the picture is excellent.  HD is terrific with no adjustments, color calibration or skull cracking needed.  I was not seeing the scores on the football game and discovered I had inadvertently zoomed in, once I zoomed out everything was perfect.The remote has a solid feel but what appears to be a main control is not as main as you would think.  That is how I inadvertently zoomed.There are a wealth of connections on this TV, both on the side and the back.Overall, this is the best TV for the money I have seen.

Reviews.Title: WHAT A STEAL
Reviews.Author: G8KEEPR
Reviews.Content: While checking deals before Christmas found this TV listed for $259.99 on Friday before the holiday. Chose the free shipping option with delivery promised within 5 to 8 days. Imagine my surprise when it was delivered the next day before noon. I was watching football on it that afternoon. Having never heard of the TCL brand, I did research it before my purchase. The 2 year warranty is unheard of on comparable electronics. Very easy to set up and simple to connect. One downside is the included stand. It is glass, but seems too small for the 40 inch set. Great product. If you are not hug up on "brand names" then this is the product for you.

Reviews.Title: Pleased
Reviews.Author: IMHO
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't normally bother rating something that already has so many reviews, but, because I was skeptical purchasing this television (due to its low price), I know others probably are too, and thus might appreciate as much as much feedback as possible.Five stars, so far. I've had it for a few weeks (keep that in mind, if you're fretting about low term reliability; I'll update this in the future if I see problems), but so far it has been perfect. You might be able to find a cheaper television than this, but not a good one. This TCL appears to be a staggering good deal at this low price. I would be remiss though if I failed to carp about the stand it comes with... mine was exceptionally difficult to screw together. If you're purchasing this for the elderly, you might want anticipate assembling it for them (if you're not wall mounting it). It's not a complicated setup in the least; it just takes an unpleasant amount of strength to get screws all the way in. But, I think most would happily settle for that one-time difficulty and save hundreds of dollars over the price of a premium brand.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture and Ease of use
Reviews.Author: antoine
Reviews.Content: TCL L40FHDFTA 60HZ has the most amazing picture(Samsung parts). This LCD stands up to all the big name Flat Screen TV's. Would I buy another one - "Hell yes!!!!!" If Tcl comes out with a 60 inch, I will buy one. Configuring my direct tv and TCL was very simple. Reviews.Title: Solid Budget TV
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Cheung
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these sets when it was on sale on the Amazon Gold Box. Overall a great value for the price and the quality that you get.Picture quality: Very good for a TV at this price point. I tried out a Panasonic 42 inch LED and it definitely had colors that popped compared to this TV. However, it was double the price. I am content with the picture.Sound quality: The speakers in the TV have a very tin-like quality to them and I would not recommend using them if you care about accurate or loud sound reproduction. I have my TV hooked up to a 5.1 system so I did not have to worry about this issue.Menu: The TV turns on relatively slowly, it takes about 5 seconds before you can start viewing and channel surfing can take some time. Each channel change takes about a second to complete which can be frustrating if you are reliant on over-the-air television like me.

Reviews.Title: Good for the Price, Basic HD TV
Reviews.Author: CPR "xfilebuffyfan"
Reviews.Content: I can say that I've had a few HDTV's over the years and the technology moves so fast that it's really hard to compare one to the next.  The reason I got this TV was for my grandparents.  They usually buy whichever TV is pushed onto them buy the electronics store, so I wanted to just get them a basic TV that would meet all of their needs without costing a fortune.  This TV does that.  My grandparents have an up-scaling DVD player and HD satellite TV, but other than that they really don't nitpick the little details that a home theater fan might.  They noticed that compared to their previous 32" Toshiba, their sound was much louder & cripser (probably due to larger speakers).  They also mentioned the picture seemed smoother & clearer - which probably is more because of the newness and higher refresh rate, compared to their 3 year old Toshiba.  They also mentioned that the remote was easier to use - easier to see the wording & less buttons.I can also add that the TV seems really light and mostly plastic around the edges (except the base which seems to be made of a heavy glass or gorilla glass type substance).  When I set up their TV I moved it direct to their house without breaking a sweat.  Any person with enough strength to carry 30 lbs, will do fine.  This could be a plus for those that hate the weight of moving TVs or fear the wall mounting process due to heaviness.  The "mostly plastic" exterior could also be a negative if it is dropped - I wouldn't expect this TV to be built for very much abuse.I think this is a perfect entry level TV for someone just getting into HD and wanted to test out a new Blu-ray player, etc.  If your looking for bells and whistles, look somewhere else though.  Most TVs now push the added features such as Wi-Fi, 3D, built in apps like Facebook, etc.  You will not see those premium features here, but you will get a good picture with surprisingly nice sound for such a low priced set.  I could've gone with a different and more established company name, but instead I decided to get a larger set.  My grandparents saw how much more TV they could get for the money and they were happy.  In many cases the big tier companies would sell a 26" set for this price, maybe 32" in the mid range companies.  That is a lot to consider when you realize your needs.  This 40" TLC works great and coming from Amazon allowed me to feel secure that customer service issues would be handled quickly and professionally.Sure I haven't had to use the 2 year warranty, but I feel that if this TV lasts through the 2 years that would be longer than some LCD & Plasmas I bought in the past.  I spent over $100 on a warranty for a TV at Walmart that died in less than 30 days, so even warranties are worthless if you pay high prices for them (the warranty didn't extend to the replacement TV).All and all, consider this a beginner's HD TV.  This will tell you what you like and what could be better in future purchases.  For tech savy HDTV lovers, spend a little more and shop in the "names you know" categories.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Product and Price
Reviews.Author: Super Shiney Girl
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before purchasing this product and was a bit worried about the sound. I find that not only is audio just fine, I often have to turn it down to about 20-30. Maybe it doesn't have the deep base of a sound-bar, but my hearing is just fine and I don't need to shake my whole house to enjoy a movie.I was happy to see how heavy and sturdy the glass base was. It screwed right in (well with a little effort, the housing for the screws is very tight, which is great for stability, not so great for wrists).Set up was a breeze and I was happy to find that TV had backwards compatible ports for S-video, RCA and VGA, as my laptop does not have a HDMI port.I've been pleased with the present color settings, I do switch from Eco to Cinematic however I watch a movie.

Reviews.Title: great deal

Reviews.Title: Great Product Great Price

Reviews.Content: Ordered this TV from Amazon thinking that for the price even if I had to return it, it was worth the risk.  TV arrived next day with Prime free shipping.  Box was rather flimsy and beat up and that had me worried.  Set it up next to my 42" Sony HDTV to check everything worked and found the pic was better than the SONY at 6X the original cost! Reviews.Title: DOA*** See edit
Reviews.Author: Anasazi
Reviews.Content: TV arrived in 2 days with great Amazon fulfillment. Unfortunately it would not power up. Blue light comes on indicating it is plugged in but nothing further with remote or power switch on TV itself. Packaging was just OK and by that I mean it isn't quite up to what you would expect from one of the bigger TV names. That does not necessarily matter to me but may be indicative of the overall manufacturing process. The margins are getting squeezed in the LCD TV Biz! TV looks good. Stand is nice. Protective plastic where it needs to be. The power cord plug is not polarized and does not unplug from the TV itself so you can't replace it with a different one. That seems kind of strange. Anyway, I ordered a replacement TV and I'll report back when it comes. Assuming it turns on.Replacement TV arrived and works great. Picture and audio are both fine once you tweak them to suit your needs. Remote and menu are a change from what I'm used to but should be fine. All in all I would say it is a great buy for $319. I have adjusted my rating back up to 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great PC Monitor
Reviews.Author: Sean M. Clouse
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV as a Laptop Monitor. It is WONDERFUL!I spend about 10+ hours a day working and got tired of looking at my 24" monitor as I need 4 windows to do my job (don't ask...)The trick to using this as a monitor is this:1) Your laptop must have a HDMI port.  This monitor only offers 1360x786 resolution over VGA.  But it offers 1920x1080 over HDMI2) Once you get the HDMI hooked up, you'll need to do some advanced settings 'scaling' to get the image to fit.  I had to go 70%x70%.3) You'll want to back the brightness down to 0%.  This monitor has crazy good display the white will burn your eyes out!I paid $349 on Black Friday.  Now I see it at $319.  Either way, this TV is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: W. Bobette Brooks
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews on this TV and took a chance on it.  It arrived in 2 days and I had it connected to Dish Network and working perfectly in less than 20 minutes.  My Dish remote made it easy to program the TV to the remote.  (It was RCA #503)  I can't say enough good things about this TV.  I couldn't ask for any more from a 40" TV at this price.  I have an LG 42" and I don't see any difference at all between the 2.  GREAT TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV on sale for $299 on Dec. 28th 2011.  I was surprised how quickly it shipped and I received it within three days of ordering it and that is with the free super saving shipping.  The setup was easy and everything worked well out of the box.  I like that this TV has an audio out option so I can use it through my surround sound, since my surround sound doesn't support HDMI.  For a TV under or even around $300 it is a great deal.  The picture quality is excellent and it has a lot of inputs and outputs.  The sound through the TV is not the best; however I use it through my sound system, so it is not an issue.  If you plan on using this TV as your main TV for movies and such, I would recommend having it set up through a sound system or it may not meet your expectations for sound.  Overall, this TV is definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good..
Reviews.Author: MLD "M"
Reviews.Content: I've had this T.V. for a little under a week. So these are simply initial observations:1) Set-up in general is easy, the stand screws in and holds securely; channel set-up and audio/video settings are a cinch. You have the option of naming all your different inputs which would be nice if this were my living room t.v. where everything is hooked up to.2) Audio quality is good. No complaints. Loud and clear at just "10".3) Video is very good for a t.v. that is around three hundred dollars for a 40 inch screen. Comparing it to other display models at retailers I think it holds up with a couple hundred dollars of its price range. Obviously when you get into the $800-$1500 Sharp, Sony, Samsung t.v. range the quality goes up significantly. You can't complain for the price you're getting. Its VERY good just not top tier.4) If this were my main viewing t.v. I would probably spend more money for the best picture. As it is, this is our second (bedroom) t.v. and I couldn't be happier with what I got.5) I'll update this later in the year and especially if the t.v. gives me any problems. The price is great for quality set but terrible for a lemon. Hopefully this will remain a good deal.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV.

Reviews.Content: Just got this TV today, fast shipping.  For the price it can't be beat, and i did the Cinematic, No Sharpness, and it looks wonderful, i don't think you can beat this for the price.  Thanks Amazon. A++

Reviews.Title: Great Value....Fast Delivery
Reviews.Author: PCasp "Daddy"
Reviews.Content: This TV exceeded my expectations.  Picture is excellent.  Set it up in a spare room for the kids xbox.  No problems at all.  I would highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great TV so far. No shipping issues.
Reviews.Author: Law Hero
Reviews.Content: Unlike others, mine was shipped fine. The cardboard box is what you would expect for a flatscreen and the styrofoam blocks were very sturdy. I'm not a fan of two-piece boxes but it worked out fine, even with being transported 250 miles in the back of my car. I hate seeing reviewers give 1 star for the product because the shipper destroyed the unit in transit - I don't see what more you could expect from Amazon or TCL as far as packaging. The TCL box was packaged as well as any display I've purchased in the past.Others have complained about the base, but I have no issue with it. Mine was fortunately not broken in transit. I'll wall-mount it sooner or later anyway.As for TV performance, I've had it set up less than a week but so far so good. I've owned two Panasonic plasmas over the past 5 years (a 42" EDTV and a 50" HDTV) and a Samsung 42" plasma, as well as a 26" Panasonic LCD. While I prefer the plasma's picture, the TCL has a bright, crisp picture, and definitely shines in brightness and color, as most LCDs do (compared to plasmas). I am pleased with the display for the price I paid. SDTV picture on analog cable has some ghosting, but that seems common to LCDs. My plasmas do not exhibit that behavior. The HDTV picture is sharp and shows depth, though my cable HD channels exhibit the typical compression artifacts - an issue with my provider, not the TV. The TV found all of the analog and digital channels I expected it to find, so I have nothing to report about the tuner other than it works well. Netflix in HD on my Roku looks great, but I do need to play with the picture controls a bit more.I do find it amusing that others complain about a lack of features on a $300-320 TV. I guess my mindset is a bit different - I hadn't bought a new TV in about 2 years - so I don't expect to have Netflix, Hulu, etc. built into the TV. I use my Xbox/PS3/Bluray/Roku boxes for that as necessary. Buy a $45 Roku LT or WDTV player and you're set. In my opinion, the TV has plenty of ports, with the only negative being the lack of an optical audio out. Coaxial audio will work fine, though.All in all, a super value. 5 years ago when I bought my first Panasonic plasma EDTV (848x480 resolution - take that 1080P fanatics! the TV is still running great too) I paid over $1200 for it. It's amazing that I can get a 40" LCD for a quarter of that price now.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV. Great price.
Reviews.Author: Charlie
Reviews.Content: For the price of this TV I consider 1 of the best buys I have ever made.If I move to a larger house with more rooms there will be one of these sets in every room.The only thing I feel is wrong is the packing of the TV. It is shipped in a cheap flimsy carton bound by only 2 straps. Received 2 sets the same day and refused one because of damaged box. Charge a couple more dollars and ship in a more secore carton.

Reviews.Title: Solid TV at a solid price
Reviews.Author: Brian Damage
Reviews.Content: I got this TV right before Christmas for about $320. The picture looks great, and is actually a lot darker and crisper than my 47" Insignia which cost me over double the price a couple of years ago at Best Buy. The main downside for me is that the USB port on the TV does not support video playback, which was kind of disappointing. But whatever, I just bought another XBOX 360 so that's no longer an issue.Also, surprisingly, the speakers don't sound awful. They're not going to be great for listening to music, but sound pretty good (better than other HDTVs) for watching shows or playing video games.Overall, I'd definitely recommend this TV. It's a safe purchase at a very fair price.

Reviews.Title: I'm a TCL FanBoy Now!
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: I've gotta say, I was really, really skeptical about buying this "no name" LCD. I read almost every review and when it went on sale at Christmas ($259.99) I quickly purchased it and after having used it for two weeks...I'm sold. The image quality is great, the front firing speakers are a nice touch and the input/output selections are nice! Image quality controls are nice and detailed complete with expert settings. This unit will be used for tv viewing and xbox gaming mostly and at 1080p, the images are crisp, clean and no lag issues anywhere! Hard to find anything bad about the LCD. I do wish the remote was a bit fancier, maybe some more colorful keys- spoiled by my other remotes I guess. But if you are that person like me who asked, "who is TCL and should I buy this LCD" I say yes! I do like the 2 year warranty and because I'm that gadget guy I did buy the square trade 4 year warranty just in case! If I could improve this product, it would be a 55 to 65 inch version for $499! I'd buy it with no hesitation! Again, great product and a great value overall.

Reviews.Title: This is a Very Nice HDTV for the Price.
Reviews.Author: A. Willis
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice HDTV. My wife and I purchased it on DEC 21 w/Amazon Prime and it was delivered by Dec 23. We've been using it every day for almost two weeks and so far so good. We have had no problems requiring updates like some mention. The picture quality and sound are great. The only issue I have with it at this point is that DirecTV does not list remote codes for TCL brand televisions. Reading the reviews of others, I tried ALL of the RCA codes and none worked. I decided to call DirecTV to verify if their remote is incompatible and learned that they do not currently have codes for the TCL brand. However, when I mentioned that I had read that RCA worked for some people the DirecTV representative had me try several RCA codes again only this time I was to try turning the TV off instead of trying the volume like the on-screen remote setup instructs you to do. Well, after trying about 30 different remote codes, several did turn the TV on and off, but we were not able to get any of the codes to control the volume. Regardless, I was elated that I could at least turn off the set with one remote when done watching without having to search for both the TV and satellite remotes.One of the codes that did turn this set on and off was 11953. If this does not work for you try the other RCA codes that are listed. Just remember to try turning the set off instead of trying the volume as the instructions tell you to do. I hope everyone finds this helpful and I wish all a Happy New Year!By the way, I subtracted one star because of the remote code. Otherwise, I would give it five stars!

Reviews.Title: very pleased with tv,
Reviews.Author: bieber
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV a few weeks ago for under $300.  I actually returned a 32 inch because of this TV's low cost.  This picture on this Tv is great and even sounds alot better than tha last TV. It was vitually plug it and go.  Only problem, if you don't have hd, the coaxial cable sticks out from the back of tv making it not so flat against wall if mounted.I've only had it a few weeks so let's hope things stay good!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Purchase!
Reviews.Author: Matt2624
Reviews.Content: Have had this for a week now and couldn't be happier.  The picture is great (mine too has the Samsung panel label) and the sound is certainly adequate.  If you want big sound - as expected - you'll have to go with an external sound system, but it's more than sufficient for us (and what we were used to with our old CRT anyways).  I was looking at a couple of other TVs - an LG and Panasonic - but the price, excellent reviews and Amazon's TV policy drew me to this TV.  By getting this for so much less, I was able to surprise the kids by throwing in an XBOX Kinect and Blu-Ray player to boot!  Haven't had to update the firmware, as I've had no problems.  If anyone's gone through a calibration on this though, I wouldn't mind seeing what your setting results were.  Excellent!

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!
Reviews.Author: KPLLC
Reviews.Content: TV came fast and is so nice!  Picture is great...easy set up...such a great deal for the money!  Hard to find a 40 inch this good for a price like that!

Reviews.Title: Great TV, great price - but one question
Reviews.Author: Mark Fradl
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews so just to be safe I added the extra warranty (so it now has a 4 year warranty) - free shipping said it would take 5-8 days, it arrived in 2.  Easy set-up, and the difference it makes (going from old 30" crt) is amazing.  Playing SoCom on a PS3 I can actually see the bad guys now... turns out that makes them easier to shoot.  Who knew?One question i have for anyone reading this - I have it hooked up to the AT&T; Universe box with an HDMI cable and I notice that different programs are different sizes.  I understand that is because of the different formats things are filmed in (4:3, 16:9) but I'm surprised to see that nothing fills the screen.  Watching the show House gives me what looks like a 16:9 ratio but with several inches of black screen bordering all sides.  But with my PS3 it's full-screen.Am I doing something wrong?

Reviews.Title: Can't do better for the money!
Reviews.Author: Gquest
Reviews.Content: This TV is by far the best bang for the buck and was nervous to buy a no name brand and over the internet, but no longer! It's awesome!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Buy!
Reviews.Author: persianlt
Reviews.Content: This is the greatest buy I have every made! The price for the quality is really unbelievable. I couldn't believe how inexpensive this television was listed as, then when it arrived (very quick) and it got hooked up...wow! The picture is amazing! My boyfriend works with televisions every day and it even got his seal of approval :-) I was so worried there would be something wrong because it was so cheap. Reviews.Title: Great so far
Reviews.Author: DMartin
Reviews.Content: I have never seen a TCL TV other than here on Amazon, but I'm glad I saw this. I got it as a lightning deal a few days before Christmas and set it up on the 26th. That means it has only been set up for a little over a week so far, but we love it. It gives a nice, crisp picture. The sound leaves something to be desired, but so does our Panny 50 inch that is now in our game room. Reviews.Title: Great TV Great Price
