Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price.  Out of the box, plug it in, HDMI from cable box to tv, hit the on button on the cable remote and there is the picture.  Easy and simple.  Has a great picture but not as good as my Samsung 55" 3D but it didn't cost $3000 either.I order it with the free super saver shipping and expected it in 5 to 10 days.  Ordered it on Thursday, got it on Saturday.

Reviews.Title: My second TV. And it is awesome!
Reviews.Author: LionHeart0812
Reviews.Content: I love this TV from this brand. I just bought a second one for my dad and it look absolutely beautiful and works great. The picture and sound is awesome. No complaint whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: Awesome.
Reviews.Author: HeartBreaker
Reviews.Content: The best HDTV i ever came across I simply love it. I am not a TV freak but the moment i bought it I am in front of my TV all Day. Its a steal I recommend all to buy itUpdate even after almost 1 year still in love with this

Reviews.Title: Good gaming monitor
Reviews.Author: gray-ump
Reviews.Content: After buying the Playstation 3 for Christmas, I wanted to get a flat screen monitor that would be dedicated to it so we wouldn't compete with the kids when we wanted to watch a show.  With this in mind, I certainly didn't want to spend a lot so when I saw this Amazon deal for $299, I decided to jump on it.  It appeared to me that if it worked when it arrived, then I would probably be okay since most of the bad reviews involved a unit not working after it was unpacked.I ordered it on a Thursday and it arrived the next day.  It was easy to unpack (in fact, a little too easy - they should probably protect it and the stand better in the packaging, but both arrived unscathed in any case).  I connected the sturdy, glass stand with the 4 screws and hooked up the PS3 with RCA cables (don't have the HDMi cable yet).  Turned on and everything works very well.  I was a little concerned with getting a 60Hz screen for gaming, but all the games we have played so far - MW3, InFamous, Gran Turismo, Force Unleashed - all work perfectly.The picture is excellent and the sound is much better than expected.  One disclaimer on the sound - our setup is in a small room and we are playing within 7 feet of the monitor.  Not sure how the sound would be in a larger room like a family room.Since we don't have the HDMi cable yet, we have not played any Blu Ray movies, so perhaps I will update this review when we have done this.Also, I have not applied the firmware update since I have had no problems.  If it ain't broke, don't fix it.All in all, I am very satisfied with this purchase and hope to never have the need to use the 2 year warranty.  If something happens after 2 years, then I figure it was only $300.1/4/12 Update:  Got the HDMi cable yesterday and hooked up the PS3 with it and WOW - what an amazing picture!  I really didn't expect that big of a difference in picture quality, but even the 720p games look better.  In 1080p, Gran Turismo looks so real.  The TV switches seamlessly and automatically between 720p and 1080p depending on which game I am running.  Can't wait to see what a Blu Ray looks like!

Reviews.Title: For the price, amazing quality
Reviews.Author: Aaron W
Reviews.Content: I got one of these as part of a black friday deal for roughly $200.  My expectations were low, but I am overly impressed with the quality.  It works great with my antenna and my xbox 360.  The darks and clarity are almost as good as my sharp aquos.  I think this is $300 now and at that price it is still probably the best quality you can get at a value.

Reviews.Title: Complete Trash
Reviews.Author: Melinda Langley
Reviews.Content: Had the TV for 4 months. Last night it turned itself off and will not power on. Tried to call support and no one answers. You get what you pay for - buyers beware!

Reviews.Title: Great for the price.
Reviews.Author: S. TANNENBAUM
Reviews.Content: TV received as promised.  Packaging was very good.  Hooked-up the TV, it self programed & works great.  Can't beat it for the price. Great picture & sound. Just be carefull assembling the base, it's glass.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: Vish
Reviews.Content: this is my first TV and so far it has been excellent. Easy to set up with laptop or cable. Video quality just like any other brand out there and nice audio as well.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the price!
Reviews.Author: M. Martin
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV as a replacement for my 60" Sony XBR that broke after 7 years (mishandling during a move caused pixels to burn). I wanted to buy an inexpensive TV that we could use until my family moved into our new home - we plan to purchase a larger 3D TV later. Anyways, this TV is beyond my expectation. First of all, I was skeptical about the brand as I've never heard of TCL before. The set up was easy and the picture quality is a little on the dark side, but it's pretty good. Overall, I would recommend this TV especially at this price!

Reviews.Title: Great for the Price
Reviews.Author: Bo Martin
Reviews.Content: Amazon gets 5 stars for delivery!!!I ordered Dec 22rd at 9am, I chose free standard shipping, It arrived at 10am Dec 23rd.And I only paid $260.TV has a good picture (I say this because my 1 year old Sony EX500 is AWESOME!!)I didn't need a second high end TV.I'm amazed at what I got for $260.I hooked it up to my HDMI Cable Box and my WD TV Live.Cable box is 720p and the WD is 1080p.The default settings on the TV did not give the best picture. I ended up picking Cinematic Mode.It looked the best to me. I also set the Dynamic backlight and Light Sensor ON.This TV is only 60hz so there is some motion blur. I can live with it for the price.The sound was a little tinny so I just used the built in EQ and boostedthe Low end and cut the high. Problem Solved.I use a Logitech Harmony 300 Remote Control 915-000143. Works great.My only worry is how log will it last! Only time will tell.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, awesome picture
Reviews.Author: Justin Burton
Reviews.Content: Order with free shipping and arrived in two days. Easy to put together, picture looks really good, although it's the biggest TV I've ever owned so I might be biased. Word is they use Samsung screens. Sound is ok, but a TV this size should have some kind of external speaker hooked up to it anyway. Overall one of the best deals I've found in a long time.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly Surprised for the Price
Reviews.Author: Tammy
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my son for Christmas and WOW what a beautiful TV for the price.  He is so happy with this TV.  The colors are beautiful and he has had no problems what so ever.  Thank you Amazon for a great product.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Joy
Reviews.Content: I was surprised by the quality of the picture. Also looks great in my livingroom.I thought I was taking a chance buying a 40" for only $299 and worried about  the quality but no, great buy. I am going to buy another one.

Reviews.Title: no remote code
Reviews.Author: chels
Reviews.Content: Great Tv for the price. My two complaints are that it's s bit thicker than I expected and that as of now there is no remote code available for direct Tv. It's not a huge deal to have to use both the Tv and cable remotes but I prefer the convenience of using a universal remote. Otherwise deal great for the price

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: km christensen
Reviews.Content: I read bad reviews but the price was to good to not give it a try. Out of the box looks great, i was surprised that the base was glass and not plastic. Physically tv looks real good. I plugged it in and followed the prompts. Maybe 20 minutes later it was working good. When on coaxial cable picture was not great, but once on hdmi cable great picture. Sounds good to me but I have not been with a high dollar sound system. Really good buy so far just got it though we'll see.

Reviews.Title: TCL L40FHDF12TA 40-inch HDTV
Reviews.Author: Gregory Salo
Reviews.Content: TV works great right out of the box!Remote control is of less than average mechanical quality.  It will probably have to be replaced in the future.Amazon shipped TV to me very quickly.  Arrived one day earlier than estimated date!

Reviews.Title: Amazing Deal
Reviews.Author: Serious Youth
Reviews.Content: What a great TV right out of the box.  Easy menu and/or input selections.  Great picture and sound quality!  Thanks TCL.

Reviews.Title: TCL L40FHDF12TA 40-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LCD
Reviews.Author: Roberto Lopez
Reviews.Content: got this tv for $259.99 on a gold box deal,great tv for the price much better them the COBY 40INCHES LED TV, great colors and verry good sound, fast delivery from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: I have received my TV and its great so far.
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: I ordered my TV on the 25th and received it today about thirty mins ago. hooked it up everything works good, looks good. I will add to Review if anything happens to the TV. For the price of 303.00 for a 40" LCD TV I am happy. I hope it stays that way.

Reviews.Title: So far so good right out the box!
Reviews.Author: Jeff "VisionaryUrbanTactics"
Reviews.Content: Took it out the box and turned it on and everything works perfectly. HDMI worked from computer to TV as well! I was worried with some of the other reviews but am not having any troubles here so far. If things change I will update this review.

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy!
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: Yes this is a great looking tv with plenty of ports(hdmi, USB, etc). I heard it has a Decent picture and colors but if itbreaks on you forget that 2 year warranty. I purchased the tv and right off the bat it didn't work. No picture at all. Amazon wanted a two to three week turnaround to send me a replacement but what good would have that done?  It's sold out now. Tried calling TCL customer service only to be referred to the warranty department. The phone just rings and rings. Called the customer service line anD was told they are having phone troubles. Really?  For three days?  Phone trouble?  If a company can't get their phone to work I sure as heck am not buying a TV from them. Returned for a refund. Save your money and buy a better tv for an extra $100 or so unless you like headaches.

Reviews.Title: TV works at 1080i but not 1080p so it looks like crap
Reviews.Author: Serious Gamer
Reviews.Content: bought this TV cause including shipping was cheaper then most TV's of the size in the area, was orginally going to buy 3 and have a eyefinity setup (3 monitors used as 1 super wide) but glad i didnt. my graphics cards are saying the recommended resoultion is 720p, however i can set to 1080p. But, at 1080p i get issues. once the TV is turned off, and back on again after awhile the tv will just flash green every second and wont connect, i have to use another monitor and set the resoultion to 720p, then turn on the TCL and then once it connects i can reset to 1080p.. its very annoying, i contacted TCL via there website a week ago, still no reply.thinking about returningEdit: after further tinkering, it appears to be a refreshrate issue, if i set it to 30hz interlaced (this is 1080i not 1080p) then i dont have the green flashes and the picture appears no problem. however 1080i looks horrible and its not what i paid for. i have still not had any email or phone call from TCL regarding this TVEdit: And AgentP, the updated was for TV's that poweroff randomly, its listed on TCL's website.Edit: just did the firmware update no change.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Warranty, do not trust them!
Reviews.Author: J. Ross
Reviews.Content: Do not buy TCL TVS for their warranty. If something happens to you TV do not expect much help. Their customer service is almost non existent. Everytime you call you have to wait 30minutes-1hour on the phone, they probably only have 1 person answering the phones. When you do get a hold of someone they either transfer you to someone else, tell you to call a different number, or hang up and tell you to call back later. I have spent at least 4 hours on hold with them so far and my TV has not even been fixed yet.I had a problem with the TV within 1 month of turning it on. That was 3 months ago. I am still trying to get them to fix it. It took a month of calling them and trying to give them information before they sent an independent worker to my house. He could not fix the probably so they told me I had to send the TV back to them. After another few weeks they finally shipped me a box to send it back to them in, except I have to pay $80 to ship it back! Seeing as I bought the TV for around $300 I don't even know if it's worth it to pay that because even if I do receive a TV back (which I'm sure will take another few months) who knows if that one will work.Don't rely on their 2 year warranty because it sure isn't worth anything but long hold times and months of waiting

Reviews.Title: Awful product, even worse customer service.
Reviews.Author: Alex the Sane
Reviews.Content: I liked this TV from December 2011 when I purchased it until August 2012 when the screen went black.  I followed all of the suggestions about unplugging it for 10 minutes to reset it, unplugged it for an hour, 24 hours, all with the same result.I looked up authorized repair centers on the TCL website.  Closest one to me was 35 miles away.  I drove out there, store doesn't exist.  Maybe I'm the moron for not calling ahead, but I assumed the information on the website would be accurate.I contacted customer service, they referred me to the warranty department at 877-470-7766.  My first call I was on hold for an hour before the line disconnected.  I called back to 877-300-8837 and told me that the other number was the only one to call for warranty repairs.  One time someone picked up, immediately told me to hold a minute and never came back.Live and learn I guess.  I didn't expect much from this TV but I didn't expect it to be this awful.

Reviews.Title: Total piece of junk
Reviews.Author: lurl
Reviews.Content: the audio hurts your ears, the video hurts eyes, which I can tolerate, then this piece of shit shuts off by itself every now and then, you have to wait 10 min to reboot, sometimes it will reboot, sometimes it won' t....I don't understand why a Chinese company wants to damage it's image by exports these pieces of junks? The customer service is Horrible!!! I'm from china and I will never buy these junk again. Had a toshiba for five years still delivers the best picture quality. Amazon should be shamed of itself to help dump garbage products to US costumers!

Reviews.Title: Blue light only
Reviews.Author: Jeanne L. Bartel
Reviews.Content: I bought the TCL L40FHDF12TA 40-inch TV at the end of January for our bedroom because it was such a "good deal".  My husband finally opened it and set it up a couple days ago (in May) and was disappointed that it does not work at all.  In the one-star reviews we see this is not uncommon for this product.  Since we passed our window for returning the TV, our son-in-law called every repair shop listed as authorized repair centers from Monroe, WA to Salem, OR and every single one of them have disconnected numbers so we are unable to have it repaired.  I may be throwing good money after bad, but I am going to return it to Amazon with a letter of explanation and see whether they can help.  Wish me luck.The moral of the story is:  It isn't a good deal if it doesn't work.

Reviews.Title: NOT a good buy!
Reviews.Author: Lover of Facts
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews about this product prior to purchasing, as I always do.  Looked like it was worth taking a chance on it even though I'd never heard of the brand.  Wrong!  After unpackaging and getting this television all set up properly I clicked the power button on the remote.  Nothing.  Kept clicking.  Nothing.  Checked the outlet, but knew it was fine because the little blue light on the front of the TV was glowing.  Replaced the batteries in the remote control.  Nothing.  No sound, no picture.  Pressed the power button directly on the television.  Nothing.  As instructed in the instruction manual, I unplugged the television and let it sit for several minutes.  Plugged it back in.  Nothing.With a sinking feeling I decided I had to call the TCL service department.  After the person who answered asked a multitude of questions (needed all the TINY numbers on the back of the TV read to them, my name, address, etc., etc.) she ran through a list of things to do.  I had already done them, as I had read the instruction manual.  By the way, I had to laugh when reading the trouble shooting portion of the manual.  It said that if the TV won't turn on one of the things you should do is press the "MENU" button on the remote and check something on the menu screen.  LOL  If the TV has no picture, how does one manage to see the menu, I wonder?After talking to the first person at TCL who knew very little, she told me I would need to call another number (surprise!) and not only would they need the information that I had just given to her, but I would need to look up the email which was sent to me confirming that the package was shipped.  Wha?  I had the serial number on the TV, I had given my name, address and other information.  Why is even more information necessary?  When calling a service department, is it not obvious that I indeed owned one of THEIR televisions and was having a problem with it?  Why else would I be calling?  Why do I need to be grilled on every detail of my purchase?  Do they suppose that I am joking and actually do not own one of their televisions?I give up.  It's going to get packaged up today and returned for a full refund.  I prefer a television which works without two or more phone calls of runaround and wasted time.

Reviews.Title: Junky Set.
Reviews.Author: Aaron Kuhn
Reviews.Content: I seem to have gotten a bad set by all the glowing reviews here, but this TV was just junk for me. 25+ dead pixels, including a very large cluster of dead pixels smack in the middle of the screen. Cheap, poorly made remote with buttons that stick. LED backlight bleeding (view the TV set in a completely dark room, the light should be evenly distributed, not obviously viewable around the edges and not the whole screen). Ended up returning this set, will not buy anything from these TCL guys again.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the Money
Reviews.Author: Funds
Reviews.Content: We saw this price for a 40 inch 1080 TV and could not believe it.  After getting it home I can't completely put my finger on what makes my more expensive living room TV better, but there is definitely a difference.  It also takes a about 5 seconds longer to power on for some reason.  That being said, I'm completely satisfied with paying so little for a 40" TV for my bedroom.  Good deal and I would recommend this to friends.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Poor Service - Finally Resolved
Reviews.Author: Joel
Reviews.Content: Update - 4 starsAfter two weeks plus two phone calls, the blue banner problem was resolved with a firmware fix, but emails never were answered.Minor problem yet with premature turn OFF, three times in one night.Original- 3 starsTV seems fine -  BUTSix emails to TCL re blue banner not removable when viewing slide shows with media or even with single shots on media.NO answer to the emails in spite of their 'we love our customers','like to talk TV', and'you'll get an answer soon'.I hate companies who will NOT respond to questions re their product. Never TCL again!

Reviews.Title: Not worth the few extra bucks you save
Reviews.Author: MamaJo
Reviews.Content: I really was hoping Amazon sold through their stock of DOA TV's during the Christmas/Superbowl rush - seemed they still have them.  Received the blue light of death today.  Now I'm trying to figure out how to package the thing back up so the box doesn't fall apart when the UPS man picks it up tomorrow - extra packaging tape and a note that says be gentle?  The top of the box slides up and off and came bound with that packing strips.  It's heavy at 35ish pounds and I will use lots of tape and hope the bottom doesn't fall out when he lifts the box.  I can't believe I thought I'd get lucky on this one.  It's definitely not worth the $100 bucks I saved.  I am returning this and having a new tv delivered tomorrow but spending the money and going with the Samsung which I've had good luck with.  I could have tried to replace this one but I don't want to deal with repackaging another dead tv.***I ended up finding a roll of duct tape I didn't know we had and used that to repackage this thing.  Thank goodness for random things laying around in the junk drawer.

Reviews.Title: Glad I bought this !!!
Reviews.Author: mikesmess
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research and spoke to others and read many reviews on all 40" flat screens. I was not even considering a TCL brand, but I am glad I did and am very happy with the purchase. The picture is crisp and very clear, I did set picture on vibrant and moved the preset contrast from 50 to 55 percent and it really brought out the background. Some TVs have a darker background than I care for, but once I made the adjustment, which was very simple to do, I was delighted with the picture. I also like the 2 year warranty and that it is American made instead of overseas. I did buy addition set of speakers for better sound, but I found that all of the flat screens today are weak on sound without additional speakers. Overall, I am very happy with my purchase. Thanks TCL!

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: dwrune
Reviews.Content: Great buy for the price, just make sure you have HD cable or dish. Otherwise the picture is blocky. Didn't have any problems with it, except base screws didn't want to go in. Took a trip to a hardware store to find screws that would work.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Dodgey75
Reviews.Content: I have to admit the picture quality is simply amazing! At first I thought to myself that that not knowing of this type of brand might not be great. But it shocked me :)Pros: Great Clear Picture  Many adjustable presets  Easy to install/hook upCons: Sound is not great at all, I want everyone to know if you are looking for the hype of a great sound on this TV this may not be for you! Once you go past the volume up about 30 or so you start to get a vibrating sound if there is a lot of bass, you have to adjust the sound setting manually to get is just right still much higher you go it catches up. So you might either want to invest in a Home Theater system or sound bar.Other then this the TV is Great Gave it 4 out of 5 because of the sound.

Reviews.Title: A bargain
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture right out of the box; lots of picture and sound options; very nice price at $300 delivered. Ordered Super-Saver shipping from Amazon but it was delivered in two days on a Saturday by UPS. I would have given it 5 stars except the local channels on the menu's "Antenna" setting are a bit difficult when having to move rabbit ears around to find best location; you have to rescan at every move.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for mom
Reviews.Author: Norman Bates
Reviews.Content: Mom really likes her new TV, she has not said anything but she sits in her rocker and never complains about it. She complains about everything else. The TV does everything I need it to, even works on the little cameras down in the motel. No need to run down to the parlor to peek in on guests. I might even get some more sets to guests, but few of them stay very long anyway.

Reviews.Title: Been perfect for us!!
Reviews.Author: LE "freespirit"
Reviews.Content: We bought ours from Amazon warehouse at a reduced price.  Packageing came fine - TV works great - Free shipping!  What more could a person ask for.  We use this in our bedroom and so far has been working wonderful for almost a year now.The only con is - that you cannot operate with a dish remote otherwise we are perfectly happy with color, sound features etc.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, probably the best buy ever.
Reviews.Author: Christine Kranich
Reviews.Content: First off, it's 1080p, 40", and best of all, it's a little over $300!I'm very satisfied with this TV, and I am currently using it as a monitor to play games on/ watch Blu-Rays. (Blu-Rays look amazing!)The sound system is good. (I am running on my own PC speakers, but I tried the TV's, and they were almost as good.)Picture for a monitor is great! Just enlarge the text sizes and ensure it's running at 1080p/i! (Gaming is amazing on it- PC Gaming that is!)ATTENTION: WHEN YOU FIRST PLUG IN A PC IT IS FIRST RUNNING AT 1280x720 (720p/i) AND YOU MUST GO INTO AMD CATALYST CONTROL CENTER, GO UNDER DESKTOP MANAGEMENT, DESKTOP PROPERTIES, AND CLICK 1080i @ 30 Hz (30 Hz doesn't cap the frame rates. I've checked guys.) -Not sure what to do if you are using nVIDIA cards, but I'm sure it's just as easy.^ This is not a con. I just fiddled with it for a while and it worked in 1080i.ATTENTION 2: OLD GAMES WILL MAKE THE TV STOP AND SAY NO SIGNAL! NO FEAR, HOOK UP YOUR OLD MONITOR AND RUN A DUAL MONITOR DISPLAY, AND SWITCH DESKTOPS TO RUN OLD GAMES ON THE PREVIOUS MONITOR.^ Once again, not a con, I'm talking about old games that don't have 1920x1080 in the options guys, like Age of Empires 2 for example.^ But I have not seen anyone buying a 40" TV for their first monitor.^^ IN OTHER WORDS, DO NOT BUY THIS AS YOUR FIRST MONITOR, OR IF YOU ARE REPLACING THE OLD (BROKEN) ONE! - I mean come on, putting old games on a 40" would decrease the quality anyway. For all you care run it on a separate CRT!4.6/5 Stars/ if I could rate it to that much detail.

Reviews.Title: So awesome helped my nephew buy one
Reviews.Author: Patriot729
Reviews.Content: AWESOME AMAZINGI bought mine on Dec 22 at 0600 for 259.00 Flat from Amazon.Yes thats right 259.00 and guess what?December 23 at 1300 the TV was sitting in my living room!! You cant beat that!! I bought this a researching it for several weeks and seeing it in person at Tiger Direct. On Christmas Day my 12 yr old nephew had been saving his money cause he wanted a bigger TV and I told him about mine. We looked on Amazon and while the price went up it was still a great deal. 299.00, he was a little short so I made up the difference and we ordered it around 1900 that day. Wednesday afternoon it was delivered.Now my review of the TV. I have a Sony 55 KDL-NX810 in my living room and I will tell you  The TCL has a really nice picture and nice designI watch it mainly on weekend mornings as it is mounted on the wall in my room. My nephew uses his for Video games on XBOX 360 and the graphics are pretty amazing to me.The warranty was also another selling point for me. 2 years from the manufacturer to me means they are pretty confident about the Tv's they make. I have read some negative reviews but remember the price you are paying and the size you are getting.This is no High end Sony but i think the Picture is pretty darn good and if my kids didn't already have Tv;s I would buy them these.I have even watched the finish of several Sunday & Monday night football games and am really happy with the TVWould i buy it again?  Without hesitation!!!!

Reviews.Title: good tv for the price
Reviews.Author: D
Reviews.Content: The pictures are okay and the sound system is good.  Overall the TV is good for the money.  Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: Great TV but very poor tech support
Reviews.Author: Chris L
Reviews.Content: The TV is great but I wish that the tech support could be better. I had an issue connecting the TV to my PC with a HDMI cable. I could get video but not sound. I thought maybe the HDMI out on my PC was only sending video so I also connected a 3.5mm cable but could not get any sound through the TV. I first called normal tech support and they had to escalate the matter to level 2. Level 2 tech support simply told my to return the TV to Amazon and get a new unit. What do I get with the new TV, same issue! I start researching the matter online and it is a windows configuration issue! I would LOVE to have had better tech support because this wasted quite a lot of my time.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed...
Reviews.Author: Gimp
Reviews.Content: The top two corners bleed light terribly so the colors are distorted. Plus, the blacks aren't very dark at all. I've tried changing the settings, but the light bleeding is not affected. As a result, the picture quality is far inferior to my 3-year old 32" Dynex, not exactly a TV known for its stellar picture! There is some advice online about how to "massage" the corners to help fix this so I'll give it a whirl and report back.By the way, the sound is perfectly fine (much better than the Dynex); not sure why others here have been complaining about it.

Reviews.Title: great!!!
Reviews.Author: maxwell
Reviews.Content: I dont have much to say, if you re contemplating about getting this t.v, i must tell you, i have being in your shoes...lol.. mine was delivered after 3 days of purchase on amazon...Easy set up, i do not have cable... I only fixed an antenna wire to the t.v ( no antenna, just a 10inches antenna wire) and i got 47 hd good channels...hahaha... wat a suprise....Great picture, good sound....( go to picture quality and select cinematic)///////

Reviews.Title: Not for HTPC!
Reviews.Author: Prophet360
Reviews.Content: So, I got this TV. All I wanted was a big, high resolution screen and LFDs (Large Format Displays) are crazy expensive. I hook it up easily enough. The HDMI my receiver and xbox, vga to PC (nvidia GT 530) with audio to my sound-card. I turn it on and no PC, everything else though. What I do not get is that when NO SIGNAL is normally on the screen, the background is blue, but as soon as I turn the PC on, it  goes black but still says NO SIGNAL. So it is getting a signal just not displaying it.So, I replace the cable. Same. I replace the video card with another going VGA to another TV. works fine there but when i hook it up to this, same thing happens. So I hook it up to on-board video (Intel G41) and it works fine!!! well almost, it will not let me go higher than 1360x768 and it tells me 720p is native. I thought it was 1080p? So I get a new graphics card, an nvidia gt 430, and get the same video thing. so i try 1 more thing.as a last resort I use a dvi to hdmi cable I had and it works perfectly, except the resolution problem. If anyone can help me with this, I got nowhere with TCL.So here it is: resolution questionable (720p on 1080p, wtf?), support nonexistent (amazon is great but TCL is terrible), PC In put does not support modern video cards (DO NOT USE WITH HTPC!!!), but it is cheap and great for normal TV. Unfortunately, you get what you pay for. I am probably gonna keep it for a bedroom TV but get a good one for my HTPC setup.-- Edit 1/15Finally got 1920x1080. I am not sure how but I think it normally overscans. i hit it off on the remote. picture is terrible though. I had to turn the sharpness way down, around 40, just to read text. It still tells me 1280x 720 is default, but ignore that.

Reviews.Title: 1st TV DOA, 2nd TV Alive!!!
Reviews.Author: Skyhoneybear
Reviews.Content: Update (1/13/11)I got the replacement TV in two days (longest two days ever!) and the TV is Alive. It started right up.WOW! I agree with what all the 5 star/4 star reviews say. I am blown away. Coming from a 27 inch CRT to this 40 inch is amazing. All I can say is I didn't realize how the newscasters for the local stations really looked. Bought the cheapest HDMI cord from Walmart, and the picture is streaming just fine.The best part is that my previous TV was an RCA, so Time Warner cable remote works perfectly for the TCL, no programming was needed. So I echo those trying to find codes for your remotes, try RCA.Speakers sounded fine, without our surround sound system, we keep it at a level 10-15 as this is our main TV. When we do use the surround system, it has theater sound quality. Wii looks very good on the TV as well. Because the Wii has WiFi and Netflix, I don't think it is a big deal the TV doesn't have "apps" or Internet (or whatever).I have no complaints although it has been less than 24 hours. I was going to give this review 4 stars due to defective first TV, but decided on 5 to include Amazon's awesome return policy.This is a great deal for this size of TV. I can't compare it to other HDTV's as this is my first one. It sucked getting the first D.O.A TV, but two days later it was fine.Do your research, read the reviews, and use your own judgement!----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------1 Star rating, 1/10/12So, I rolled the dice and got a TV that is D.O.A. Plugged up the TV, and nothing. It seemed like no power was getting to TV. Tried different outlets, nothing happened. All other electronics plugged into outlets worked.The TV looked nice.I'm going to give it one more try and have requested Amazon to send a replacement. If the 2nd TV does not work, I will request a refund. I've already printed the return label and will be dropping off at UPS today. Thanks Amazon for a great return policy.I want this TV to work. From the great reviews it sounds awesome, and this is a great deal. I'm not brand name struck and understand that all TV's can have problems.Will update review when new TV arrives. Keeping fingers crossed.

Reviews.Title: Can't get any better at this price!!
Reviews.Author: Icky K "Icky K"
Reviews.Content: This TV is excellent for around $300. Picture quality is excellent and quality appears to be very good. Can't go wrong with this TV at this price and with a 2 year warranty!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome...
Reviews.Author: Jezabel Pagan
Reviews.Content: This TV is great, I can't believe you get such a great quality for such a low price... I bought it on December 23rd, the $269.99 and I had to think about it for a while before I decided to buy it, did research and got it, no problems so far. Delivery was fast... it came a week before the estimated date I got when I bought it. Just for the New Year and the football bowl games!!!

Reviews.Title: Best value LCD TV out there
Reviews.Author: Antonio Comas
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV a couple of days and so far I'm pleased with my purchase. I bought it new from amazon for about $190 and you can't beat that price for any 40" LCD TV. The picture quality is I'd say a 6 out of 10 in my eyes. Aside from the backlight and contrast there's very few controls to tweak the colors, although the image presets are fine for most uses. The sound is obviously sub-par and has very little base but it does have some volume, and it doesn't distort when turned all the way up. The Remote though, is the worst one I've ever seen on a device, because even though it works and it looks OK, the individual keys stick. One thing that scared me a little bit is that when I went to pick it up at my local UPS location (I missed the original delivery) the box was split in half as if the bottom was never attached. I had to take the TV out of the box at the UPS building because it could not be carried in the bottom half of the box. I inspected of course the TV for physical damage and it looked fine, but I think I got lucky. If you're looking for a cheap TV, this is in line with most $400 TV sets you can find on Walmart or Best Buy. Hopefully, I won't have to use the 2 year warranty, because I honestly don't think it's worth the hassle returning it.

Reviews.Title: Geez Amazon--you are killing brick and mortar stores
Reviews.Author: scienceguy
Reviews.Content: I ordered this for $260 on Dec 23 with free shipping...got it on Dec 25th....they delivered it Christmas Day!  How can any one compete with that?  I haven't even opened it yet...plan on using if for a monitor at work...hope the 60Hz doesn't matter since most images will be pretty static.

Reviews.Title: Better than LED-LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Raymond D. Tai
Reviews.Content: I received the TV right before the Christmas day to replace my 32 RCA LED-LCD. This TV is well built and packed. The color is beautiful. It is so bright that is even better than RCA 32" LED which I returned because of the poor color. I compared with my Sharp 46" LED-LCD and I could not tell the difference of the color and brightness. I do not know why this TV is sell so cheap but it is excellent TV.

Reviews.Title: Bravo China !!!
Reviews.Author: bissi
Reviews.Content: It's all good except we are killing US based competitors.$299 for a 40" HDTV is unbelievable. And this Brand is not a low end quality, it's as good as Sumsung Sharp or others. The next 40" HDTV listed is $200 higher and there is no way a US manufacturer can compete a such bargain. Go China,Go, it's your moment!!

Reviews.Title: Better than expected, great bargain and Amazon shipping is amazing.
Reviews.Author: Taylor
Reviews.Content: Pros:Nice picture (I like my Samsung plasma better, but there is little to complain about on this TCL)Every input type imaginable and 3 of each (use input skip menu to hide the 12 you won't use)Easily accessible side inputs for USB, HDMI and RCAHeadphone plug (rare on large TVs, it seems)Nice Eco features like light detecting auto dim and backlight adjustmentFull native 1080pSound has plenty of volume2 year warrantyCheap!Cons:Sound has no bassGrey speaker strip looks a bit cheapTuner seems a bit weak, expect to fiddle with rabbit ears if using over-the-air TV60hz occasionally shows motion artifacts (most cheaper LCD are 60hz, though)All in all, it is better than I expected for such an inexpensive TV.P.S. We bought this when it was on Gold Box and Amazon shipped it overnight for $10 in time for Christmas.  I've looked at what it would cost to overnight a 40lb box to my house and it's roughly the same cost as this TV.  So I don't know how Amazon does it, but I am not complaining!

Reviews.Title: Bought on Friday, shipped overnight on Wed. Rec'd Thursday Free Shipping.
Reviews.Author: Dave W.
Reviews.Content: TV arrived yesterday. Took about 30 minutes to set up, mostly finding the channels. I could have stopped it after about 30 sec. since I have a satellite box and it found that immediately. But I let it run anyway to see how long it would take. Took about 10-15 minutes. Since I don't have my HD satellite box yet, I'm not commenting on the picture quality yet, although it's about what I expected. I tweaked the picture a little and improved it. Setup and menu system is pretty straightforward and the remote is pretty logically laid out. The TV has been on most of yesterday and today so I have no idea if the random turning on issue is an issue.For the price, it's a great deal. At least it is after one day! I'll try to update once I get the HD tuner after the first of the year.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be Happier
Reviews.Author: MH
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv from Amazon on Dec. 23 around 6 A.M. and was delivered probably 10 A.M. the following day without extra shipping. The total cost- $259.99! The speed of delivery and cost was outstanding. I just knew there had to be something wrong with the set especially when the FEDEX lady showed me a fist sized hole in the screen side of the box. Upon opening it everything looked to be fine so FEDEX lady made a note of the damage and was on her way. Setting up the tv was easy. The base went on without a hitch. Turned the tv on and and everything seemed to work just fine. Hooked up HD receiver and the quality of the picture was perfect although some tweaking may be necessary. My service carrier's website gave me the wrong code to enter in their remote for TCL tv's but I heard that RCA code will work so I just entered RCA with no specific model and the code that was given worked like a charm. Hope that helps. Apparently the distributor of these sets are in to different things as the name and address listed on the user guide (TTE Technology, Inc. 1255 Graphite Drive Corona, Ca) is a motorcycle dealership. LOL  Don't let that scare you as my set came from Indianapolis from the same name (TTE Technology) but an electronics distributor. Go figure. Only giving a 4 stars because it's still early to tell if my purchase was worth it. Will get back with an update.[UPDATE]  Three weeks later and I'm still happy over my purchase. Think I'll bump my star rating to a 5 I'm so happy.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Route4
Reviews.Content: The best $400 I ever spent.  Really like it. I bought this for my Xbox plus kinect, and also hd channels by antenna.  Great quality, no problem at all.  my first 5 star item in Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Extremely Poor Customer Support
Reviews.Author: Nikki Elizondo
Reviews.Content: In May of 2011 we purchased 6 of these 40" televisions to use in my companies conference rooms.  2 of these units are experiencing a reverse image and we have been trying to get a hold of TCL since April of this year with no luck.  Either their phone lines are down or we are transferred to a voicemail box that is never answered or completely ignored.  It is very frustrating that a company of this size and in the electronics business is so bad at support.  I would double think from purchasing from this company.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the price
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: This TV is very basic, it's missing a lot of bells and whistles on most flat-screens (such as integrated NetFlix etc.) However, honestly, who needs that when most Blu-Ray players can support such features? The upside is it has a very clean, simple interface and one of the easiest flat-screen TV's I've configured in a while. It's definitely a lot of TV for the money. I did have a problem with one of the 4 wall mount bolt holes, but I found a workaround fairly easily.

Reviews.Title: DOA on Christmas EVE...blue led light only...RETURN
Reviews.Author: ComputerNeenja
Reviews.Content: I've bought 2 of these total.  First one arrived DOA with only a blue light on the LED in lower left hand corner...nothing at all would post on LCD.2nd one received today...box was beat up pretty bad but it was well packaged.Blue led light in lower left hand corner, but the TCL Setup Screen came up.  This lcd works fine.I'm waiting on TCL 40" lcd #3 to replace the 1st one that was DOA.  I'll come back and write a review then.TV looks nice, but I give 3 stars for the first TV being broke on arrival...and yes I let it sit in Room temperature for 5-6 days.

Reviews.Title: Just so so.
Reviews.Author: asasass
Reviews.Content: Quick shipping, good price, but too heavy, and almost never used. Will not purchase this item anymore. Will not tell my friend.

Reviews.Title: Good Picture, Horrible quality, Horrible customer service
Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV thinking it would at least do the minimum. When I got it, it had a great picture and was amazed by the cost and quality. However, just two months later, the TV picture went out. Called customer service and had it repaired. Now, the same thing happened and customer service is nowhere to be found. I have to call almost literally all day, and when I do, they shuffle me to another person. This is one of the worst customer service that I ever had. I will never buy a TV from this people again.Save yourself the headache and spend another $100-200 for a better TV from a known manufacturer.

Reviews.Title: customer service?  Warranty??  Baah!
Reviews.Author: Cap'n Jan "Cap'n Jan"
Reviews.Content: Update:  It is November 7, 2012:  Our TV has been at the 'repair shop' (warehouse?  Garbage dump?) now since the first of August 6, 2012.  That makes it 3 months.In talking to my husband last night he said "I bet the reason these TV's are so inexpensive is they bought up all the discontinued parts sitting around in China, assembled the TV's and sold them dirt cheap."  So what if they break?  They are disposable!  Trouble is they don't inform the customers that they are throw-aways.  Instead they talk about their warranty!  And their Customer Service!!!.  The disposable TV theory makes sense to me particularly given the treatment we have gotten.  I am putting this review on EVERY TCL TV even though we only bought the 42 inch version.In looking at other reviews (and not just on Amazon) TCL has this same ho-hum attitude about customer service for ALL of their TV's.  I promise to eat crow if we ever see that TV again, but I don't think I'll be burping feathers any time soon.  I would bet money we will never see that TV again.  I'd appreciate any comments where people have had satisfactory customer service - it might restore my faith that I will see that TV on the front porch in the next couple of years.----------------------------------My original review written in October still stands:When we set it up, we were very happy with the picture quality, there were a few dead pixels, but that doesn't show up much and we weren't concerned. But the whole panel died after only 6 months. We aren't big TV watchers either. The thing was on less than 5 hours a week.So we contacted TCL (after several tries to get them on the phone), they gave us the number of the repair shop we were to send this TV to. After several tries, I got them on the phone. They agreed to send us a box to ship it in (a whole other fiasco, but that's not to do with the TV).We received the packing box (after a couple of weeks). We packed it and sent it to them Fed-Ex the same day.Now the Big Wait begins. After 3 weeks I called (again, several times, for several days before an answer). Oh, its here, it is in our shop and they are working on it. Sometimes it takes a couple of weeks because we are So Busy!!OK. Fine. We wait some more. Three more weeks. I call (yes, again, several times over a period of days before I get an answer). NOW there is a problem getting the part. But it should be in 'any time now'.Hmmm. So I wait some more. Another 3 weeks. I call (here we go again! several times a day, for several days -FINALLY an answer). This time someone let the cat out of the bag and told me that the 'panel' that my TV needs is on 'back order'. They have a warehouse full of TCL TV's waiting for this part. She was honest enough to say that it could be 3 months or 3 years before it is received. They simply do not know.Of course it is not the repair shop's fault. I am mad at them for not being more forthcoming, but it is TCL's fault for not providing proper warranty service - TCL simply does not care about customer service.I will update this review as things change, but things probably won't change. This week I am due to call again. I am nothing if not persistent.So, you can go ahead and buy a TCL TV, and you might get lucky and get one that works for a while. But then you can send it to the repair shop so it can keep mine company - in the 'warehouse full of TCL TV's needing repair'.Fair Winds,Cap'n Jan

Reviews.Title: Well worth it.
Reviews.Author: Shawn E. Decker
Reviews.Content: While there are many flat screens out there for the money this one is by far, to me, the best. For the size of screen and what I paid at first I thought it was a mistake. Although the remote is basic but functional, it works fine. I've had the TV over 6 months and I told myself if it lasts 2 years I'm a winner. I paid $300 shipped for it and if you can find a better deal on a 40" flat screen then jump on it. Sure flat screens will continue to drop but for my first one on a budget it fit the bill well. I'm sure there are horror stories on every product from time to time but I'm lucky to say this TV has worked 100%. Picture is good and overall I'm happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Looks Great
Reviews.Author: Andrew Goodwin "Drew"
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and thought I would purchase one. The price was great at $320.00 with two year warranty. I am a little worried about the customer support comments. But, as long as the 40" LCD keeps working well, no problem. Good LCD TV For the price.

Reviews.Title: SO FAR.....SO GOOD....
Reviews.Author: ZBearz
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV about 6 weeks ago for $350.00...saw the price going up, decided I better buy it right then, glad I did!  I give it 4 stars because like one other reviewer mention the yellow is a bit off and I have tried all the codes for DirectTV and there remote will turn on the TV but will not turn it off.  I even bought a universal remote and same problem.  But for the quality of the picture and the price I can live with this.  I also bought a costco 5 year Square Trade warrenty for $30.00.  I just hope it lasts now.

Reviews.Title: Tricky Review.......
Reviews.Author: D. Hancock
Reviews.Content: Well.... Where do I start...... I bought this tv from the warehouse deal section. It was described as used with a few cosmetic scratches on the stand. I received the tv on time. The tv was packaged well however the other parts were not. The stand was simply inside the box loose and so was the remote and hardware. By the time it it reached me, the remote had been smashed around so bad that it separated into 4 pieces. I am a pretty handy guy so I attempted to snap everything back together. I noticed the metal springs which serve as the battery contacts were lost. I removed similar springs from an old tv remote I was getting rid of and modified it to fit. I snapped everything back together and installed batteries and it works. Second issue was the 4 screws that attach the stand to the back of the tv were also missing. My wife suggested sending the tv back at this point. I rummaged through my screw collection in my shop and found 4 that were the correct fit.The tv is together and working. This is the first "not new" product I have ever bought, and I was nervous. This tv is for my patio and i did not want to put an $800 tv outside. This set was $314 so I knew there was some risk involved. The description was that there were scratches on the base of the tv. Luckily the plastic film coating on the glass base had never been removed. After removing the film, the scratches went with it! The film was scratched, not the base. What was NOT in the description was a dead pixel on the screen. This I didn't like. It's bright green and quite noticeable, especially in dark scenes. Since I don't normally buy off brand, seconds or used things.... I'm not sure if this "is part of the deal" or not. There were two tv's left at this price. If one or the other had described a problem with the screen, I would have chosen the other one. I was ready to accept cosmetic scratches, NOT screen issues. ANYWAY.... more care in packaging would have made my experience better. A simple Ziplock bag with the hardware and remote control in it and some tape, would have earned this rating another star or two. The reduced rating was for missing and damaged parts, not necessarily a TV problem. I guess I'll live with the pixel problem. Now we will find out if this tv will last!

Reviews.Title: It's okay
Reviews.Author: josharcher
Reviews.Content: the tv is very nice.Pros:Nice pictureCheapokay soundcons:HeavyBad stock stand(very difficult to set up and if put on wrong could mess the stand and tv up)Easy break. I have had the tv for about 2 and half months and the powerboard already went out. Luckily I have a warranty. BUT DO NOT BUY THIS TV WITHOUT WARRANTY. GOOD FOR THE MONEY BUT WILL MORE THAN LIKELY BREAK.

Reviews.Title: Too Bulky for an LCD
Reviews.Author: Krish
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV couple of months ago. It's so heavy, I couldn't wall mount it in the guest bedroom. As the performance of the TV (for the cheap price) is ok, I decided to keep it. So moved it to the Garage.

Reviews.Title: VGA can't support 1080p resolution
Reviews.Author: Leizar
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to use it also as a monitor, but I can't set a 1920 x 1080 resolution using the VGA port... It's a shame. But as a TV works perfect.

Reviews.Title: beautiful
Reviews.Author: jon
Reviews.Content: SO FAR SOO GOOD INSTALLMENT OF THE BOTTOM PLATE WAS I LITTLE TRICKY BUT OTHER THEN THAT ITS GREAT LOVE IT, IT GOT HER REALLY QUICK I ORDERED IT AFTER A FEW THINGS AND IT GOT HERE FIRST. CANT WAIT TO PLAY PS3 ON IT SEE THE QUALITY OF THE GAMES ON IT WILL DEFINITELY RE POST LATER ON IF ANYTHING GOES WRONG .. IM ALREADY PLANING ON BUYING THE SECOND ONE

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: I struggled with purchasing a new TV for a few months.  Wanted a big enough screen but was determined to keep the price down.  I did some research on the TCL and found out they build a lot of the RCA TV's here and the board in the back has Samsung printed on it. That all being said, I decided to go with the 'off brand'.So far the TV has performed flawlessly.  It did take some doing, setting up all the different color schemes that are available.  The picture quality is superior. I use a home theater, so I cannot vouch for the speakers in the TV. The base was easy to install and connections were a breeze.I would recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Good value, but poor over the air reception
Reviews.Author: mot
Reviews.Content: Short story: This TV has poor over-the-air reception, so if you're planning on using it for that, then I would not get this TV. Otherwise, it's a great value.Longer story: I bought one of these and was very happy with the picture quality, etc, but had big problems with the reception. I live less than 10 miles from the broadcast antennas for all the major stations, but wasn't able to get a reliable signal from them even with a decent antenna and a signal amplifier. I plugged the same antenna into a small old TV and got all the major stations without any problems. I returned the TV, got a replacement, and had the same problem. I know it's a small sample size, but it's convincing enough for me to think that the poor over-the-air reception is an inherent problem with this TV. I returned my replacement, got a used Samsung, and I'm much happier with it. The Samsung with an old set of rabbit ears works way better than the TCL with a nicer antenna placed in a different room where I got better reception, plus a signal amplifier.  When you include the cost of all the extra antenna stuff (not to mention the time and hassle of messing with the antenna), the used Samsung didn't cost much more.I'm only giving the TV 3 stars, but I'd give Amazon Customer Service as many stars as I can. Returns were easy, fast and free, the replacement TV showed up in only a couple days, and they were very nice to talk to on the phone. I couldn't be happier with them.One other note for people trying to get broadcast TV. This homemade antenna worked much better for me than rabbit ears and even an amplified model from Terk:[...]

Reviews.Title: BEST VALUE!!!!
Reviews.Author: So cali girl
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS TV!!! I USE it as a monitor in my office. Its great. love it. Quality is almost as good as my Toshiba. Dont be turned off by the low price. This is the best value.

Reviews.Title: Great TV great buy
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: After reading lots of reviews and worrying about purchasing a non brand name tv I took the plung and I am very glad I did.  This is a fantastic tv.  I read so many reviews that the picture or sound were inadequat or that the settings would not stay put but I have no complaints about how this tv works.  I did however have an issue with the tv being delivered in a carton that was open.  I called fedex right away but they just directed me to amazon.  Amazon never replied to the email I sent so that was disappointing.  One other problem I had was that the tv was listed for  $299.99 on dealnews but when I checked out the price was $319, no shipping and no tax.  I don't understand what that was all about but the tv was still a very good deal so I went with it.

Reviews.Title: nice sound but picture needs a lot of tweaking. previous model - 11TA was a lot better
Reviews.Author: shphoenix
Reviews.Content: nice sound but picture needs a lot of tweaking. previous model - 11TA was a lot better.. I have the 32" from 11TA series and that is world's better than this one in terms of picture quality and sharpness. THis one looks a little fuzzy and non HD looks horrible (not even accounted for in my rating). THis 12TA series does look better in terms of ghosting compared to 11TA. BUt the colors and details looked A WHOLE LOT better on 11TA older series. THe black levels look good. THe details are fuzzy is my only beef with picture. TV has a samsung LCD panel and I thought it would be netter just like my TCL 32" - but wasnt the case.  RCA remote code will work (it is working my Time warner cable.) Played with picture settings A LOT and finally the tHe best picture settings i have found so far1. noise reduction - low2. turn off SABC, dyna backlight, ambient light control3. brightness 50, contrast 90, sharpness 70, color 55, backlight 90, tempand tint 0.hope that helps..

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: rachelzbth
Reviews.Content: Great, clear picture!  Good from all angles.  Easy setup too.  Only thing is that for some reason it automatically puts some channels in Spanish or some channels appear to have no sound at all.

Reviews.Title: Price lower elsewhere, but prefer TCL and Amazon guarantees
Reviews.Author: gee miller
Reviews.Content: I bought a 32" TCL a year ago and have been really pleased with it.I just ordered a 40" TCL from Amazon, but found it for $305 elsewhere...there is no price matching on Amazon, it seems. I am sticking with my Amazon order for the backup I see that Amazon provides...but wow...HDTVs are coming way down in price.I understood that TCL (China) was like the 6th largest electronics company in Asia, and that they made panels for Samsung (Korea) flat screens. I read reviews here that state that Samsung makes the panels for TCL...I wonder how to find out which Urban Legend is true?I install satellite TV for Dishnetwork, and I see every brand of TV...the finest picture depends on the level of quality of the particular HDTV, but Sony and Samsung are always a beautiful picture. My TCL has the same fine HD picture as the Samsungs I hook up daily...I am quite pleased with TCL. The only customer I have met that knew of TCL had one, and a Samsung as well. She was Chinese.Additional praise...Hooked up the TCL L40FHDF12TA when it arrived today, set the various levels from Madqueen's great review, and am completely blown away by the awesome picture this tv has. I checked it out by putting on my BluRay Avatar disc. I then checked out the local channels I have on antenna...crystal clear HD.As I stated before I am a DishNetwork installer;I see just about every size and brand of flatscreen out there, and hook up HDTV to them.The TCL 32" I had for a year worked flawlessly, and always had a great picture. Just 32" was a bit small for screen size, so here I am with a 40" and wow...am I happy now!Seriously...all flaws some have encountered aside, this is a GREAT TV, TCL is a seriously good brand, and for about half the price of an equal size Sony or Samsung there is no better deal out there, excepting a one-time only offer on some other brand. (i.e.,I saw an offer for a 50" LG for $500, but for a short time only)I adamantly recommend this TV!

One shot, two, three and ... so many times but nothing showed up, then I plugged that antenna back to sharp again, the antenna worked like a charm.Decided to give it another shot, this time I used the laptop to connect with this TV, ended up with no signal in result. Tried to connect the laptop with another TV, nothing unusual.The only thing it would worked with were USB and HDMI port (using my PS3).I don't know what was going on with my this one. It did not perform as expect. Both antenna and laptop worked fine with current TV

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY!! DO NOT BUY!! HORRIBLE!!

Reviews.Content: DO NOT BUY ANY ITEM FROM TCL!!!!! I PURCHASED THIS TV SOLELY TO DO PN90X IN MY BASEMENT AND AS A GUEST TV. THE TV DID NOT EVEN SURVIVE 100 HOURS! IT WAS USED FOR 1 HOUR PER DAY 6X'S PER WEEK. ONE DAY I GO DOWN TO DO MY WORKOUT AND THE SCREEN IS BLANK BUT WAS FLASHING WHITE INTERMITTENLY. BECAUSE IT HAS A 2 YEAR WARRANTY I FIGURED IT WOULD BE A PAINLESS PROCESS, AND THAT I MIGHT HAVE TO SHIP IT BACK WORST CASE SCENARIO. FIRST, OF THE 10 PLUS TIMES THAT I'VE CALLED THE SHORTEST TIME HAS BEEN 30 MINUTES! AND YES I SAID 10+! EACH TIME I GET THE RUN AROUND, NOBODY HAS ANY ANSWERS, NO TRACKING NUMBERS ARE AVAILABLE, NO DATES CAN BE CONFIRMED, NO CALLBACK EVER HAPPENS EVEN THOUGH I HAVE BEEN TOLD EVERYTIME THAT I WILL BE CONTACTED! NO MANAGERS TAKE PHONE CALLS OR ACKNOWLEDGE THAT THEY ARE MANAGERS BECAUSE I BELIEVE THIS IS A CALL CENTER OPERATED OUT OF A GARAGE! AND IT CAN BE SUMMED UP THAT NOBODY CARES OVER THERE! I OWN A "55 INCH LG LED THAT IS NOW 2 YEARS OLD AND FUNCTIONS LIKE A DREAM! I PAID $1500.00 FROM AMAZON AND IT'S BEEN PERFECT. I ALSO OWN A "36 VIZIO THAT I PAID $500.00 IN MY BEDROOM THAT IS 2 1/2 YEARS OLD WITH NO ISSUES EITHER. I THOUGHT THIS MAY BE A GOOD CHOICE AS A SPARE TV BECAUSE I READ THE REVIEWS AND THEY WERE DECENT (4 STARS) WHEN THE TV WORKED, IT WAS A GOOD TV, BUT IF IT BURNS OUT AFTER 100 HRS OF USE, ITS A PIECE IF CRAP! YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR. AND IF IT BREAKS, YOU MIGHT AS WELL THROW THE MONEY IN THE TOILET! IF YOU WANT A GOOD TV THAT DOESN'T COST A LOT THEN GO TO WAL-MART AND GET A VIZIO ***************************************DO NOT BUY!!!!!!!!!*******************************************

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Deal, but lets cut to the chase
Reviews.Author: P. Meldrum
Reviews.Content: First off, you cannot beat this deal.  The picture is excellent for this price, but good overall.  This TV can't compete with my 4 year old 60hz Samsung, but I don't expect it to at this price.  Would I be ok with it as my main TV, yes, but I would get a better TV.I looked to see if the TV had a Samsung LCD panel and all I can say is that a part says Samsung, although I could not say if it is the lcd panel or just another part.The picture does take a lot of adjusting to make it good, but in my experience that is normal for all tv's.The sound is ok.  I definitely want a soundbar or home theater system but it is acceptable. However I will say that it is pretty good considering how bad the build in speakers tend to be these days as the tv's get thinner.All in all I am very happy with my purchase, but if I watched TV on it a lot, I would opt for a higher end model. Also it will not win any beauty contests but it is not ugly either.  It is definitely much more bulky looking than todays LED TV's but it is not bad looking either.

Reviews.Author: PiginPooh
Reviews.Content: Overall I'm not upset. The automatic ratio does seem to create a very nice image. Good audio options. It doesn't get as hot as my previous TV. And it looks nice on my shelf(even though my previous wall mount was rated to fit that size tv, it couldn't  align w this model tv). The dissappointing aspects are it takes too long to turn on; equal to the time it takes to change inputs. The screen pixelates too much. There is no manual. The inputs seem straight forward but either is configured incorrectly or just broken. For example, I tried  to attach a multi pin  cable from my comp to the back of the tv...darkness. ! I'd rate the TV a 2 1/2 - 3 star. But I wouldn't use it for target practise at least not yet.

Reviews.Title: Not a good deal--even when the price is amazing
Reviews.Author: Creative Shopper "Creative Shopper on Amazon ...
Reviews.Content: I was so exited when I saw this television available on a lightening deal right before Christmas. A forty inch television for $260.00 was a great deal, so I scooped it up.  I was familiar with the reviews on the brand since I had already purchased a smaller one as a Christmas gift.  Set up was somewhat cumbersome due to the fact that these televisions seem to have an issue with the screws in the stand.  I was able to enjoy the television for about 10 days when, all of a sudden, it had no picture.  I could pick up audio but the screen was blank which meant you couldn't navigate either.  I called the company and was redirected to the "second level" where I was told that I needed to repackage the television and send it back to Amazon since I was still within my thirty days of purchase. Apparently, there was a problem with the motherboard.  I appreciate the ability to return the item, but, frankly, having to repackage a 40 inch television was an annoyance I could have done without.  I made the decision to get a refund rather than a replacement because I just don't have much faith in this company anymore.  Also, we had issues with the smaller television and its stand.  (This company needs to do some major work on its stands and the screws.) Although I called about the smaller television and the fact that the stand does not fit properly, I have yet to hear back. . . still waiting.As far as a review of the television during the period of time it actually worked, I would say that it was an okay television--nothing particularly great.  I guess for a cheap price, it was adequate.  I would not purchase another one regardless of the price.

Reviews.Title: First impression -- I LIKE IT
Reviews.Author: JLD "JLD"
Reviews.Content: First off, I am a female who is not really all that into TVs but I am technically capable. I know what an HDMI cable is and how to troubleshoot most issues I run into. I cannot comment on how this TV compares to all the other high level brands.  I bought it because of the price, size and options it has.  When it comes to TVs, I am not a high end girl.  I just finished unpacking and setting up my TV, cable remote programmed and all.  It was a snap.  It took me (all by myself) less than an hour to complete, from opening the box to sitting down to write this review.  Keeping in mind, I am a girl so I read the directions.  Also, I did find other reviews very helpful, especially the remote codes that one reviewer (thank you very much) supplied.  Using their advice, I picked the most common RCA code (1000) for ATT cable and it worked.  Just remember, you need to make sure the AT&T; button is reselected on the remote or some weird things may happen.  Like, when I did the guide button, I got the TV guide even though other options were working fine with the remote/TV.  I do have some concerns with quality but like my friend said, with TVs, if they work for the first 90 day you are usually pretty good to go.  If I do have any issues with support, quality or service, I will update this posting.  As for picture and sound quality, looks and sounds good to me.  Much better than the one it is replacing.  This is the biggest TV I have ever owned and that is an adjustment.  Also, the size and picture quality are doing to push me to buy a new DVD player.  Kinda want to see a digital movie on my new TV now.

Reviews.Title: Unusual Response as Computer Monitor
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: TCL L40FHDF12TA 40-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LCD HDTV with 2-Year WarrantyBought this primarily as an oversized computer monitor. I plugged my Mac into the HDMI2 receptor and the monitor worked fine for the first few hours. Next morning HDMI2 was not available as an "Input" and no monitor available. I restarted everything, still no HDMI2. I changed the input to VGA coming from the same computer. No response from the monitor. The I plugged the VGA connection into another working monitor and all was well (ie - nothing wrong with the signal from the computer - the problem lies with the TLC HDTV). Will return later today. Rarely do I have to return products to Amazon, but when I do, the return policy of Amazon is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Review with remote code solution
Reviews.Author: B. Lancaster
Reviews.Content: Revised review 03/03/2012 with ideal settingsThe code that worked for me with my programmable remote was to use an RCA television code: 11781.  (Other RCA codes that may work are 12002, 12187, 12247, or 12234)Ideal settings from CNET.com:Picture Settings menuPicture Preset: PersonalBrightness: 68Contrast: 62Sharpness: 50--Expert settings menuBacklight: 19Color: 46Tint: 0Color temp: 2--Advanced Settings menuLight sensor: OffDynamic backlight: OffNoise reduction: LowSABC: OffI'll keep this shorter than the previous review.The first TV arrived DOA, Amazon sent me a new one overnight with no hassle.  If you're concerned about the dead on arrival issue, don't fret, Amazon's got your back!Picture quality:  Excellent. We watched Terrence Malick's "The New World" last night and the detail and color depth were stunning.  If you love watching movies, getting this TV is a no brainer.Inputs: Very generous.  It has three HDMI inputs, two component inputs, and a VGA input for computers.  For comparison, my dad's $2500 Samsung LCD only has one HDMI input!Design: Understated, but certainly not ugly, as other commentators have shared.  The speaker grill cover is a nice accent, and the glass base is very substantial; no worries about it toppling over.Setup: Easy.  The first thing the TV does is go through the setup options which makes it easy.  The color management options are very detailed, and run on a 0-100 scale which allows for a lot of fine-tuning.The code that worked for me with my programmable remote was to use an RCA television code: 11781.  (Other RCA codes that may work are 12002, 12187, 12247, or 12234)Cons:Only a few, which is remarkable for a low-cost TV.1.  The first TV that arrived didn't work.  As mentioned, Amazon took care of it, no problem.2.  Light bleeding in the top corners.  Only noticeable on letter box movies when watching at nigh time.  Can be drastically reduced by turning off the "Light Sensor" and "Dynamic Backlighting" options in the advanced menu.3.  The remote has buttons that are difficult to press.  They can get stuck in place when pressed.  Not a problem for me though I'm using my universal remote from my Insignia amplifier.4.  The screws that go into the bottom of the glass plate are difficult to screw in, I almost stripped one of them by trying to muscle it in, which would have been very bad!Overall a great TV at a great price.  Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for - poor picture
Reviews.Author: cnf
Reviews.Content: I picked this TV up for 299.99 for Black Friday.  In fairness, I got the Wal-Mart version which appears to be exactly the same as this television listed here, with nearly the same model number (L40FHDM12) - my understanding is the slight variance is that Wal-Mart orders large enough batches to deserve their own #.  I'm reviewing it here because the listing is not maintained on Wal-Mart's website (as it was a temporary special) and I also relied on Amazon's reviews in making my purchasing decision.The Good:*Connections - Amount of connections are good, several HDMIs, AVs, Component, a VGA connection as well as USB connection.  All of them worked well except for the USB, which is largely useless as it has a very small range of file types it will read.  Basically, you can look at .JPGs with it (and about two other file types) but that's it.  I tried a few videos and other files, no luck.*Sound - Reasonable for built in speakers.  I have no complaints.  If you want to shake the floor you'll need something more substantial, but the speakers are good for casual tv/movie watching.*Settings - There are a wide range of settings on the TV.  Only complaint here is that you can't change the actual individual color settings (i.e. red only).*Picture - This goes good and bad.  The good is the picture is quite crisp.  The HD does not disappoint.The Bad:My one complaint - the complaint that killed the deal for me - is this-THE PICTURE COLOR - The picture color on the televisionS (yes, multiple) are awful.  The crispness is fantastic but the colors look drab.  Everything looks like it was shot on a rainy day.  To compensate for this I tried upping the color, contrast, brightness, etc.  What I wound up with then was a horribly contrasted overbrightened (blacks look high gray) picture, still with bad color.  And believe me, I tried.  I used calibration images, everything.  I tried it with regular DVDs, Blu-Rays, hooking up a computer, streaming video, you name it.  Using a calibration disc to make sure contrast and brightness were correct resulted in the colors being extremely drab.  No manner of shifting settings would work.  For instance, at no point did any of the greens ever look normal.  And the presets that came with the TV (i.e. cinema) all looked universally dark and drab.  Playing video games was hard as well, for instance the gun in Call of Duty looked about 90% like a black blob with no definition.After reading reviews here and at Wal-Mart (mostly good) I figured the TV I bought was defective so I got a replacement set.  It looked *exactly* the same - I ran them side by side, same scene, same movie, at the same time.  Awful color.My conclusion is it would be an ok set to throw in a guest bedroom but in my experience using it for day-to-day viewing would be distracting.  And I suppose if one was upgrading from a 27" tube TV it may look good in comparison to that based simply on the crispness.  $300 for a 40" TV is ridiculously low price but I figured I would try it.  I don't expect above-and-beyond from something that cheap, but a decent picture is a must.

Reviews.Title: Customer Service is Terrible
Reviews.Author: Paula Carli
Reviews.Content: We purchased the TCL 32 inch TV a year ago, have the 2 year warranty and our receipt.  The TV was great for a period of time but started having 3" white bright lines at the top and bottom and flashing back and forth.  Then the remote stopped working even after changing batteries several times.  We contacted the main number and just as the previous person stated, we went thru the routine of unplugging, plugging it back in and then referred to "level 2".  After calling 2 days in a row with busy signals, we got thru to level 2 and were disconnected.  Then a call back to an actual person resulted in that we were to fax our copy of our receipt and someone would call.  5 days later no person has called us back.  We are disgusted with this TCL product and the service is horrible.  Even though we did pay more than the $300 price that this TV is now, it is only a year old.  I would not recommend anyone to purchase it if you expect to get any decent service.  Any communication or acknowledgement that they got the fax or what we are expected to do with the broken TV would have been appreciated-terrible service company.

Reviews.Title: Terrible TV
Reviews.Author: M. Xu
Reviews.Content: Do not buy! The color is terrible. And also, I guarantee you will not like the remote: you hit any button once, the TV will response twice.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy!!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was so excited I thought wow this is a great deal!!! Only to find out it wasn't, do not be fooled by the good reviews you see on Amazon. When I got the television set up it would not even turn on. Needless to say I took advantage of Amazons 30 day return policy. I don't even know why Amazon is still carrying the product. When I went back and did further research I found more reviews that I wished I had seen prior to making this purchase. At least Amazon took it back with no questions they took me at my word when I said it would not power on.  I hope this review saves someone else the aggravation and headache I went through.

Reviews.Title: Wow!! TLC Support ... TV stand (the glass plate) is not a part of TV, not covered under warranty?? Amazing... gotta hate this
Reviews.Author: Sree
Reviews.Content: Wow!!! Wow!!!! Wow!!!! Dear TCL, where are you living in this capitol economy.. you want to compete with the existing gaints in the market in electronics in USA? Re-consider your customer support policies and warranty policies..I have purchased this TV on 12/23 and received it last night, when I opened it, the GLASS PLATE (to which the TV needs to be attached to keep it standing) was damaged.Called the TLC support number, waited for 30 minutes to have someone to pick up the call. They took all my details etc and asked me to contact the secondary support line (1-877-470-7766 9AM to 6PM Pacific Time, Monday To Friday).When I called the gentleman at that number advised me to RETURN the TV to the store. When I told him that I have purchased it from Amazon and its a huge TV to take it back to the shipping etc, just checking if I can get a replacement of this item from the TCL as a manufacturer. He has replied that they doesnt have any such parts. This item is not covered under the warranty since this is an accessory (Wow!! Wow!!! Wow!!! the standing flat plate is only the part of the TV which keeps it standing to use.. but its an accessory .. give me a break.. your legs are not accessory that the God gave you, its a part of your body dear TCL).Now I am turned down to get this SIMPLE item replaced for a less than 24 hours old TV. Imagine what would be the REAL WARRANTY and real SUPPORT for TWO years.. it sounds like a big time SCAM...TCL, please correct me if I am missing something here...Other buyers.. please dont fall for 2 years warranty.. think twice..

Reviews.Title: No power out of the box
Reviews.Author: Ben DeNoble
Reviews.Content: It arrived today, the TV that would not turn on.  I didn't even get the blue light that other people are talking about.  The only good thing I can say is that the box looked nice.  Amazon is sending a new one, hope I have better luck with that one. It would be a good idea to turn the tv on before you spend your time hooking everything up to it.

Reviews.Title: minus 5 stars TCL TV destroyed Christmas fun!
Reviews.Author: Bob R.
Reviews.Content: This product has a history of mutiple defects . Including poor technical,support and a history of firmware repairs expected by the customers by requiring  customer download of firmware with a thumb drive (with knowledge how to use it). This is clearly a plan to shove it out the door  without adequate testing and having the customer repair their mistakes IF They know how. I am a electronic engineer and this sort of product developement by Chinese designed products remind me why we should buy American products or at least Japanese because of quality controls and skill level of design and manufacturing qualty control  .

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY Breaks within 6 months!!
Reviews.Author: CR
Reviews.Content: Warning - do not buy this!  Seems awesome at first until it start turning on and off by itself!  Was under warantee so Westinghouse had us send it directly to them and WE had to pay the $85 Fedex shipping.  Took over 3 weeks and they said they replaced it.  Worked for 2 1/2 months and guess what....SAME thing is happening.  They want us to ship it back and WE pay for it again. NEVER AGAIN will I buy Westinghouse!

Reviews.Title: Amazon would not honer Lower Price Match
Reviews.Author: Arnold McGee
Reviews.Content: Ordered this TV on 12-22-11 for $319.99 and 2 days later it was on sale for $259.00!!! $60.00 drop! Called in and they said it was a special sale and my Price Match guarantee was pretty much worthless. They told me they would rather I return the TV that give the $60.00 back!!! After reading the reviews on this TV I decided I would be return it. 19 -5 stars with 11-1 star. Not very good. Some people said they were having trouble getting TCL Customer Service. 2 year warranty means nothing if they go out of business or don't answer their calls! I would get the extended warranty from Square Trade on this TV.  Never had trouble with Amazon before. They said many people were calling in and complaining. On a few chat boards a few people were getting their $60.00 back while others were told to shove off. If you don't want to price match on TVs amazon, just take the option off your site. Don't promise something then fall back on your many exceptions to the rule!
